subject: *Become a PeerHub Student Coordinator ‚Äì Apply Now!*
snippet: Dear Students, We're thrilled to announce an exciting opportunity for you ‚Äî PeerHub is hiring a *Student Coordinator* from your campus! If you're enthusiastic, socially active, and enjoy
content:
Dear Students,

We‚Äôre thrilled to announce an exciting opportunity for you ‚Äî PeerHub is
hiring a *Student Coordinator* from your campus! If you're enthusiastic,
socially active, and enjoy networking, this role is tailor-made for you.

üåü Role & Responsibilities:
As a PeerHub Student Coordinator, you will:

Engage fellow students and drive participation in PeerHub events.

Promote PeerHub Fellowship activities on your campus.

Serve as a Brand Ambassador for PeerHub.

üéÅ *Perks & Benefits:*

*Internship Certificate*

*Letter of Recommendation (LOR)*

*Pre-Placement Offer (PPO) for top performers*

*Performance-based stipend up to ‚Çπ20,000/month*

This is more than just an internship ‚Äî it‚Äôs a unique chance to grow your
professional network, boost your resume, and gain hands-on experience.

üëâ Apply now: https://forms.gle/RRHavkqAiGS6QRxMA
üìÖ Applications are open for a limited time ‚Äî don‚Äôt miss out!





*Thanks & RegardsPankaj ChaurasiaGrowth & Marketing Manager*

subject: Accenture Initiative for CHARUSAT Students ‚Äì Internship & Placement Assurance Program 2025
snippet: . Dear Student, Accenture, in collaboration with leading education partners, is extending participation in the Verified Internship and Placement Assurance Program 2025 to eligible students of Charotar
content:
I've invited you to fill out the following form:
Summer Internship by Accenture: Apply for the 2k25 Internship Program

To fill it out, visit:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfOI5NpjTjq-Ovm8bkQOAsck67jKea5A4ZEm82__5iHwY0gHw/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1&flr=0&usp=mail_form_link

Dear Student,

Accenture, in collaboration with leading education partners, is extending  
participation in the Verified Internship and Placement Assurance Program  
2025 to eligible students of Charotar University of Science and Technology  
(CHARUSAT). This initiative is tailored to enhance career readiness through  
structured training, practical assignments, and project-based learning  
guided by professionals from relevant domains.

The program provides a focused pathway for students to strengthen their  
profiles through resume-building support, interview preparation, and  
exposure to industry-aligned project tasks. On successful completion,  
participants will receive verified credentials acknowledging their efforts,  
issued in association with the program‚Äôs professional mentors and academic  
collaborators.

If you‚Äôve already shared your interest or submitted your details, no  
further steps are needed. Otherwise, if you‚Äôd like to learn more or  
participate, you are encouraged to respond to this message by 28th June  
2025. We welcome your interest in engaging with this career-oriented  
learning opportunity.

Sincerely,
Program Coordination Team
Accenture Verified Internship and Placement Assurance Program 2025

subject: Thank You for Your Willingness to Contribute!
snippet: Dear Students, Thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project. We truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness of our academic email classification
content:
Dear Students,

Thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project. We
truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness of
our academic email classification model.

As promised, your data will be used *strictly for academic purposes*, and *only
informational emails* will be processed. Your contribution will also be
acknowledged in our final presentation/report.

To make the process simple, we‚Äôve prepared a Google Drive folder containing:

   -

   A script that will extract only academic emails from your inbox

üìÇ Folder link:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PbOQD_oKgAsZ9pWPrY62nWme5xyJr6JD?usp=sharing


üì§ Once the extraction is done, please upload your output here:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1NNd3t-VRDvEbDpGLDJOCsyBMA1t19Pdz?usp=sharing
------------------------------

‚ö†Ô∏è *Important:*
To make the process smoother and more efficient, we‚Äôll be conducting the *email
extraction together over a single Google Meet session*. This will help save
time and allow us to *assist you in real time* with any issues or doubts
you may have during the process.


link meeting:

www.meet.google.com/qqm-yenq-mbe

If you have any questions, feel free to reach out ‚Äî we‚Äôre more than happy
to help!

Once again, thank you for contributing to this student-led research
project. Your support means a lot to us!

Warm regards,
*Vansh Malani ‚Äì 23DCS056*
*James Dhandhukiya ‚Äì 23DCS023*
*Jugvi Desai ‚Äì 23DCS021*

subject: Anti Drug Online Pledge 2025
snippet: Dear Students You are aware that CHARUSAT has established an Anti drug committee for the prevention/prohibition of use of Anti-Drug and Alcohol in and around the campus . Today, 26th June is celebrated
content:
Dear Students

You are aware that CHARUSAT has established an Anti drug committee for the
prevention/prohibition of use of Anti-Drug and Alcohol in and around the
campus . *Today, 26th June is celebrated as International Day against
Drug Abuse.*

All the CSPIT students are requested to take an online pledge by CLICKING
HERE <http://cbn.nic.in/en/pledge/>, and download the pledge certificate.

Submit a copy of the certificate in the GOOGLE FORM
<https://forms.gle/cF542xymiwKZ6hqo9>.

Keep the campus free from Drugs and Alcohol.

subject: Regarding Enrollment: Cyber Security Student Club
snippet: Dear All, Greetings from the Cyber Security Club! We are excited to announce the enrollment drive for the Cyber Security Club of CSPIT-CE. Students who are interested in exploring and learning new
content:
*Dear All,*

*Greetings from the Cyber Security Club!*

We are excited to announce the enrollment drive for the *Cyber Security
Club of CSPIT-CE.* Students who are interested in exploring and learning
new concepts in the field of cybersecurity are welcome to join.

To view the detailed session schedule, please visit our *Page
<https://sites.google.com/charusat.ac.in/cspitce/club-chapters/cyber-security-club?authuser=0>*
.

*Interested students can register using the link below: *

*Register <https://forms.gle/n5CQdPYckMagfgdT7>*

*Note:* The maximum club strength is limited to 30 members, including 2
coordinators. You are requested to register as per your interest *on or
before 28th June, 2025*.

*Activities planned for this semester include:*

   -

   Introductory learning sessions starting from the *first week of July*
   -

   Student-led sessions
   -

   Interactive sessions with alumni
   -

   A one-day hackathon (tentative)
   -

   Internship opportunities

All activities will be conducted *on Saturdays or during free slots*, as
available.

If you're eager to learn, explore, and take initiative, we encourage you to
join us!

Regards.
--

*Martin K Parmar,*

Assistant Professor,
U & PU. Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT),

At. & Post Changa-388421, Ta: Petlad, Dist:Anand, (Gujarat) India.

https://www.linkedin.com/in/martinparmar/

Mob: +91 8488065457

--

subject: Re: Announcement: New IEEE CHARUSAT SB Positions are now open for 2025-26
snippet: A gentle reminder to those who are interested to fill in for positions in the student branch. Please note that 30th june is the last date, so complete the procedure as soon as possible. On Mon, 16 Jun
content:
A gentle reminder to those who are interested to fill in for positions in
the student branch. Please note that 30th june is the last date, so
complete the procedure as soon as possible.

On Mon, 16 Jun 2025 at 12:56, IEEE CHARUSAT SB <
ieee.charusatsb@charusat.edu.in> wrote:

> üì¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members ‚Äì
> 2025-26
>
> Dear *CHARUSAT Students*,
>
> We‚Äôre thrilled to announce that applications for the *IEEE CHARUSAT
> Student Branch Executive Committee* and its chapter positions are now
> *open* for the academic year *2025-26*!
>
> This is your chance to be part of an empowering platform that nurtures *technical
> expertise*, *professional growth*, and *global networking*.
> ------------------------------
> üîé What is IEEE?
>
> IEEE is the world‚Äôs largest technical professional organization dedicated
> to advancing technology. Student branches offer a space for innovation,
> collaboration, and leadership across engineering domains.
> üí° Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?
>
>    - *Enhance Your Resume:* Engage in projects, workshops, and events in
>    domains like AI, Robotics, VLSI, Signal Processing, and more.
>    - *Global Networking:* Connect with professionals, mentors, and
>    students around the world.
>    - *Leadership Roles:* Lead initiatives and build real-world leadership
>    and teamwork skills.
>    - *Exclusive Opportunities:* Participate in events like IEEE Xtreme
>    and international conferences.
>    - *Access Resources:* Utilize tools like the IEEE Xplore Digital
>    Library to stay ahead in your field.
>
> üîó Student Membership Benefits
> <https://www.ieee.org/membership/students/index.html>
> üîó General IEEE Membership Benefits
> <https://www.ieee.org/membership/index.html>
> üß© Available Branches
>
>    1. Main Executive Committee
>    2. Computer Science (CS) Society
>    3. Women In Engineering (WiE) Affinity Group
>    4. Antenna and Propagation Society (APS)
>
> üìå Positions Available
>
>    - Chairperson
>    - Vice-Chairperson
>    - Secretary
>    - Treasurer
>    - Web Master
>
> Each position involves managing academic and extracurricular activities,
> promoting IEEE‚Äôs mission, and encouraging participation within the student
> community.
> üìù How to Apply
>
> Please fill out the Google Form below and note that the last date is *30th
> June, 2025*. The selection process includes evaluation of your responses
> and an interview later on.
>
> üìã Apply Now
> <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdRjH7KzS5k-HnAYka2T6sf1-Z1Jy9r5lmYifWWcA86FMKLtg/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=102851502240872653276>
>
> We look forward to welcoming passionate student leaders into our IEEE
> community!
>
>

subject: Re: Books Available in Department Library
snippet: Dear Students, I hope you're all excited as the new semester begins today! As you embark on this academic journey, I wanted to share some valuable resources available in our department library that
content:
Dear Students,

I hope you‚Äôre all excited as the new semester begins today! As you embark
on this academic journey, I wanted to share some valuable resources
available in our department library that will help you excel in your
studies.

To aid in your understanding and deepen your knowledge, I highly recommend
exploring the books available for your respective subjects. These resources
are specifically chosen to support your coursework and provide additional
insights into the concepts you're studying.

You can view the full list of available books in our department library by
following this link:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1E0NOvlJup5y729t-GegJxFomChOuSiv6ZP_2XCa1RAI/edit?usp=sharing

I encourage you to make the most of these resources throughout the
semester, and I wish you all a successful and rewarding academic experience!

On Thu, Jan 2, 2025 at 3:39‚ÄØPM Krunal Maheriya <
krunalmaheriya.ce@charusat.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> As your new semester has begun or is about to begin, I would like to share
> some book recommendations available in our department library that you can
> refer to for your subjects. These resources will assist you in
> understanding the concepts and excelling in your studies.
>
> *OOPC:* *Object-Oriented Programming Using C++* by Harish G. Narula
> *DBMS:* *Database System Concepts* by Abraham Silberschatz
> *CNS:** Cryptography and Network Security *by William Stallings
> *Compiler Design:* *Principles of Compiler Design *by Alfred V. Aho
> *Cloud Computing:* *Distributed System *by Andrew S. Tanenbaum
> *Machine Learning:* *Introduction to Artificial Intelligence *by Eugene
> Charniak
>
> I encourage you to explore these books, as they will provide comprehensive
> insights and practical knowledge for your respective subjects. You can
> access the complete list of available books in our library through the
> following link:
> https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1E0NOvlJup5y729t-GegJxFomChOuSiv6ZP_2XCa1RAI/edit?usp=sharing
>
> On Thu, Dec 5, 2024 at 1:27‚ÄØPM Krunal Maheriya <
> krunalmaheriya.ce@charusat.ac.in> wrote:
>
>> Dear Students,
>>
>> We are pleased to inform you that new books have been added to the
>> department library. You can explore the list of newly added titles through
>> the link below:
>>
>> Link for the document:
>> https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/163dIhxWwQ8-6ipwZApX6SEuo7FQZ56pwVU57q_IB4fc/edit?usp=sharing
>>
>> Feel free to visit the library and make the most of these resources!
>> --
>> Thanks & Regards
>> *Krunal Maheriya*
>> Assistant Professor,
>> U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
>> Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
>> CHARUSAT, Changa, Anand-388421.
>> https://www.charusat.ac.in/ <https://charusat.ac.in/>
>>
>
>
> --
> Thanks & Regards
> *Krunal Maheriya*
> Assistant Professor,
> U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
> Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
> CHARUSAT, Changa, Anand-388421.
> https://www.charusat.ac.in/ <https://charusat.ac.in/>
>


-- 
Thanks & Regards
*Krunal Maheriya*
Assistant Professor,
U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT, Changa, Anand-388421.

subject: WWT All India Women Only Hackathon 2025 Prep Session Recording: ‚ÄúHow to Win a Hackathon"
snippet: Dear Participants, Thank you for joining the pre-hackathon masterclass "How to Win a Hackathon" scheduled on Friday, 20th June 2025 from 5:30 - 6.30 PM IST. Those who missed the session
content:
Dear Participants,

Thank you for joining the pre-hackathon masterclass "How to Win a
Hackathon" scheduled on Friday, 20th June 2025 from 5:30 - 6.30 PM IST.

Those who missed the session please see access the recording here

<https://sstarsfoundation-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2NIqzXCQt6CnzcbdnUPQ5dpxa7oRJE7sXFaaxUqWQjjpHK26SlwFNSeJr8cBile3Nheg4yMwpPljgP6alxCF2L2B75HQ5X_kr8ttDy1wUuYR8HL9uzQAjuF5hiNA-nrceeWpcH5leogPKGKc_VzvY3EMbU1T3CVMegK_qadaPvMJenALJLhMSfnAybigleeYTUrFRAipTuXyB5NavrtGcDQEVTqrdecOzfJ5BgVe2Np053v-z51M>

Here are some highlights from the session along with the PPT presented
<https://sstarsfoundation-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2F5nyjfROJX6SkXdpoH-SpPQaOWzpgRCmizWy7HhLvClJK26SlwHJjWX9tf8I4MMDikpxF-12vVmvBL3zRBpCTigJT5QJ4criuT1Ivb4a37K2MXKssFet-sF28-VI82OxlcQVKUsoVUT8TjHuO3Inr-fX9RdiLvOtcAlPw3joA2ymFx2VG3RX9F0mEGsh4hxK8B57BDN8xpBpGy1KfjCwGq6pArFdbcQYsbAW8KvkgXEI0fzb5yPNzS8e08jlZ3Njz46cmd7fNFd2W3SQ79SCX5WppPurcfXiCZwuXv7s_czvHCfKMgIIT28q40RtbOs>

- Gain comprehensive knowledge about hackathons, from understanding the
concept to unlocking the secrets of winning strategies.

- Learn how to build impactful AI solutions that align with the theme:
‚ÄúAI for Financial Inclusion of Women‚Äù.

- Discover how to work effectively in teams, pitch your ideas, and stand
out in evaluations.
- Get inspired by stories from past winners and boost your confidence
before the big day!

- Raffle Prizes for Attendance

We look forward to witnessing your incredible talent in action.

Please see the lucky 10 raffle winners from the session. We will reach out
to you post the hackathon.

Pushpam Kumari

Mary Lohita Swarup Reddy Gade

Ananya K R

Priyanshi

Keerthi N Puranik

Aruna Arunachalam

SASMITA PANGULUR

M. Sowmya

Prathiba G

Chandrini Chandrasekaran Kalaivanan

Best regards,

Shooting Stars Foundation.

subject: Fwd: Emerging Research Trends in Engineering (ERTE 2025)
snippet: Dear Friends, IEEE Gujarat Section, along with Kadi Sarva Vishwavidyalaya and IEEE KSV SB, is organizing a 2-day event ‚ÄúEmerging Research Trends in Engineering (ERTE 2025)‚Äù on July 26‚Äì27, 2025. The
content:
Dear Friends,

IEEE Gujarat Section, along with Kadi Sarva Vishwavidyalaya and IEEE KSV
SB, is organizing a 2-day event *‚ÄúEmerging Research Trends in Engineering
(ERTE 2025)‚Äù* on *July 26‚Äì27, 2025*. The theme is *AI for Smart Cities and
Industry 4.0*.

Interested students can find more details in the forwarded mail below.
Regards,
Dhruv Rupapara

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IEEE eNotice <enotice@enotice.ieee.org>
Date: Tue, Jun 3, 2025 at 5:26‚ÄØPM
Subject: Emerging Research Trends in Engineering (ERTE 2025)
To: <dhruvrupapara@ieee.org>


If you are having trouble reading this message, click here
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=ND6C_G_4XR7QwsC0DN1gvYOvZ57b8ruOGT492fDy5UinE7tL911ili6B-6NrwdnFxyyA1OBe0eeYBZxh9tjRKA~~&t=CNwiJ1nlky-5HZTdButDjA~~>
for the web version.

Dear all,

It is our pleasure to inform you that IEEE Gujarat Section, along with Kadi
Sarva Vishwavidyalaya, Gandhinagar, IEEE KSV SB is organizing a 2-day event
on "*Emerging Research Trends in Engineering (ERTE 2025)*" during *July
26-27, 2025.  *The event aims to provide an insight into industrial
practices, current research areas, and trends in the field of *"AI for
Smart Cities and Industry 4.0."* The event is supported by IEEE SPS, IEEE
CS, IEEE IES/IAS/PELS, and the IEEE PES chapter of the IEEE Gujarat
Section.

*Following are distinguished speakers of the event*

¬∑        Mr. Samir Bhatt, E-Infochip, Ahmedabad.

¬∑        Mr. Jugal Oza, E-infochip, Ahmedabad

¬∑        Dr. Mahipal Jadeja, MNIT, Jaipur

¬∑        Dr. Sudeep Tanwar, Nirma University, Ahmedabad

¬∑        Mr. Sohil Patel, Oizom Instruments Pvt Ltd, Ahmedabad

¬∑        Mr. Naveen Gupta, Deets Digital, Ahmedabad

¬∑        Mr. Vicrumnaug Vuppalaty, Fiscal Ox Cloud Pvt Ltd, Vadodara.



*Registration link:*  https://forms.gle/xbNDCXLbJk1zx4Y56
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=-hjM3BbMnc2OcId_rF5ruRICpNteDrR8xlQIK6vV9k7-mvVHi8DpnetQdYkm8Cyfdw6GyuUtVR0aTP5nS0_39g~~&t=CNwiJ1nlky-5HZTdButDjA~~>

Website: https://ieeegujaratsection.org/erte-2025/
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=KqgBIsIwhMGgkP3p3F95_FjCDyeN-Bh5wevi0Lu0H0xsK3f0XlSc4k8WesNQ8i5XxTfKi9CT_hGBPmWZ8F2u6w~~&t=CNwiJ1nlky-5HZTdButDjA~~>

   - *Fees for participation:*
      - IEEE Student Member: Rs. 400/-
      - Non-IEEE Student Member: Rs. 700/-
      - IEEE Professional Member: Rs. 700/-
      - Non-IEEE Professional Member: Rs. 1000/-



   - *Venue:* Kadi Sarva Vishwavidyalaya, LDRP-ITR Campus, Sector 15,
   Gandhinagar.

On behalf of the IEEE Gujarat Section and Kadi Sarva Vishwavidyalaya, we
invite you to attend this event at *Gandhinagar*. Please find attached
herewith the flyer of the event.

Further, you are also requested to share this mail in your network and
among eligible audiences.

Regards

On behalf of Organizing Committee

ERTE 2025

IEEE Gujarat Section
------------------------------
Attachments:
ERTE CFP 2025
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=9DwJe9fePPfZHI2I1YMGEVWJMeVyzpky10D8dfJ_1FNqVcNFC6wZmOHPxA9YZ0VADwBrVrBt4Ukr2rs8_SvOEA~~&t=CNwiJ1nlky-5HZTdButDjA~~>
Gujarat Section : http://ieeegujaratsection.org/

*Warm regards,*
*Dhruv Rupapara*

subject: Commencement of ODD Semester 2025‚Äì26 and Important Guidelines
snippet: Dear Students, I hope this email finds you well. The ODD semester for the Academic Year 2025‚Äì26 will commence on June 23, 2025. Please refer to the attached academic calendar for important dates and
content:
Dear Students,

I hope this email finds you well.

The *ODD semester for the Academic Year 2025‚Äì26* will commence on *June 23,
2025*. Please refer to the attached academic calendar for important dates
and schedules.

Kindly take note of the following rules, which will be strictly enforced
throughout the semester:

¬∑         A *minimum of 75% overall attendance* and *70% attendance in each
course* (theory and practical) is mandatory to be eligible for the
examinations.

¬∑         There should be *no pending disciplinary action* against you.

¬∑         *Academic fees *must be paid.

Attendance will be strictly monitored from the first day of the semester.
Manage your schedule carefully to fulfil attendance criteria.

Wishing you a great start and a successful semester ahead!

All the best

-- 
Thanking You

Dr. Nikita Bhatt, Ph.D.
Head of Department, CE,
Accredited Grade 'A+' by NAAC
Contact Number: 02697-265353

subject: Invitation to Participate in Online Quiz on 11th International Day of Yoga ‚Äì Organized by NSS-PDPIAS Unit
snippet: Dear All, Warm Greetings! On the occasion of the 11th International Day of Yoga, the NSS Unit of PDPIAS is organising an Online Quiz to spread awareness about the ancient Indian practice of Yoga and
content:
Dear All,

Warm Greetings!

On the occasion of the *11th International Day of Yoga*, the *NSS Unit of
PDPIAS* is organising an *Online Quiz* to spread awareness about the
ancient Indian practice of Yoga and its significance in our daily lives.

We invite all students, faculties, staff and CHARUSAT family members to
participate in this engaging and informative quiz enthusiastically.

*Date:* 17th June 2025
*Mode:* Online
*Quiz Link:* https://forms.gle/Pvc3gGbRbmEGZC6k6
*Time: *10:00 AM to 03:00 PM

*E-certificates* will be provided to all participants on or before June 19,
2025, via email.

The quiz aims to promote the importance of Yoga for physical and mental
well-being and to honour the spirit of this global celebration.

Let us come together and celebrate *Yoga for harmony and peace*.

For any queries, please contact: Dr. Rajesh V. Savalia, M. 94292 22899

-- 
Thanks & Regards,

--

subject: Announcement: New IEEE CHARUSAT SB Positions are now open for 2025-26
snippet: üì¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members ‚Äì 2025-26 Dear CHARUSAT Students, We're thrilled to announce that applications for the IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Executive
content:
IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch 2025-26
üì¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members ‚Äì
2025-26

Dear *CHARUSAT Students*,

We‚Äôre thrilled to announce that applications for the *IEEE CHARUSAT Student
Branch Executive Committee* and its chapter positions are now *open* for
the academic year *2025-26*!

This is your chance to be part of an empowering platform that nurtures
*technical
expertise*, *professional growth*, and *global networking*.
------------------------------
üîé What is IEEE?

IEEE is the world‚Äôs largest technical professional organization dedicated
to advancing technology. Student branches offer a space for innovation,
collaboration, and leadership across engineering domains.
üí° Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?

   - *Enhance Your Resume:* Engage in projects, workshops, and events in
   domains like AI, Robotics, VLSI, Signal Processing, and more.
   - *Global Networking:* Connect with professionals, mentors, and students
   around the world.
   - *Leadership Roles:* Lead initiatives and build real-world leadership
   and teamwork skills.
   - *Exclusive Opportunities:* Participate in events like IEEE Xtreme and
   international conferences.
   - *Access Resources:* Utilize tools like the IEEE Xplore Digital Library
   to stay ahead in your field.

üîó Student Membership Benefits
<https://www.ieee.org/membership/students/index.html>
üîó General IEEE Membership Benefits
<https://www.ieee.org/membership/index.html>
üß© Available Branches

   1. Main Executive Committee
   2. Computer Science (CS) Society
   3. Women In Engineering (WiE) Affinity Group
   4. Antenna and Propagation Society (APS)

üìå Positions Available

   - Chairperson
   - Vice-Chairperson
   - Secretary
   - Treasurer
   - Web Master

Each position involves managing academic and extracurricular activities,
promoting IEEE‚Äôs mission, and encouraging participation within the student
community.
üìù How to Apply

Please fill out the Google Form below and note that the last date is *30th
June, 2025*. The selection process includes evaluation of your responses
and an interview later on.

üìã Apply Now
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdRjH7KzS5k-HnAYka2T6sf1-Z1Jy9r5lmYifWWcA86FMKLtg/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=102851502240872653276>

We look forward to welcoming passionate student leaders into our IEEE
community!

subject: TECHNOVA ‚Äì Second Issue of the Department Newsletter
snippet: Dear Students, We are excited to introduce the second issue of TECHNOVA, the biannual newsletter of the U & P U. Patel Department of Computer Engineering. This newsletter showcases the achievements
content:
Dear Students,

We are excited to introduce the second issue of *TECHNOVA*, the
biannual newsletter of the *U & P U. Patel Department of Computer
Engineering*. This newsletter showcases the achievements, events, and
progress of our students and faculty, reflecting our department‚Äôs growth.

A special thank you to our editorial team Prachi Desai (22CE025), Jay
Khetani (23CE057), Satyam Charola (22CE016) along with mentor Dr. Sneha
Padhiar for their hard work in compiling and designing this edition.

The growth of any department or institute is driven by the *hard work,
dedication, and sincerity* of its students. We sincerely appreciate each
one of you for your contributions to our department‚Äôs progress.

*Together, we grow and achieve more!*

We look forward to your continued support and cooperation in the future.

Kindly find the attached Newsletter along with the flipbook link.

*Flipbook Link: -*TechNova - Vol 1 - Issue - 2
<https://heyzine.com/flip-book/77d7b79e88.html>
 TechNova - Vol 1 - Issue 2 -Final Draft.pdf

subject: Invitation to participate in 11th International Yoga Day - Online Debate Competition organized by¬†IIIM¬†NSS¬†Cell
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings from IIIM NSS Cell!!! To celebrate the 11th International Yoga Day, Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management (IIIM) - NSS Cell has organized an Online Debate competition on
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings from IIIM NSS Cell!!!

To celebrate the *11th International Yoga Day,* Indukaka Ipcowala Institute
of Management (IIIM) - NSS Cell has organized an *Online Debate competition*
 on *June 20, 2025 (Friday).*



*Online Debate Competition ‚Äì Event Details:*

*Date:* June 20, 2025
*Time:* 10:30 AM Onward
*Theme:* Yoga for One Earth, One Health* (Topics to be provided one hour
prior to the scheduled start of the competition)*

*Registration Process:*
Interested participants are requested to register latest by *June 19,
2025* *till
12 PM* using the following link: https://forms.gle/Qzf1YCSnSnDxqFX68

*Online Debate Format:*
*The structure and flow of the debate will be determined based on the total
number of registered participants. Topics will be shared with participants
one hour prior to the competition.*

*Proposed Rounds:*

   1. *Preliminary Round:*
      - Each participant will speak for 3 minutes, either *for* or
*against* the
      motion.
      - Top-performing speakers from the preliminary round will advance to
      the final round.
   2. *Final Round (Crossfire & Closing Statement):*
      - A crossfire round will be conducted, where the selected
      participants will engage in a Q&A session with each other and the judges.
      - Each finalist will then present a 1-minute closing statement.

*Judging Criteria:*

   - Content & Knowledge
   - Delivery & Clarity
   - Rebuttal & Defence
   - Engagement & Time Adherence

*Certificates:*


   - Winners will be awarded 1st, 2nd, and 3rd prizes.
   - All participants will receive a Certificate of Participation.


Together let's make this International Yoga Day memorable. We look forward
to your cooperation at this extraordinary
International Yoga Day Celebration.



Please contact* IIIM NSS Coordinators: *Dr. Poonam Amrutia (+91 94295
58484); Mr. Brijesh Patel (+91 97370 23027) for further details.


*Kruten Patel*
*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

subject: üåø Invitation to Participate in Yogya 2025 ‚Äì University-Level Online Yoga Competition | International Yoga Day Celebration
snippet: Dear Faculty Members and Students, Warm greetings from the CHARUSAT NSS Cell! On the occasion of International Yoga Day 2025, we are delighted to announce ‚ÄúYOGYA 2025: The Virtual Yoga Challenge‚Äù, a
content:
*Dear Faculty Members and Students,*

Warm greetings from the CHARUSAT NSS Cell!

On the occasion of *International Yoga Day 2025*, we are delighted to
announce *‚ÄúYOGYA 2025: The Virtual Yoga Challenge‚Äù*, a university-level
online yoga competition organized by *NSS ARIP* (Ashok & Rita Patel
Institute of Physiotherapy) under the *CHARUSAT NSS Cell*, in collaboration
with the PHYSICAL EDUCATION & SPORTS SECTION.

This event is an opportunity to showcase your passion for yoga, creativity,
and mindfulness while celebrating the spirit of health and harmony.
[image: ‚ú®] Themes for Yogya 2025

   1. Yoga for the Mindful Generation
   2. Breathe In Positivity, Breathe Out Stress
   3. Stretch to Destress
   4. Unity in Diversity ‚Äì Yoga Beyond Borders
   5. Unplug to Connect: Digital Detox through Yoga

[image: üßò] Participation Guidelines

   - Submit a 1‚Äì2 minute video demonstrating 3‚Äì5 yoga asanas.
   - Choose any one theme and express it through your flow.
   - Top 10 participants will be invited to perform live in the final round via
   an online platform. (Zoom or Google Meet)
   - Entries will be judged on technique, flow, creativity, and thematic
   expression.

[image: üìÖ] Key Dates

   - Last Date for Registration & Submission: 16/06/2025
   - Final Round (Live via online platform): 19/06/2025 (Timings will be
   communicated - preferably evening around  6:00 pm)
   - Result Announcement: 20/06/2025

[image: üèÜ] Awards & Recognition

   -

   Best Yoga Performer (Student and Faculty)
   -

   Most Creative Flow (Student and Faculty)
   -

   Best Video Setup (Student and Faculty)

[image: üìú] E-certificates will be awarded to all participants.


[image: üì•] Register & Upload Your Video Here:
https://forms.gle/s7enhcCicAPNZ8N99


For any queries, feel free to contact:

   - Dr. Shreya Swami (PT) ‚Äì +91-6353651313 - shreyaswami.phy@charusat.ac.in
   - Dr. Disha Shah (PT) ‚Äì +91-9974790312 ‚Äì dishashah.phy@charusat.ac.in

We warmly invite all students and faculty members to participate in this
celebration of health, balance, and inner strength. Let‚Äôs bend, breathe,
and belong ‚Äî together !!

*Jay Hind !!*
CHARUSAT NSS Cell !!
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*



-- 
Thanks & Regards,

--

subject: Re: Join the World Hackathon and Innovate Globally!
snippet: On Tue, Jun 10, 2025 at 4:43 PM Abcd Efg <efg5726@gmail.com> wrote: Hi Kevin, Get ready to showcase your skills and innovate on a global scale! The World Hackathon is just around the corner, and
content:
On Tue, Jun 10, 2025 at 4:43‚ÄØPM Abcd Efg <efg5726@gmail.com> wrote:

> Hi Kevin,
>
> Get ready to showcase your skills and innovate on a global scale! The *World
> Hackathon* is just around the corner, and we're inviting developers,
> designers, and innovators like you to participate.
>
> This virtual event brings together brilliant minds from around the globe
> to collaborate, learn, and build groundbreaking solutions. Whether you're a
> seasoned hacker or new to hackathons, the World Hackathon offers an
> incredible opportunity to:
>
>    - *Solve real-world problems:* Work on challenging tracks and develop
>    solutions that can make a real impact.
>    - *Collaborate internationally:* Team up with participants from
>    diverse backgrounds and expand your network.
>    - *Learn and grow:* Access workshops, mentorship, and resources to
>    enhance your skills.
>    - *Win exciting prizes:* Compete for recognition and rewards.
>
> ------------------------------
>
> *Event Details:*
>
>    - *Website:* https://world-hackathon.devpost.com/
>    - *Registration Deadline:* 14-06-2025
>    - *Event Dates:* 14-06-2025 TO 20-06-2025
>
> ------------------------------
>
> Ready to make your mark? Visit our Devpost page to learn more about the
> challenges, rules, and how to register.
>
> We can't wait to see what you'll create!
>
> Best regards,
>
> The World Hackathon Team
> [image: imagy-image.jpg]

subject: Request for Email Data Contribution ‚Äì Research Acknowledgment Included
snippet: Dear fellow student, We hope you're doing well. We are a group of students working on a research project focused on analyzing CHARUSAT student inbox data to train a machine learning model that can
content:
*Dear fellow student,*

We hope you're doing well.

We are a group of students working on a research project focused on
analyzing CHARUSAT student inbox data to train a machine learning model
that can automatically classify academic emails ‚Äî such as faculty
announcements, seminar notifications, class updates, and internship
opportunities.

We are reaching out to a few *handpicked students*, and we believe your
contribution could significantly strengthen the quality of our dataset. As
a token of appreciation, all contributors will be *acknowledged in our
final research presentation/report*.

Please rest assured:

¬∑       Your data will be used *strictly for academic and research
 purposes*.

¬∑        We are only interested in academic/informational emails, *not
personal content*.

¬∑        *No data will be collected without your clear consent*, and we
will *explain the data extraction process in detail* if you agree to help.

If you're willing to contribute or have any questions, feel free to reach
out. We truly appreciate your support in helping make this student-led
research a success!

*Note:* Please reach out to us if you agree by 15th June 2025.



Warm regards,

Vansh Malani, 23DCS056

James Dhandhukiya, 23DCS023

Jugvi Desai, 23DCS021

subject: "Internship_Career - B Tech 1st Year Students of Charusat University!"
snippet: Dear Student from Charusat University. Congratulations on being shortlisted for the Internship Program! LaunchEd Global in Collaboration IIT KHARAGPUR(Kshitij) is Organizing a 2-month Training &
content:
*Dear Student** from **Charusat University**.*

*Congratulations* on being shortlisted for the *Internship Program!*

*LaunchEd Global* in Collaboration *IIT KHARAGPUR(Kshitij)* is
Organizing a *2-month
Training & Internship Program with certifications from WIPRO Dice ID, IBM,
CISCO, META, and AICTE-approved.* Gain *industry-leading skills* and
*real-world
experience* to advance your career!

*Fill out the Google Form today to reserve your place in the program:*

                https://forms.gle/VWhzEk9Fp23BKQmV9
<https://forms.gle/ux9C9RpVqkDkcmf69>

*Join Our Official WhatsApp Group For More Information:*

     https://chat.whatsapp.com/HQlb0D2oAFl2Dfp4q9e3wR
<https://chat.whatsapp.com/ENKgO96eEfmD3PZz5aeM3V>

*Here is an outline of the program's structure.*
*1. Training Outline*

   - *Live Mentoring with Industry Experts:* Evening classes (6:30 PM -
   8:00 PM) are conducted live on the Zoom platform to fit your schedule. Get
   guidance at every step.
- *From Basics to Advanced:* Perfect for beginners and those looking to
   refine advanced skills, starting from scratch.
- *AI-Powered Development Made Easy*: Build applications with minimal
   coding, create innovative solutions using Generative AI, and easily design
   effective AI prompts.
- *LMS Access for Flexibility: *Recorded live sessions will be uploaded to
   the Learning Management System (LMS) and available for 6 months from the
   batch start date. Login credentials will be shared after registration,
   ensuring uninterrupted learning at your own pace.

*2. Internship Conduct*

   - *10+ Minor Project**: *The minor project is an individual project,
   where students will work on projects related to each topic they are
   learning.
   - *Major Project (CAPSTONE):* The major project is a group project, and
   you will work in a group of 3-4 interns, with specific responsibilities
   assigned to each intern. The company will provide you with all the required
   data and materials for the project.
   - *Resume Building*: Get expert guidance to craft a standout resume that
   gets noticed.
   - *Mock Interviews*: Receive feedback from industry experts to sharpen
   your interview skills.
   - *Masterclasses*: Learn from top leaders in global companies through
   exclusive sessions.

*Certifications Provided*

   - *Course Certificate*: Receive a prestigious certificate from
   IIT-KHARAGPUR(Kshitij)
   - *Internship Certificate*: Earn a certificate from our partnered MNCs &
   StartUps.
   - *Verified by WIPRO Dice ID*: Both the Certificates will be verified by
   WIPRO Dice ID
   - *100% Placement Assistance: *Join Our Growth Community for Direct
   Placement Support with Top Companies.

subject: Embrace Harmony: Yoga & Nature Session
snippet: Dear All, As part of the 11th International Day of Yoga (IDY) 2025 celebrations, CHARUSAT enthusiastically invites you to a week-long series of events promoting health, mindfulness, and environmental
content:
Dear All,

As part of the 11th International Day of Yoga (IDY) 2025 celebrations,
CHARUSAT enthusiastically invites you to a week-long series of events
promoting health, mindfulness, and environmental consciousness.

Join us for our special "Yoga & Nature" Session, designed to connect your
well-being with the serenity of the outdoors.

*Event Details:*

   - *What:* "Yoga & Nature" Session
   - *When:* June 16th to June 20th, 2025
   - *Time:* 5:30 PM to 6:45 PM daily
   - *Where:* Centre Lawn, CHARUSAT Campus

This session offers a unique opportunity to experience the profound
benefits of Yoga amidst nature, aligning with this year's IDY theme: "Yoga
for One Earth, One Health." Let's come together to foster holistic
well-being and environmental sustainability.

*Kindly confirm your registration by clicking on:  *
https://forms.gle/qoQfRvsiWWLv1Kmy7

*Who can attend:* All CHARUSAT students, faculty, staff, and the wider
community are welcome!

Please bring: Your own yoga mat and a water bottle.

E-Certificates will be provided to all participants.

Let's celebrate the spirit of Yoga and its connection to our planet. We
look forward to seeing you there!

*For more information, please contact:*
Dr.Pritesh Patel
-- 
Assistant Director of Physical Education and Sports
CHARUSAT Physical Education and Sports Section
(A constituent of CHARUSAT)
*Accredited with "Grade A+" by NAAC, GOI*
*Accredited with Centre of Excellence by GOG*
Landline No: 02697-265036
Mobile : -- 97142 96999

--

subject: All India Women Tech Hackathon by World Wide Technology: Idea Submission Due By 30th June 2025
snippet: Dear Participant, Hope you are all geared up with your team! Please review the participant guidebook to go through the event details. In the pre-hackathon round, each team will make a preliminary
content:
Dear Participant,

Hope you are all geared up with your team!

Please review the participant guidebook
<https://sstarsfoundation-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/20dBZBge1MQWNbLkCd32dIx4LPUiaMIUOZNPxR4u9jyfSFrxVlwHkDvrrYwi44VoE98r5iKyOcli8N-LLaNI43I7Xq4hjxI_jworf-vnd1z0v8tCW-o743XUkuJLeu6y4NzGLUMU4sP0bcvNf5Shv5mW3EBsIcDTqBtq3qkAnGHLlxqHGozE3NC24PuoqD94fbVD77tLomjdex9lRWQqansvOv5iiZ-GIqeEAZIEJ6YA1hI_UN-GScYrbra1S9eE>
to go through the event details.

In the pre-hackathon round, each team will make a preliminary submission of
their idea over the google form under the theme ‚ÄúFinancial Inclusion for
Women ‚Äî AI Solutions for Economic Empowerment and Financial Literacy‚Äù.
Based on the submission, ~25 teams will be shortlisted for the Hackathon
event

   -

   Please Note: Final Team and SSF Assigned Team is mandatory for Idea
   submission
   -

   Written abstract only - no need of prototype
   -

   Use the same email id you used to submit the registration form
   -

   Only 1 Idea Entry Per Team


Your Idea should:

   -

   Clearly define a specific real-world problem that women face in
   financial inclusion. And outline an innovative AI/ML solution to address it
   -

   Explain how the proposed solution prioritizes ethical AI use (e.g.,
   fairness, bias mitigation, data privacy) and is inclusive for underserved
   women
   -

   Provide a high-level implementation plan, including potential
   challenges, and estimate the solution's impact if successfully deployed
   -

   Create a high-level development roadmap with key milestones
   -

   Propose specific metrics to evaluate the solution's success(e.g., number
   of women reached, increase in digital literacy, improved financial access)
   and discuss potential for scalability or broader application



Abstract Submission Link: https://forms.gle/23dnsVBtwhbpfijE8
<https://sstarsfoundation-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2BtUU2VeVmj2MktzzNzKAowolrrHKTdvzRMINbingEXPVFrxVlwEOmPkk1-wBLUFkj9kBmDv2XmH3DHI93afCx2R5lc2coFSFMQ-eaqqz3mNotneg2FjwyuIvoPpTARVZWReA2oaAOfAEi45voixV1UFg37WuVZx-blxeVsTpGxlJ0AhRf-m91SSMMsKHjoKVR2c>

Plagiarism is strictly prohibited and will be terminated from participating
further

Last date for submission of your idea is 30th June 2025 (Monday) 11:59 PM
IST


For queries: https://forms.gle/8st6EHsY6LRH7hLH7
<https://sstarsfoundation-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2yPHdGLQIbyuMuOWwSQwUBfbV67PL3-9zpJwvMfT-Kt_XFrxVlwGLr3QBIfklWkG6q61hUiAC2_xUlHeShigTeEUI_qxSxv_hrUpyfqG8AWkCk0yK3GEyN-NgL6QcLR9iBDu5nSFYfHwz_HE25Gsq_OPa1x7XaJ_cR7-rLWDue8uT6Vux5nVG5MaZuz0NekWDTw>

Thanks,

Shooting Stars Team

subject: Thank You for Registering ‚Äì Next Steps for WWT Hackathon 2025
snippet: Dear Participant, Thank you for registering for the WWT Hackathon 2025! We're excited to have you on board. Your registration has been successfully received and confirmed. Please review the
content:
Dear Participant,
Thank you for registering for the WWT Hackathon 2025!
We're excited to have you on board. Your registration has been successfully
received and confirmed.

Please review the participant guidebook to go through the event details:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nOi64Z3hXVLUIhPrUYpWXxLK5LXzdzr2ZB7BrZwNmds/edit?tab=t.0
<https://sstarsfoundation-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/25Ac379nbReJpQ-TGlr7PACc4BIxJxMqLLhrpzU1E6z-XN4lVlwE5OWjQUkHt6IXbBh0Fwnbz7JARxvMVJPIyqNc4cc0Wxgm_rKQxNmcghR7IYFpO0NgzKi44pVgI9iiq0t3j32wuEAZbmdV2BISXxCWy5wJkj2AjdsMlihG4qEVtG6WHYmRBM_7th1SVutm7CPAHf_kgMz11a37qwNQLd1p1on6NhBfVPJAAxJLebkN73lUE8csggQ2ubBjqZW4>

Now, it‚Äôs time for the next important step ‚Äî Team Formation!
Step 1: Confirm Full Team Registration

It‚Äôs mandatory for all participants to individually complete the Main
Registration Form (if not done already):
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1qg_rRFneTFMVN6gLJiMNhR9huBKe0Xbh15_7hVxcZso/viewform
<https://sstarsfoundation-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/20A_oMJhfTA29ePay43GUv6kCscs6PVaZWO1EG9Q0BbGZN4lVlwHLvon7bTsb6RKZGoGrNicJ1uRRyKttdsMXnHZFp2dazHfqXcnDm7cyraMsS_P-1OjrY6_AIE_9ZU2CCZUEsAhsXh0Ig0z9Ua26KTRTNHIbEHygocujeg4f8SboOmF-eA0gbzue4_7xfUMp-zzHD731KaP-dzgOReLKf7NuDE95ioTFsxUBKgXW4_xUojuAkDo>
Deadline:
30 June 2025
Step 2: Already Have a Team?

If you‚Äôve formed a team of 2-6 members, please ask your Team Lead to submit
the team details here:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1cKSmFT6AcDXGHV0yPYQo_u2zZMJq-KppsJqY6j2DBmo/viewform
<https://sstarsfoundation-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/20ha8a3yNZ1LOP6y84NjFekJiK36LD-O1Pgr2f-A5NOucN4lVlwG-gyA3pCiP1mHzVoZaxJ3nAwB9LMeM18KfPTZbXEW5kri9Ygm7gXI3WC_OCN38BhqRWF3lBVQRZeKfD08iJdSO0X7MdJk2MQU4c23G4bS2I_pFFXPadK9Zp2kCipOkAYzeiJrv5oHvAaiyxyciMhRDAdWE2K463Oe4x4UJCGE1AzC7wLazhx408_5cXBCXTN7R>
Step 3: Need Help Finding a Team?

No worries! If you're looking for teammates, fill out this form and we‚Äôll
help match you with other passionate hackers:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1yn3neJNF5TSedT2zNnhXg9xRPl6HcRfGLO-fSi6p2fs/viewform
<https://sstarsfoundation-dot-yamm-track.appspot.com/2qg1JLkSaTZuvLZOq12plZKHgFAMuPZLfJpEozLbVgPXON4lVlwH878m8paP2JwtChK9a2RyB3EGv2j_qYcOP3-ixrJ-QmC5U1qPS4-mUB8XN1bOx381pV_DkYVjjP3VdAHMdf0aaTNcc9AQbme-XvPo4M_6UkhoyluOCle0SKTBE7CJt9NV9FmryWw-YF47dHLuYpHXbmGIC3NCtG8AC3MkHZVdCr7kWpI4QS_EVm0SXuOQRRJk>
Quick Reminders:

   -

   Only one person (Team Lead) should submit the team form.
   -

   Team size must be between 2 to 6 members.
   -

   Deadline to finalize teams: 30 June 2025

We can't wait to see the incredible ideas your teams will bring to life.
Let‚Äôs make this hackathon an unforgettable experience!

Warm regards,
Team SSF x WWT Hackathon 2025

*Dear Professor *

I am Dr. Deepti Pillai, formerly with CodeChef and currently serving as
Director ‚Äì Community at *Shooting Stars Foundation*, a non-profit committed
to advancing access to STEM education and entrepreneurship for underserved
communities.

We are delighted to invite your *girl students* to participate in the
upcoming
*WWT All India Women-Only Hackathon 2025*, organized in partnership with *World
Wide Technology*, a leading US-based IT services company.
Hackathon Highlights:

   -

   -

   Financial Literacy*
   -

   -

   50K/35K/25/15K/10K). A*ll top 25 teams standing a chance to win a
   minimum of ‚Çπ5,000
   -

   -

   *Last Date to Register: June 30, 2025*
   -

   *Registration Link:* www.starhacks.org/wwthackathon2025
   <https://email.shooting-stars-foundation.org//l/ZF7Z763WC7eUq2AeqCCIc2Bw/1L3mRYYlKvNT1EbrEAqOBw/aznlpRaV3enicF4u4mWwng>

students or circulate it through your department WhatsApp/email groups. *A

participants* will receive a *special mention* on our social media and in
exclusive communications to our corporate partners ‚Äî celebrating your
commitment to promoting gender diversity in tech.

Your encouragement could make a life-changing difference for your students,

*Dr. Deepti Pillai*

subject: CAREER LAUNCHPAD INTERNSHIP PROGRAM | CHARUSAT
snippet: Dear Student of Charotar University of Science and Technology, We are thrilled to introduce the Career LaunchPad Program, a 3-stage, outcome-focused initiative designed exclusively for students of
content:
Dear Student of *Charotar University of Science and Technology,*

We are thrilled to introduce the *Career LaunchPad Program*, a 3-stage,
outcome-focused initiative designed exclusively for students of *CHARUSAT*.


Please fill out the *Admission Form*:
Admission form <https://forms.gle/DDjMnNEeBnEXV4pPA>
------------------------------
*Stage 1: Learn (Training)*

   -

   *Skill Training:* Master in-demand skills.
   -

   *Mentorship:* Get guidance from experts:
   ‚ñ´Ô∏è *Ayush Kumar* (Adobe)
   ‚ñ´Ô∏è *Harsh Vajpayee* (Sony India)
   ‚ñ´Ô∏è *Aastha Kanupriya* (Capgemini)
   -

   *Masterclass:* Insights from CXOs of Fortune 500 companies.

*Stage 2: Build (Internship)*

   -

   *Live Projects:* Work on 10+ projects, including a Capstone Project.
   -

   *Real Experience:* Solve real-world problems with startups.

*Stage 3: Launch & Create Your Own Product*

   -

   *Founder Sessions:* Learn MVP Building, Pitching & Scaling.
   -

   *Career Tools:* Resume building, mock interviews, and job opportunities.

------------------------------
*Certification & Program Benefits:*

   -

   *Course Completion Certificate* accredited by *NSDC Skill India*
   -

   *Internship Completion Certificate* verified with a unique *Wipro DICE
   ID* ‚Äî trusted by industry leaders
   -

   Enjoy *6 months of Software Access (LMS)* and *Lifetime Access to Growth
   Community*
   -

   Free *Resume Building Sessions* and *Mock Interview Sessions* to boost
   your confidence and skills
   -

   Get practical experience and tools to launch your career successfully

------------------------------
*Ready to launch your career?*

Please fill out the *Admission Form*:
Admission form <https://forms.gle/DDjMnNEeBnEXV4pPA>
------------------------------

*‚ÄúYour career is your launchpad ‚Äî equip yourself with the right skills,
real experience, and the confidence to soar. This program is your first
step to turning dreams into reality.*

Dear Student,

Krutanic Solutions, in collaboration with industry leaders and endorsed by  
Accenture, is offering a structured Online Internship and Training Program  
designed to enhance your technical skills and project experience.

This 2‚Äì3 month virtual program provides focused learning, real-time project  
exposure, and optional career readiness support‚Äîall accessible remotely.

Program Timeline
Month 1: Training

Live sessions led by experts from Accenture, IBM, and Wipro

Doubt-solving and mentor support provided

Month 2: Internship

Minor & Major Projects (30 days total) based on industry case studies

Group and individual formats available

Month 3: (Optional) Placement Support

Resume-building, mock interviews, and skill development sessions

Internship Certificate endorsed by Accenture & Wipro

Letter of Recommendation for qualifying students

Important Details
Final date to apply: May 31

Seats are limited and assigned on a first-come, first-served basis

For any assistance, please reach out to the coordination team.

Krutanic Solutions

subject: Industry-Aligned Online Internship Program ‚Äì Registration Closes Tomorrow at 12 PM
snippet: . Dear Student, We'd like to inform you about the upcoming Online Summer Training & Internship Program, offered by Krutanic Solutions in alignment with Accenture's training standards. The
content:
I've invited you to fill out the following form:
Advance Your Career with Accenture-Verified Training and Internships

To fill it out, visit:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfhiob3wud-MIiXdVNWIl7dtQSWnoz7fW7VyB0Gbcz9sWJsUw/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1&flr=0&usp=mail_form_link

Dear Student,

We‚Äôd like to inform you about the upcoming Online Summer Training &  
Internship Program, offered by Krutanic Solutions in alignment with  
Accenture‚Äôs training standards. The program is open to students of Charotar  
University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT).

Structured over 2‚Äì3 months, this online program combines live training,  
practical project work, and optional career preparation support.

Program Structure

Training (Month 1)

Live interactive sessions led by industry professionals

Individual support through 1-on-1 doubt-solving sessions

Internship (Month 2)

Minor and major project work (7 days + 23 days)

Mix of individual and team-based assignments

Career Preparation (Optional ‚Äì Month 3)

Interview readiness: mock interviews, resume building

Communication and soft skills sessions

Certificates Provided

Internship Certificate (Co-certified by Accenture & Wipro)

Course Certificate from Krutanic Solutions (AICTE & ISO certified)

Letter of Recommendation from partner organizations

Certificate of Excellence (for select performers)

Important Details

Mode: 100% Online (Zoom / Google Meet)

Seats Available: 12

Registration Deadline: Tomorrow by 12 PM

Training Fee: Applicable

To secure your seat, register now.
If you have any questions, feel free to reach out.

Best regards,
Ashwaq
National Training Coordinator
Krutanic Solutions

subject: Fwd: MEUD101 Elements of Engineering - Submission guidelines
snippet: Dear Students, Please find the details below for MEUD101 - EOE Practical Examination. Building: A7 Room No. : 426 A /B (CAD Lab) - for Practical Exam/Viva Room No. : 415 (Fluid Mechanics and Machines
content:
Dear Students,

Please find the details below for MEUD101 - EOE Practical Examination.

*Building: A7*

Room No. : 426 A /B (CAD Lab) - for Practical Exam/Viva
Room No. : 415 (Fluid Mechanics and Machines Lab) - waiting room for viva
batch
Room No. : 528 A & 527 B - for Practical Performance (Drawing)
Room No. : 519 & 520 - waiting room for practical performance

Instructions:
- Students are instructed to sit as per the allotted room numbers and not
in center square or in corridor.
- Students are also instructed to report at 9.10 AM (all batches).
- At the time of Practical Exam (Viva) students have to bring Lab
Sketchbook (signed by faculty), Sheets, Assignment sketch book, and Lab
manual.

Radhika madam is requested to forward the same to Depstar students.

Regards,

Vikas Panchal

Assistant Professor

Mechanical Engineering | CSPIT, CHARUSAT

vikaspanchal.me@charusat.ac.in

kundanpatel.me@charusat.ac.in>, Mr. Bhargav Shobhana <
bhargavshobhana.cv@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

The submission process for the subject MEUD101 - Elements of Engineering is
as follows:

For Engineering Graphics Sheets:

1. Students must submit their A2-size drawing sheets and  binders on both
sides.
Sequence is as follows: Binder - Sheet - 1 - Sheet - 2 - Binder
All the sheets should be of A2 size.
[image: image.png]


2. Colour code of the binder is as follows:

Department Institute Colour Code
CE CSPIT & DEPSTAR YELLOW
CSE CSPIT & DEPSTAR BLUE
IT CSPIT & DEPSTAR GREEN
AIML CSPIT BLACK
EC CSPIT PINK

3. No need to stick the Certificate and Index on the binder.
(as the certificate and index are already available in your lab manual)

4. At the time of Practical Exam (Viva) students have to bring Lab
Sketchbook (signed by faculty), Sheets as mentioned above, Assignment
sketch book (signed by class teacher), Lab manual and assignment of
Mechanical & Civil.


You can contact your respective lab/lecture faculties for submission.

Radhika madam is requested to forward this email to DEPSTAR students.

Regards,


Vikas Panchal

Assistant Professor

Mechanical Engineering | CSPIT, CHARUSAT
8866286233
vikaspanchal.me@charusat.ac.in
CHARUSAT Campus, Changa, Gujarat 388421

subject: MANDATORY WIPRO SUMMER INTERNSHIP AND AICTE APPROVED INTERNSHIP
snippet: Transform Your Career with Our Exclusive Training & Internship Program! DEAR STUDENT OF CHARUSAT We are excited to announce a unique opportunity in collaboration with NIT Durgapur and Wipro DICE ID
content:
Transform Your Career with Our Exclusive Training & Internship Program!

DEAR STUDENT OF CHARUSAT
We are excited to announce a unique opportunity in collaboration with NIT
Durgapur and Wipro DICE ID, offering a prestigious 2-month Training+
Internship program with certifications from industry giants like CISCO,
META|FACEBOOK, IBM, and various other renowned MNCs in technical and
non-technical domains, with key highlights including placement assistance,
limited seats available, and enhanced career prospects

*Note: If any of your batchmates are missed or haven't received the
notification, recipients are allowed to send this mail to them.*

It is Mandatory for students to submit their application. If you get
shortlisted, you will be getting a call from our HR Team:
*Submit Your Application* <https://forms.gle/k86LWXSJYNX9LQDQ8>
Program Details:Program Overview:

   - *Duration:* 2 months (1 Month of Training + 1 Month of Internship)
   - *Eligibility:* Limited seats available‚Äîensure you apply early to
   secure your place.

Program Structure:*First Month: Expert Training*

   - Live lectures and mentorship from seasoned industry professionals with
   10+ years of experience.
   - Access to online course materials and recorded sessions.
   - *Learning Focus:* In-depth theoretical and practical knowledge in both
   technical and non-technical domains.

*Second Month: Internship*

   - *Internship Projects:*
      - *Project 1:* 10 individual projects for each intern, designed to
      enhance real-world problem-solving skills.
      - *Project 2:* A collaborative Capstone Project, where groups of 15
      interns will work together under mentor guidance.
   - *Mentorship:* Ongoing live mentorship for projects, offering insights
   and practical experience in solving industry-specific challenges.

Class Formats:

*Blended Program:* Access to recorded classes and live doubt clearing
sessions every weekend.

*Mentor-led/Live Classes:* Live Zoom classes at 6:30 PM for 3 to 4days a
week, with recorded sessions available.

*LMS Portal:* Access for 12 months.
Certification:

After completion of the program, students will receive:

   - *Program completion certificate issued by WIPRO*
   - *Co-branded internship certificate from top MNCs.*
   - *100% placement assistance.*
   - *Access to a thriving professional community.*
   - *WIPRO DICE Certification.*

*Submit Your Application* <https://forms.gle/k86LWXSJYNX9LQDQ8>



*Congratulations to students who have already been selected for our
programs:*

subject: C++ materials list
snippet: Dear students, Greetings!!! Below is the list of C++ materials chapterwise as per our syllabus. I would recommend you to go through the practice questions available at the end of all the chapters. That
content:
Dear students,
Greetings!!! Below is the list of C++ materials chapterwise as per our
syllabus. I would recommend you to go through the practice questions
available at the end of all the chapters. That could help you prepare the
concepts well for your exams.

CHAPTER-1

https://www.notion.so/Unit-1-Overview-of-C-Programming-1a4cf78054b680daac9ef33466c25f03?pvs=4

CHAPTER-2
https://www.notion.so/Unit-2-Function-and-Function-Templates-1a8cf78054b6807b8f17f4c1ff27ade9?pvs=4

CHAPTER-3
https://www.notion.so/Unit-3-String-Files-and-Pointers-1bbcf78054b680d2b851f4e2827b53b5?pvs=4

CHAPTER-4
https://www.notion.so/Unit-4-Introduction-to-Classes-and-Inheritance-1b59abba230f80a785fde77fc803036a?pvs=4

CHAPTER-5
https://www.notion.so/Unit-5-Polymorphism-Overloading-and-Smart-Pointers-1becf78054b6801a961eea78f886f3a9?pvs=4

CHAPTER-6
https://www.notion.so/Unit-6-Exception-Handling-1becf78054b68076a65dd4efb12e9954?pvs=4

CHAPTER-7
https://www.notion.so/Unit-7-Standard-Library-Containers-and-Iterators-1bfcf78054b680088fe6c0090bf7e369?pvs=4
*--*
*Thanks & Regards,*
*Aayushi Chaudhari | PhD*
Assistant Professor,
U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT,Changa,Anand-388421.
www.charusat.ac.in

--

snippet: Dear students, Find the email below for your reference. EC-Council Essentials Series - https://www.eccouncil.org/train-certify/essentials/ ---------- Forwarded message --------- Subject: EC-Council |
content:
Dear students,

Find the email below for your reference.
EC-Council Essentials Series -
https://www.eccouncil.org/train-certify/essentials/

---------- Forwarded message ---------
Subject: EC-Council | Help Your Students Upskill with EC-Council Essentials
To: Priteshkumar Prajapati <priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in>

Dear Prof Pritesh,

We‚Äôre pleased to offer *CHARUSAT students* a unique opportunity to
access *EC-Council‚Äôs
Essential Series* at a heavily discounted *academia rate of ‚Çπ7,022 per
course*.

These beginner-friendly, globally recognized courses are designed to equip
students with practical cybersecurity skills across a range of key domains:

üìö *Courses Available:*

   1. Network Defense Essentials
   2. Ethical Hacking Essentials
   3. Digital Forensics Essentials
   4. IoT Security Essentials
   5. Threat Intelligence Essentials
   6. Cloud Security Essentials
   7. DevSecOps Essentials
   8. Security Operations Essentials

üîç *What‚Äôs Included with Each Course:*

   - üìò eCourseware ‚Äì 12 Months
   - üß™ Hands-on Labs ‚Äì 6 Months
   - üéØ Capture the Flag style exercises  (Excluding DSE & CSE)
   - üé• Video Lectures ‚Äì 12 Months
   - üìù Exam Prep Resources ‚Äì Sample Exam
   - üéì Exam Voucher (with Remote Proctoring Services)- 12 Months

üõí *How Students Can Redeem the Offer:*

   1. Visit:
   https://ec-councilindia.myshopify.com/collections/frontpage-essential-series
   2. Add the desired courses to the cart
   3. Use the code *ECC-ACA-IND-ESS* at checkout
   4. Complete the purchase using their *@charusat.edu.in
   <http://charusat.edu.in>* email ID

We look forward to welcoming your students in these exciting programs.



Kind Regards,

*Senior Manager ‚Äì Academia*

*EC-Council | Academia*

subject: This is what you are missing out on!
snippet: Hi shreeja vaishnani , It's been a week since we last saw you on CodeChef! CodeChef is your ideal learning partner for anything related to Programming. This is what you are missing out on Our
content:
Hi shreeja vaishnani , 

 

It's been a week since we last saw you on CodeChef!

 

CodeChef is your ideal learning partner for anything related to Programming.

This is what you are missing out on

  • Our curriculum covers everything that your will encounter during a 4 year Engineering course - Programming, OOPs, Data structures & Algorithms, Web development, Analytics & Data science (coming soon!)

  • Our learning flow gives you access to AI support, Skill Tests, Test case debugging, Video editorials

  • Preparation for OA rounds: Over 4000 curated algorithmic problems

Continue learning!

Should you have any questions, feel free to hit reply.

 

Regards,

Ravikant

Developer@CodeChef

subject: Nomenclature Competition I Multi Utility Building @ CHARUSAT
snippet: Dear Students, CHARUSAT is excited to invite your creative suggestions for naming our Multi-Utility Complex. The facility is a versatile space for CSIC, CIVF, HRDC, COE, IT Cell, IQAC, conference rooms
content:
Dear Students,

CHARUSAT is excited to invite your creative suggestions for *naming our
Multi-Utility Complex.*
The facility is a versatile space for CSIC, CIVF, HRDC, COE, IT Cell, IQAC,
conference rooms, paperless exam halls, an exam control room, and
multitudes of related services. It is designed to cater to the diverse
needs of CHARUSAT's unique initiatives and will play a pivotal role in
enhancing the overall campus experience.


*Criteria for Nomenclature:*

   - Should reflect Vedic/Sanskrit terminology‚Äîeasily memorable
   - Should be meaningful and relevant to the facility
   - Should have Clarity, brevity, and creativity
   - Should have a touch of academia or knowledge


üéÅPrize: The best fit name will be awarded a cash prize of ‚Çπ11,000/- by the
prime donor of this facility, Shri Devang Patel (Nadiad).


Click to fill out the form <https://forms.gle/WDvwYgL4uC2DBHMi9>
*Deadline*: Submit your response before May 30, 2025.


*Kruten Patel*
*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

Hey, check out our new courses and features for your coding journey Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø Õè ‚Äå ‚Äá Ôªø

Hi shreeja vaishnani,

 

We hope you're doing well and staying curious. We have some exciting news to share: New courses and cool tools that will make coding even more fun and educational.

New React JS Course

We‚Äôve just launched a brand-new React JS course! Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or looking to refresh your skills, this course will guide you through building awesome web interfaces with React. You'll learn how to work with components, manage state and props, and use hooks to handle dynamic data. The best part? You can learn at your own pace, anytime and anywhere

  • Hands-on Projects: Build real web apps using React.

  • Step-by-Step Lessons: Follow clear tutorials on components, state, and more.

  • Self-Paced Learning: Go through material as quickly or slowly as you like.

Coming Soon: We‚Äôre also working on new backend-focused courses on Flask and Django ‚Äî Stay Tuned!

Start the React JS course Now!
‚Ää

Code Visualizer Tool

Check out our  Code Visualizer in the Python, Java and C++ online compiler and courses. This awesome tool lets you run your code step-by-step and see exactly what happens. As your code executes, you‚Äôll see English explanations pop up for each assignment and conditional statement .

 

This way, you really understand what your code is doing. If your code encounters an error, the Visualizer will pause just before it crashes and show you the state of all variables right before the error. It‚Äôs like having a debugger that talks to you!

Explore Code Visualizer Tool
‚Ää

AI Explain Feature

Debugging just got easier with our new AI Explain feature! Next time you see an error message in the CodeChef compiler, click the ‚ÄúExplain‚Äù link next to it. Our AI-powered helper will: 

  • Explain the Error: Tell you why the error happened in simple terms.

  • Show a Fix: Provide a corrected version of your code.

  • One-Click Solution: Let you copy the fix and run the corrected code instantly.

No more scratching your head over cryptic errors‚Äîthis tool does the explaining and fixing for you.

Check out our AI Explain feature
‚Ää

Projects

We believe the best way to learn coding is by building real stuff ‚Äî not just watching tutorials.

Whether you're preparing for internships, hackathons, or job interviews ‚Äî these projects will help you apply your skills in real-world scenarios and stand out from the crowd.

 

üî∞ For Beginners

  • Projects using HTML/CSS ‚Äî Start with the basics of the web

  • Python Projects for Beginners ‚Äî Write scripts and simple apps

  • C++ Projects for Beginners ‚Äî Build logic-heavy mini tools

  • Java Projects for Beginners ‚Äî Learn OOP the practical way

  • Projects for Beginners in C ‚Äî Foundational coding made hands-on

‚öôÔ∏è Intermediate Projects

  • Intermediate-level projects using Python ‚Äî Take your skills to the next level

  • Intermediate-level projects using Java ‚Äî From console to functional apps

Thanks for being part of the CodeChef community. We hope these new resources and tools help you learn faster and debug smarter.

 

Happy coding!

Team CodeChef

subject: Accenture Verified Internship Certification Program 2025 Opportunity
snippet: . Dear Student, Charusat University is pleased to announce that you have been shortlisted for the Accenture Verified Internship Certification Program 2025. This program aims to provide students with
content:
I've invited you to fill out the following form:
Advance Your Career with Accenture-Verified Training and Internships

To fill it out, visit:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfhiob3wud-MIiXdVNWIl7dtQSWnoz7fW7VyB0Gbcz9sWJsUw/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1&flr=0&usp=mail_form_link

Dear Student,

Charusat University is pleased to announce that you have been shortlisted  
for the Accenture Verified Internship Certification Program 2025.

This program aims to provide students with essential skills for successful  
placements, including support in developing ATS-compliant resumes,  
interview preparation, and access to career opportunities with leading  
organizations such as Accenture, Wipro, and IBM.

To secure your participation, we encourage you to complete your  
registration as soon as possible. Please note that seats are limited, and  
the registration deadline is approaching.

Note: If you have already completed your registration, no further action is  
required.

We are committed to supporting you in your pursuit of a successful and  
rewarding career.

Sincerely,

Program Coordination Team
Accenture Verified Internship Certification Program 2025

subject: Improve your Coding Skills with C++ Class Template Specialization
snippet: Hi SHREEJA, Improve your skills with this challenge recommended for you: C++ Class Template Specialization C++ | 41997 submissions Class templates in C++ create specializations for certain types. These
content:
|  

  |

subject: IEEE Student Membership Half Yearly Offer
snippet: Dear CHARUSAT Students, We're excited to invite you to join the IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch 2025-26, a platform designed to help you grow both academically and professionally. Whether you're
content:
Dear CHARUSAT Students,

We‚Äôre excited to invite you to join the *IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch
2025-26*, a platform designed to help you grow both academically and
professionally. Whether you're looking to gain hands-on experience, build
your resume, or expand your network, IEEE has something for you!
What is IEEE?

IEEE is the world‚Äôs largest technical professional organization. Our
Student Branches are university-based groups that offer opportunities for
career development, technical learning, leadership experience, and
networking within fields of engineering and related disciplines.
Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?

   - *Build Your Resume with Projects and Skills:* Participate in technical
   projects, workshops, and hackathons in areas like Robotics, Artificial
   Intelligence, Signal Processing, VLSI, and more.
   - *Exclusive Networking Opportunities:* Connect with industry
   professionals, mentors, and peers globally for internships, jobs, and
   guidance.
   - *Leadership Experience:* Take on roles within the branch to develop
   key professional skills.
   - *Access to Global Competitions and Events:* Join competitions like
   IEEE Xtreme and attend conferences that boost your professional exposure.
   - *Resources to Stay Ahead:* Get access to the IEEE Xplore Digital
   Library and other exclusive member tools.

Learn more about the benefits of IEEE membership:

   - Student Membership Benefits
   <https://students.ieee.org/membership-benefits/>
   - General IEEE Membership Benefits
   <https://www.ieee.org/membership/benefits/index.html>

*Avail the half-yearly offer now and join IEEE at a 50% discount!*

Please refer to the attached PDF for step-by-step instructions on how to
take up membership.

For any queries please reply to this mail.

Join IEEE Now <https://students.ieee.org/membership-benefits/>

subject: Fwd: DE Video presentation instructions and deadline
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Ronak Patel <ronakpatel.ce@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Apr 17, 2025 at 3:45 PM Subject: DE Video presentation instructions and deadline To: <24ce@
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Ronak Patel <ronakpatel.ce@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Apr 17, 2025 at 3:45‚ÄØPM
Subject: DE Video presentation instructions and deadline
To: <24ce@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Asifiqbal Thakor <asifiqbalthakor.ce@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

You have a presentation as one of the components. It is having 10 Marks.
This is an individual task.

First you need to approve the topic of the presentation for that fill up
the google form below. The presentation topic must be unique and to check
that the response sheet is shared in which you can check whether someone
has taken that topic or not.

*Form Link: https://forms.gle/BttCer3HLGxo92jw7
<https://forms.gle/BttCer3HLGxo92jw7>*
Deadline: 24th April 2025

You can check the response of the above form using the link below. The
definitions which are approved will be highlighted Green and those which
are rejected will be highlighted in yellow.

*Response
Link: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1YL5cO9sncvcOC3PvvH7GGlsUomFkOXyu-1LCYbHayAE/edit?usp=sharing
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1YL5cO9sncvcOC3PvvH7GGlsUomFkOXyu-1LCYbHayAE/edit?usp=sharing>*
Deadline: 24th April 2025

Students, whose topic is approved, need to prepare a video of  5 minutes
minimum and upload it to your YouTube channel. This link you need to
provide in the Google form below. Your face must be visible in
the bottom right corner.

The evaluation criteria are as below:
Video uploaded on YouTube without any copyright issue.
Content of the presentation
Proper video presentation

Once your video is live on YouTube fill up below google form.

*Form Link: https://forms.gle/dfNxvZNbvEWBZTndA
<https://forms.gle/dfNxvZNbvEWBZTndA>*
Deadline: 30th April 2025

Thank You

subject: Internship, Venture-Building, and CXO Mentorship ‚Äì Apply for the PeerHub Fellowship
snippet: Dear Student, We are pleased to invite applications for the PeerHub Fellowship Program‚Äîa 7-month intensive designed for ambitious students ready to take the next step in their entrepreneurial journey.
content:
*Dear Student*,

We are pleased to invite applications for the *PeerHub Fellowship Program*‚Äîa
7-month intensive designed for ambitious students ready to take the next
step in their entrepreneurial journey.

Unlike traditional programs, the PeerHub Fellowship empowers you to *build
your own venture*, with direct support and mentorship from CXOs and leaders
at top firms including *EY, Deloitte, IBM*, and others.

*Program Highlights:*

   -

   *Five months of live training* with industry experts, startup founders,
   and CXOs
   -

   *Two months of venture-building*, where CXOs work closely with you to:
   -

      Refine your ideas
      -

      Validate business models
      -

      Prepare you for investor-ready pitches
      -

   *Internship opportunities* through PeerHub‚Äôs corporate and startup
   network
   -

   *Access to an exclusive ecosystem* of mentors, investors, and peer
   innovators

This is more than a learning experience. It is a launchpad for students who
are serious about innovation and real-world impact. You will not only gain
strategic insights from top executives, but also apply them while building
your own venture with expert guidance.

*Apply Now:* https://forms.gle/bwBxE2bufuTgL7mZ9
<https://forms.gle/bwBxE2bufuTgL7mZ9>
*Deadline:* Limited seats available. Applications are reviewed on a rolling
basis.

*Your vision deserves more than a classroom. It deserves a platform.*
This is where it begins.

Best regards,
[image: 20[1].png]

subject: Important instructions for CLUV101 Environmental Sciences university practical examination_May 2025.
snippet: Dear Students, The university practical examination of CLUV101 Environmental Sciences has been scheduled. The timetable of CSPIT and DEPSTAR is attached below for your reference. You are instructed to
content:
Dear Students,

The university practical examination of *CLUV101 Environmental Sciences* has
been scheduled. The timetable of CSPIT and DEPSTAR is attached below for
your reference. You are instructed to follow the below instructions for the
viva:

1. Viva will start sharp at 9:15 AM. So all are instructed to come at 9:00
AM sharp. Latecomers will not be allowed for the viva.
2. The venue for the viva will be room no. 513, environment engineering
lab, first floor, civil engineering department, CSPIT.
3. Carry your hall ticket and ID card; without that, anyone will not be
allowed to attend the viva.
4. Dress well and maintain discipline during the viva.
5. Those who have not completed any of the internal work have to submit
their compensatory work to their respective subject teachers well before
the viva. If you submit your work on the day of your viva, then your viva
will be conducted at last.

You are strictly instructed to adhere to the above-mentioned rules.

Thank You

With Regards
Ms. Hemangi Oza
M. Tech Environmental Engineering
Assistant Professor
Civil Engineering Department
CSPIT CHARUSAT
Changa, Anand.
Mo. No.: 8780473646

--

subject: Shortlisting Confirmed ‚Äì Accenture Verified Internship Program 2025 | CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY
snippet: . Dear Student Charusat University, We are writing to confirm that you have been shortlisted for the Accenture Verified Training & Internship Program 2025. Open to students from all academic years,
content:
I've invited you to fill out the following form:
Transform Your Passion into a Successful Tech Career

To fill it out, visit:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdquD6VG_5zpD5SFORqmXajc0rfISPJdt5IHCG5zKeWOSPoYg/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1&flr=0&usp=mail_form_link

Dear Student Charusat University,

We are writing to confirm that you have been shortlisted for the Accenture  
Verified Training & Internship Program 2025. Open to students from all  
academic years, the program offers structured guidance in resume writing  
(ATS-aligned), interview preparation, and practical training to help you  
align with current industry expectations. This initiative is supported  
through collaboration with organizations such as Accenture, IBM, and Wipro.

If you intend to participate, you are encouraged to complete the  
registration process at your convenience. As participation is being  
confirmed in order of response, an early confirmation will help ensure  
access to the full range of program materials and support.

No further action is required if you have already registered.

Kind regards,
Program Coordination Team
Accenture Verified Training & Internship Program 2025

subject: Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143
snippet: Thanks for filling out Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143 Here's what was received. Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143 Syllabus: Experiment 2, 3, and 4 Email * 24ce138@charusat.edu.in
content:
Google Forms


Thanks for filling out Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143
Here's what was received.


Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143

Syllabus: Experiment 2, 3, and 4


Email *


24ce138@charusat.edu.in


Name *


Shreeja Vipulkumar Vaishnani


Student ID No. *


24CE138


Institute - Deparmtment *


CSPIT - CE



Untitled Section


Determine the frequency bandwidth of the circuit? *
Captionless Image


31.8 Hz


32.3 Hz


142 Hz


31.8 kHz


In series LCR circuit, Capacitive reactance (XC) = Inductive reactance (XL)  
then circuit ________ *


is capacitive


is inductive


is at resonance


draws minimum current


In RLC series resonance circuit, on resonance the following condition will  
be fulfilled, *


V=VR


I = I(min)


Z=R


VL=VC


In the "Study of Resonance in LCR circuit" experiment, the range of  
frequency oscillator was fixed to ____________. *


20Hz to 200Hz


200Hz to 2KHz


2KHz to 20KHz


20KHz to 200KHz


One resistor of 1000 ohm and a capacitor of 12 pF is connected in series.  
then what is the value of time constant. (pF is picoFarade) *


12 ns (n is nano)


1.2 s


12 fs (f is femto)


none


In series RC ckt, a major part of transient is due to resistor only. *


True


false


The time constant of RC ckt becomes __________ with larger value of  
resistor and capacitor *


Larger


shorter


won't change


None of the aboce


The magnitude of energy stored in a capacitor is given by a formula; E =  
(1/2) (C*V^2) *


True


False


In the "Transient Analysis of RC Ckt" experiment, discharing of capacitor's  
voltage has been measured with respect to ____ *


Current


Time


Resistor


None


Which apparatus is not used in the experiment to measure the variation in  
the magnetic field? *


Battery Eliminator


Coil


Reversible Key


Volt meter


Magnetic fields are produced due to __________ *


Stationary charges


Moving charges


Both a and b


None of the above


One coil of radius of R1 is able to produces the magnetic field of B at the  
center of the coil, if radius of the coil is doubled then what will be the  
value of magnetic field. *


0.5 B


4 B


0.25 B


B


The magnetic field density along the axial line of a circular coil carrying  
current is/does *


Zero


Constant


Vary with distance from the center of the coil


not change


Strength of an electromagnet can be increased by *


increasing the number of turns


increasing the cross-sectional area


increasing current supply


all above methods


Resonant circuits are used in tuning of


A radio


A TV set


Both a and b


CD player

sink


ash pit

What is the purpose of fire door in boilers?

It is opened to increase air supply for combustion

How generative artificial intelligence is being leveraged by threat actors
