Adversarial misuse of generative AI: Analysis beyond the hype

Live Webinar - May 15, 2025 at 4:00 PM EDT | 1:00 PM PDT

May 15, 2025

at 4:00 PM EDT | 1:00 PM PDT
Register now
<https://go.cloudplatformonline.com/dc/j-0ZLuKiroz5jBuK2yHK5CJ6ILCpYkKSM2bjwsh0ZRMQWGeonCIIqpEhYE0ycwQp5zliZX7ciSPAjlpccRbKFqvx5lx-Jyj_SUG898ZDn477QCReC6HR4r3n13FDkUkBuVBY1NouHkxwjjD3Z11ExZi4XAg2R5ylNZo1sYxqU0BISMFjoMyNmFbCHqs4pV3KL5G9jKpk9DHcMjxeZbEvB4GZEiKCupnZ64lI0qVNif3NjQuidsj0p5raJ14UR3pQLLi0e0PqYZJjRAvjef8Lm3x-5Qg-T6MitLrLnYBeCWh4HBifAo-rPyA2-Aak5cG7/ODA4LUdKVy0zMTQAAAGaKUvWtr6AASl06eicAURpSlDiyESFNOO01MWKQNcz8ob0uCysvXvBsj0UTstrZr3yVX0jnZI=>

Hi Dr. Priteshkumar,

Amidst the hype surrounding AI-driven cyber threats, what's actually
happening in the wild?

In our upcoming webinar, Adversarial misuse of generative AI: Analysis
beyond the hype
<https://go.cloudplatformonline.com/dc/j-0ZLuKiroz5jBuK2yHK5CJ6ILCpYkKSM2bjwsh0ZRMQWGeonCIIqpEhYE0ycwQp5zliZX7ciSPAjlpccRbKFqvx5lx-Jyj_SUG898ZDn477QCReC6HR4r3n13FDkUkBuVBY1NouHkxwjjD3Z11ExZi4XAg2R5ylNZo1sYxqU0BISMFjoMyNmFbCHqs4pV3KL5G9jKpk9DHcMjxeZbEvB4GZEiKCupnZ64lI0qVNif3NjQuidsj0p5raJ14UR3pQLLi0e0PqYZJjRAvjef8Lm3x-5Qg-T6MitLrLnYBeCWh4HBifAo-rPyA2-Aak5cG7/ODA4LUdKVy0zMTQAAAGaKUvWtr6AASl06eicAURpSlDiyESFNOO01MWKQNcz8ob0uCysvXvBsj0UTstrZr3yVX0jnZI=>,
Google Threat Intelligence experts move beyond theoretical discussions of
abuse of AI, drawing on real-world observations of how government-backed
threat actors have attempted to misuse Google‚Äôs AI-powered assistant Gemini
for cyber attacks and information operations.

Our goal is to shed light on these activities with security professionals
to raise awareness and enable stronger protections for all.

*Topics covered include:*

   - Specific cases of attempted misuse of Gemini by nation-state threat
   actors.
   - How AI is being leveraged across various stages of cyberattacks, from
   initial reconnaissance to post-compromise activities.
   - In-depth analysis of government-backed threat activity and if it
   represents novel or unique AI-enabled attack or abuse techniques.

Speakers

Jamie Collier

Lead Threat Intelligence Advisor (Europe), Google Threat Intelligence Group
[image: Aurora Blum]

Aurora Blum

Threat Intel Analyst, Google Threat Intelligence Group
[image: Bart Inglot]

Bart Inglot

Security Engineer, Google Threat Intelligence Group

Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to stay ahead of the curve in understanding
AI-driven cyber threats.
Register now
<https://go.cloudplatformonline.com/dc/j-0ZLuKiroz5jBuK2yHK5CJ6ILCpYkKSM2bjwsh0ZRMQWGeonCIIqpEhYE0ycwQp5zliZX7ciSPAjlpccRbKFqvx5lx-Jyj_SUG898ZDn477QCReC6HR4r3n13FDkUkBuVBY1NouHkxwjjD3Z11ExZi4XAg2R5ylNZo1sYxqU0BISMFjoMyNmFbCHqs4pV3KL5G9jKpk9DHcMjxeZbEvB4GZEiKCupnZ64lI0qVNif3NjQuidsj0p5raJ14UR3pQLLi0e0PqYZJjRAvjef8Lm3x-5Qg-T6MitLrLnYBeCWh4HBifAo-rPyA2-Aak5cG7/ODA4LUdKVy0zMTQAAAGaKUvWtr6AASl06eicAURpSlDiyESFNOO01MWKQNcz8ob0uCysvXvBsj0UTstrZr3yVX0jnZI=>

subject: Join ‚ÄúFrench For All‚Äù ‚Äì 30-Hour Offline French Language Training at CHARUSAT
snippet: Dear Students, Looking to add an exciting and valuable skill to your profile? The Faculty of Humanities (FoH), CHARUSAT is offering a 30-hour offline interactive training program titled ‚ÄúFrench For All
content:
Dear Students,

Looking to add an exciting and valuable skill to your profile?

The *Faculty of Humanities (FoH), CHARUSAT* is offering a *30-hour offline
interactive training program* titled *‚ÄúFrench For All‚Äù*, from *12th May to
30th May, 2025‚Äî* specially designed for *beginners and language enthusiasts*
.

In today‚Äôs global job market, just having technical or academic skills is
no longer enough. *Learning a foreign language like French can give you a
competitive edge*, opening up new career opportunities, international
exposure, and cultural insights.

This is your chance to:

‚úîÔ∏è ‚Å£Explore the beauty and power of the French language
‚úîÔ∏è Gain a strong foundation in Listening, Speaking, Reading, and Writing
(LSRW)
‚úîÔ∏è Learn in a fun, engaging classroom environment

 *The detailed brochure is attached for your reference.*
üìû For queries, contact *Dr. Vikas Raval* at +91 94293 56638

Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to enhance your future ‚Äî *enroll now and say
‚ÄúBonjour‚Äù to new possibilities!*


Best wishes,
Faculty of Humanities
CHARUSAT


*Kruten Patel*
*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

subject: Reminder: Assignment Submissions for MSUD102
snippet: Dear CE Students, Please note that the deadline for Assignment VI has been extended to 07/05/2025. You may submit it on or before this date. However, all other remaining assignments must be submitted
content:
Dear CE Students,

Please note that the deadline for *Assignment VI *has been extended to
07/05/2025. You may submit it on or before this date. However, all other
remaining assignments must be submitted by tomorrow (01/05/2025) without
exception. If anyone has submitted the wrong file via the provided link,
please resubmit the correct file using a different email ID through the
correct link.

The following students have not yet submitted the assignments listed below:

   - *Assignment-1:* 63, 71, 72, 77, 83, 86, 88, 91, 107, 123
   - *Assignment-2:* 19, 32, 63, 71, 72, 77, 88, 91, 107, 123, 135, 139
   - *Assignment-3: *10, 18, 19, 21, 27, 31, 35, 36, 38, 39, 40, 46, 47,
   50, 51, 54, 55, 56, 57, 58, 63, 65, 67, 68, 69, 71, 72, 77, 78, 80, 81, 83,
   90, 91, 93, 96, 100, 101, 104, 105, 106, 107, 109, 110, 114, 115, 116, 119,
   120, 122, 125, 133, 136, 140
   - *Assignment-4: *11, 19, 20, 21, 25, 27, 29, 32, 33, 38, 47, 57, 63,
   69, 70, 71, 72, 73, 75, 77, 80, 83, 84, 87, 88, 91, 92, 96, 99, 100, 101,
   104, 105, 107, 110, 111, 119, 124, 135
   - *Assignment-5: *32, 63, 71, 72, 77, 88, 91, 123, 135, 137, 139


-- 
With regards,
 Dr. Manoj Prajapati

--

subject: Regarding absence of students in MSUD102 (Section II) extra Lecture
snippet: Dear CE-2 Students, As you know, I had scheduled an extra lecture for MSUD102(Section-II) today from 03:20 to 04:20 PM. However, no students attended the class. I waited outside the classroom for 15
content:
Dear CE-2 Students,
As you know, I had scheduled an extra lecture for MSUD102(Section-II) today
from 03:20 to 04:20 PM. However, no students attended the class. I waited
outside the classroom for 15 minutes. In the previous lecture, I explained
the Binomial Distribution along with one example. The remaining part of
Unit-VI will now be assigned as self-study. Please make sure to review it
on your own.

Best regards,
Dr. Manoj Prajapati

--

   -

   Write your* ID number,* *not your name.*
   -

   If you face any submission issues, please take a* screenshot *
   immediately.
   -

   Ensure you are connected to a good network.
   -

   The time limit will be strictly followed. No submissions will be
   accepted after 11:30 AM.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdbjbf8UNpXQG95zvFgpflxAXPvBbjM9chqP71JHX6UQ2kfSA/viewform?usp=header

subject: Journal + Lab Manual Submission, Notification for Quiz 2
snippet: Dear Students, You must certify your lab manual + Journal with the respective lab-in-charge on/before 2nd May 2025. After this date, no journals will be certified, and you will not be allowed to take
content:
Dear Students,

You must certify your lab manual + Journal with the respective
lab-in-charge on/before 2nd May 2025. After this date, no journals will be
certified, and you will not be allowed to take the practical examinations.

Quiz 2 (of 15 Marks) will be arranged on the 3rd of May 2025, which covers
the questions of Experiments 2, 3, and 4. The timing of the quiz will be
4:30 PM to 5:00 PM, the link will be sent 5 minutes before the exam.

Regards
Sanni

-- 
*Thanks,*



*Sanni, Ph.D.Assistant professorDepartment of Physical Sciences
<https://www.charusat.ac.in/PDPIAS/people/>Faculty of Applied SciencesP D
Patel Institute of Applied Sciences,CHARUSAT

From: Dave Dhyey <dhyey.dave@aiesec.net>
Date: Thu, 24 Apr 2025, 5:18‚ÄØpm
Subject: Looking for a life-changing experience in EGYPT ?
To: <cco@charusat.ac.in>


[image: image]
Looking for a life-changing experience in EGYPT ?

[image: image]


Register Now! <https://www.aiesec.in/global-volunteer>



[image: image]
What are you doing this summer ?

Apply to become a Global Volunteer! A 45days of wonderful experience, a
Certificate from United Nations to boost your CV!
Know More! <https://aiesec.org/opportunity/global-volunteer/1304043>


Register Now! <https://www.aiesec.in/global-volunteer>



[image: image]
CAIRO

Step into Cairo, where the whispers of ancient pharaohs echo through the
pyramids, and the pulse of modern life beats along the Nile üåÖüê´. From
timeless treasures in bustling bazaars to sunset views over minarets, this
city is a vibrant tapestry of history and hustle‚Äîready to dive in? üïåüî•üá™üá¨
[image: image]
ALEXANDRIA

Dive into Alexandria, where the Mediterranean breeze carries tales of ancient
libraries, legendary queens, and timeless charm üåäüìú. Wander through
seaside forts, hidden cafes, and sun-kissed streets‚Äîthis coastal gem blends
history and chill like no other. Ready to get swept away? üèõÔ∏èüåÖüá™üá¨
[image: image]
GIZA

Uncover the magic of Giza, where colossal pyramids rise from golden sands
and the Sphinx guards secrets older than time üê™üî∫. From camel rides at
sunrise to stargazing over ancient wonders, this desert dream is a journey
through history and awe. Ready to step back in time? üååüå¥üá™üá¨


Register Now! <https://www.aiesec.in/global-volunteer>



[image: Link] <https://www.aiesec.in>[image: Email]
<siddharth.patel3804@aiesec.net>[image: Link]

subject: Urgent: Complete Your Login on the Skill-Augmentation Portal
snippet: Dear Students, It has come to our notice that some of you have not yet completed your login process on the Skill-Augmentation Portal. Access to the learning modules on this portal is essential for your
content:
Dear Students,

It has come to our notice that some of you have not yet completed your
login process on the *Skill-Augmentation Portal*. Access to the learning
modules on this portal is essential for your skill development and course
progress.

*Action Required:* Please complete your login process at the earliest.

If you are facing issues such as a forgotten password, you can easily reset
it by clicking on the *"Forgot Password"* link available on the login page.

Kindly treat this as urgent and ensure your access is activated without
delay.

For any technical issues or login-related concerns, feel free to *contact
me directly*.
-- 
*Thanks & Regards,*
*Parmanand Patel*
Assistant Professor,
U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT,Changa,Anand-388421.
www.charusat.ac.in

--

subject: Urgent : Login Instructions for Skill Augmentation Portal
snippet: Dear Students, This is to inform you that due to technical reasons, all user passwords on the Skill Augmentation Portal (https://skill-augmentation.com/) have been reset. We request you to please try
content:
Dear Students,

This is to inform you that due to technical reasons, all user passwords on
the *Skill Augmentation Portal* (*https://skill-augmentation.com/
<https://skill-augmentation.com/>*) have been reset.

We request you to please *try logging in using your old password first*.
If you receive an *"Invalid credentials"* message, kindly click on the *"Forgot
Password"* link and reset your password.

üîó *Login here:* https://skill-augmentation.com/

Your prompt action is appreciated. If you continue to face any issues
during login, feel free to reach out for assistance.

Thank you for your cooperation.

--

hod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, HOD AIML <hod.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, HOD Depstar <
hodds@charusat.ac.in>, Head EC CHARUSAT <hod.ec@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Head IT CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>, Principal C.S.Patel Institute
of Technology <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>, Principal DEPSTAR <
principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>, Dean FTE CHARUSAT <
dean.fte@charusat.ac.in>, Principal CMPICA CHARUSAT <
principal.cmpica@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir/Madam,

Please share the email below with your students to get benefit as an
EC-Council Academia Partner.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Dear students,

*EC-Council has launched Hackerverse **Capture the Flag (CTF) challenge**.
Find the details below and register using your CHARUSAT email id for the
same.*

Hackerverse is a global cybersecurity competition ecosystem designed by
EC-Council to support and advance the cybersecurity community worldwide.
Rooted in EC-Council‚Äôs longstanding commitment to empowering cybersecurity
professionals worldwide, Hackerverse provides a competitive arena for
individuals across all proficiency levels to demonstrate their skills
through rigorous, gamified *Capture the Flag (CTF) challenges*.

Hackerverse was officially unveiled at Hacker Halted 2022, EC-Council‚Äôs
annual cybersecurity conference that unites ethical hackers, security
professionals, and industry leaders from across the globe. A platform for
thought leadership and technical exchange, Hacker Halted serves as a
convergence point for innovation, research, and discourse on emerging cyber
threats and defense strategies.

Hackerverse has helped EC-Council to broaden its impact, transitioning from
localized cybersecurity competitions to a truly global competitive
platform. *Through Hackerverse CTF, a year-long, free-to-enter Capture the
Flag (CTF) challenge on Hackerverse, cybersecurity professionals and
enthusiasts from around the world can now test their skills on a much
larger stage. *The competition features a dynamic scoring system that
rewards participants for speed and precision, reflecting the high-stakes
nature of cybersecurity. *With over $100,000 in prizes, it represents
EC-Council‚Äôs commitment to supporting and rewarding cybersecurity talent
worldwide.*

As cyber threats continue to evolve, Hackerverse remains a dynamic proving
ground, ensuring that the next generation of cybersecurity professionals is
prepared to meet the challenges of an increasingly complex digital
landscape.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
Subject: EC-Council | Invites Students for Monthly Cybercompetitions
To: priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in <priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in>


*What is the Hackerverse?*

‚ÄúThe Hackerverse‚Äù (hacker universe) is an environment consisting of
gamified cybersecurity knowledge and skills-based competitions designed to
support individuals, whether they are aspiring, new, or seasoned
professionals in the cybersecurity field.

[image: A screenshot of a video game AI-generated content may be incorrect.]

*The Hackerverse CTF*

The Hackerverse CTF is a free, global Capture the Flag competition offering
monthly rotating challenges across the latest topics and skills valued by
industry and employers. Participants may compete monthly for cash and
in-kind prizes awarded to players achieving top scores on the leaderboard.

[image: A diagram of a business strategy AI-generated content may be
incorrect.]

*Who Can Register?*

The Hackerverse CTF is open to players ages 14 and up. Any student or
professional who wishes to participate may do so.

[image: A blurry image of a computer AI-generated content may be incorrect.]

*Grow and Validate Your Cybersecurity Skills*

Participants within the Hackerverse CTF will be able to showcase their
skills and talent, completing a series of carefully designed questions that
get progressively more difficult. Players will compete against a global
network for prizes and top rankings. The primary focus of the Hackerverse
CTF is to get more participants engaged in cybersecurity competitions,
leading to increased knowledge and skill development.

<https://hackerverse.com/>

[image: A red background with white text and white text AI-generated
content may be incorrect.]

*Your Cybersecurity Skill Development Starts Now!*

Registration for the Hackerverse CTF is currently open. To find out more
about the Hackerverse cybersecurity competitions and engagements, please
visit www.hackerverse.com.

<https://hackerverse.com/>

content:
*Round 2 Result & Round 3 Details ‚Äì Coder‚Äôs Arcade 2.0*

Dear Participants,
Greetings from the *CP SQUAD Team*!

Thank you for your enthusiastic participation in *Round 2: Logic
Sprint* of *Coder‚Äôs
Arcade 2.0*. We were truly impressed by the overwhelming response and
commendable efforts showcased by all teams.

We are excited to announce that the *Top 15 teams* have been shortlisted to
move forward to the *Final Round: Code Relay*.
------------------------------

üî∏ *Round 3: Code Relay*
üìÖ *Date:* 23rd April 2025 (Tomorrow)
üïê *Reporting & Briefing Session:* 9:10 AM sharp
üìç *Venue:* 638 Lab, A7 Building
*‚ö†Ô∏è Further details and instructions for the round will be shared during
the briefing session.*
------------------------------

Please find attached the list of the *Top 15 Teams* selected for the final
round. Kindly check to see if your team has qualified.

We look forward to welcoming you to Round 3 ‚Äì gear up for an exciting
finale that will test your *logic*, *speed*, and *teamwork*! üí°üíªüî•

Warm regards,
*CP SQUAD Team*
*Department of IT, CSPIT*

snippet: Round 1 Result & Round 2 Details ‚Äì Coder's Arcade 2.0 Dear Participants, Greetings from the CP SQUAD Team! Thank you for your enthusiastic participation in Round 1: The Debug Dash of
content:
*Round 1 Result & Round 2 Details ‚Äì Coder‚Äôs Arcade 2.0*

Dear Participants,
Greetings from the *CP SQUAD Team!*

Thank you for your enthusiastic participation in *Round 1: The Debug Dash*
 of *Coder‚Äôs Arcade 2.0.* We were thrilled to witness such an overwhelming
response and commendable performances from all teams.

We are pleased to announce that the *top 50 teams* have been shortlisted to
advance to *Round 2: Logic Sprint*.

üî∏ *Round 2: Logic Sprint*
üìÖ *Date:* 22nd April 2025 (Today)
üïê *Briefing Session:* 1:15 PM sharp
üìç *Venue:* Second Floor Seminar Hall, A6 Building
‚ö†Ô∏è *Attendance is mandatory for all shortlisted team members. Further
instructions about the round, its timing, and venue will be shared during
the briefing.*

Please find attached the list of the *Top 50 Teams* selected for the next
round. Kindly check to see if your team has made it.

*We look forward to seeing you in Round 2 ‚Äî get ready for another exciting
challenge filled with logic, speed, and strategy! üí°üß†üíª*

Warm regards,
*CP SQUAD Team*
*Department of IT, CSPIT*

subject: Video Lectures on Engineering Curves
snippet: Dear Students, I've included the video lectures (links) on Engineering Curves below. Please watch the videos and if you face any queries about it, then please contact me. I will discuss this
content:
Dear Students,

I've included the video lectures (links) on *Engineering Curves* below.
Please watch the videos and if you face any queries about it, then please
contact me. I will discuss this portion at the last (may be online/as per
the time availability).

Engineering Curves:
*a. Ellipse*
1. Arc of Circle Method : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i-RDscDFnag
2. Concentric Circle Method: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BXdjqfeDz_g
3. Rectangle Method/Oblong Method:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sd4Lgylx9Mw&t=189s

*b. Parabola*
1. Rectangle Method: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WjUcz0SQ4ZM

*c. Hyperbola*
1. Rectangle Method: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pe6zAeG3V_g&t=4s


---
With Regards,

*Dr. Sagar Chokshi,*

Faculty of Technology & Engineering,

subject: Regarding the submission of Assignments
snippet: Dear CE students, As you are aware, the submission of assignments is an essential component of your overall assessment for Engineering Mathematics-II(MSUD102). Please find the link for submission of
content:
Dear CE students,
As you are aware, the submission of assignments is an essential component
of your overall assessment for Engineering Mathematics-II(MSUD102). Please
find the link for submission of each assignment.

Last date of submission of assignments-I, II, IV, V: 27/04/2025
Last date of submission of assignments-III and VI:     30/04/2025

Instructions:

   1. The name of the file must be 24CEXXX.
   2. Write your Id number (hand written only) on top of each page of the
   assignment.
   3. Please attach the properly scanned each and every page, and generate
   one pdf file for Each Assignment.


Link for Assignments:

   -  Assignment-I(Unit-I) <https://forms.gle/dyT2GtHpaX2vmoEw6>
   - Assignment-II(Unit-II) <https://forms.gle/Bncw9HvqHavabgfD9>
   - Assignment-III(Unit-III) <https://forms.gle/ynhhV896saVdyfav8>
   - Assignment-IV(Unit-IV) <https://forms.gle/CWDEz8cpmk5AXFKL6>
   - Assignment-V(Unit-V) <https://forms.gle/RKTptDiYDfnuMyRq9>
   - Assignment-VI(Unit-VI) <https://forms.gle/YuLFDkLv9btv8Kow6>


With regards,
Dr. Manoj Prajapati

 Assistant Professor
 Department of Mathematical Sciences,
 P. D. Patel Institute of Applied Sciences,
 Charotar University of Science & Technology,
 Changa-388421, Gujarat, India.
(M): +91-97171317435

subject: MEUD101 Elements of Engineering - Submission guidelines
snippet: Dear All, The submission process for the subject MEUD101 - Elements of Engineering is as follows: For Engineering Graphics Sheets: 1. Students must submit their A2-size drawing sheets and binders on
content:
Dear All,

The submission process for the subject MEUD101 - Elements of Engineering is
as follows:

For Engineering Graphics Sheets:

1. Students must submit their A2-size drawing sheets and  binders on both
sides.
Sequence is as follows: Binder - Sheet - 1 - Sheet - 2 - Binder
All the sheets should be of A2 size.
[image: image.png]


2. Colour code of the binder is as follows:

Department Institute Colour Code
CE CSPIT & DEPSTAR YELLOW
CSE CSPIT & DEPSTAR BLUE
IT CSPIT & DEPSTAR GREEN
AIML CSPIT BLACK
EC CSPIT PINK

3. No need to stick the Certificate and Index on the binder.
(as the certificate and index are already available in your lab manual)

4. At the time of Practical Exam (Viva) students have to bring Lab
Sketchbook (signed by faculty), Sheets as mentioned above, Assignment
sketch book (signed by class teacher), Lab manual and assignment of
Mechanical & Civil.


You can contact your respective lab/lecture faculties for submission.

Radhika madam is requested to forward this email to DEPSTAR students.

Regards,


Vikas Panchal

Assistant Professor

Mechanical Engineering | CSPIT, CHARUSAT
8866286233
vikaspanchal.me@charusat.ac.in
CHARUSAT Campus, Changa, Gujarat 388421

content:
Dear Students,

We have successfully organized the event. The dedication and work showcased
by you is commendable. Keep doing such things.

The jury members have decided top projects. There is no rank, but we will
declare Top-5 projects among all the presented projects.

All of you are requested to be at 2nd floor, A6 building seminar Hall from
2.20 to 2.35 today. After that, you need to approach to your Lab session.

Thank You

subject: Seating Arrangement - FTE: B.Tech-II External Exam Starting from 17th May, 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Students are required to adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in the email attachment. Students are required to uphold decorum in the examination hall. Mobile phones, smartwatches,
content:
Dear Students,

Students are required to adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in the
email attachment. Students are required to uphold decorum in
the examination hall. Mobile phones, smartwatches, or any other electronic
devices are strictly prohibited within the exam hall. Bags must be left
outside, and it is mandatory to wear an ID card. Students have to take
their seat in the exam hall at least 15 minutes prior to the exam time.

The exam will take place in Exam Hall 201 (1st floor)  and Exam Hall 301
(2nd floor) of Multi Utility Complex.


Thank you.
Dhaval Bhoi
Assistant Professor,
U & P U. Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT, Changa.
Ta-Petlad Dist.Anand
PIN-388421 GUJARAT, INDIA

--

your Team ID*, as it will serve as your identity throughout all the rounds
of the contest.
üìå Important Update:

   -

   *Round 1 will be "The Debug Dash"* (instead of Logic Sprint).
   -

   *Date:* 22nd April 2025 (Tuesday)
   -

   *Platform:* HackerRank
   -

   *Login Credentials:* Will be provided by us before the contest
   -

   *Venue:* As per the attached file

To ensure *smooth coordination and timely updates*, kindly *join the
official WhatsApp group <https://chat.whatsapp.com/JtADarh9jtp2ycJTUyqtzf>*.

We request you to *strictly adhere to the schedule*. For any queries or
clarifications, feel free to reach out to us.

All the best, coders! Let the Arcade begin! üöÄüíª

snippet: Please find solutions for Booklet-A and Booklet-B. On Wed, Apr 16, 2025 at 5:25 PM Manoj Prajapati <manojprajapati.maths@charusat.ac.in> wrote: Dear CE Students, Please find the continuous
content:
Please find solutions for Booklet-A and Booklet-B.

On Wed, Apr 16, 2025 at 5:25‚ÄØPM Manoj Prajapati <
manojprajapati.maths@charusat.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear CE Students,
> Please find the continuous evaluation test(Booklet-A and Booklet-B) paper.
>
> With regards,
> *Dr. Manoj Prajapati*
>
> On Mon, Apr 14, 2025 at 11:15‚ÄØAM Manoj Prajapati <
> manojprajapati.maths@charusat.ac.in> wrote:
>
>> Dear CE Students,
>>
>> As you are aware, the continuous evaluation examination is an essential
>> component of your overall assessment in the subject. I have scheduled a
>> 10-marks Continuous Evaluation test for *MSUD102 (Engineering
>> Mathematics-II)* on *Wednesday, 16th April 2025*, during my lecture.
>> Please note that *no makeup test will be conducted*. If you miss the
>> exam, your score will be recorded as zero.
>>
>> Please also find the syllabus and examination pattern for your reference.
>>
>> *Syllabus:*
>>
>> *Unit 2:*
>>
>>    - Methods for finding particular integrals: variation of parameters
>>    and undetermined coefficients
>>    - Linear differential equations of higher order with variable
>>    coefficients: Legendre‚Äôs Equation (Special case: Cauchy‚ÄìEuler equation)
>>    - System of simultaneous first-order linear differential equations
>>
>> *Unit 5:*
>>
>>    - Changing the order of double integration
>>    - Transformation to polar coordinates
>>    - Applications of double integrals: Area
>>    - Evaluation of triple integrals
>>    - Transformation to cylindrical coordinates
>>    - Applications of triple integrals: Volume
>>
>> *Exam Pattern:*
>>
>>    -
>>
>>    1 Long question from *Unit II* (04 marks)
>>    -
>>
>>    1 Long question from *Unit V* (06 marks)
>>
>> *Timings:*
>>
>>    -
>>
>>    *CE-1:* 12:10 PM ‚Äì 01:10 PM   Offline (During Regular Class)
>>    -
>>
>>    *CE-2:* 01:10 PM ‚Äì 02:10 PM   Offline (During Regular Class)
>>
>>
>> If you have any queries regarding the exam, please feel free to contact
>> me.
>>
>>
>> Best regards,
>> *Dr. Manoj Prajapati*
>>  Assistant Professor
>>  Department of Mathematical Sciences,
>>  P. D. Patel Institute of Applied Sciences,
>>  Charotar University of Science & Technology,
>>  Changa-388421, Gujarat, India.
>> (M): +91-97171317435
>>
>>
>
> --

subject: Regarding extra lectures for Engineering Maths-II(Section-II)
snippet: Dear CE1 and CE2 Students, As you are aware, we need to arrange extra lectures to complete the syllabus for MSUD102: Engineering Mathematics-II (Section-II: Unit-VI). Therefore, I will be conducting
content:
Dear CE1 and CE2 Students,

As you are aware, we need to arrange extra lectures to complete the
syllabus for MSUD102: Engineering Mathematics-II (Section-II: Unit-VI).
Therefore, I will be conducting *lectures during all upcoming tutorial
sessions*. This has already been discussed with the respective tutorial
faculty. The classroom details are as follows:

*Classroom*
*CE-1:* 310
*CE-2:* 304

With regards,
Dr. Manoj Prajapati

 Assistant Professor
 Department of Mathematical Sciences,
 P. D. Patel Institute of Applied Sciences,
 Charotar University of Science & Technology,
 Changa-388421, Gujarat, India.
(M): +91-97171317435

subject: Fwd: Coder‚Äôs Arcade 2.0 ‚Äì University-Level Coding Contest | Prizes Worth ‚Çπ24,000
snippet: Dear Students, Students are encouraged to participate in the competition. We expect maximum participation in Coder's Arcade 2.0. All the best and give your best ---------- Forwarded message -------
content:
Dear Students,

Students are encouraged to participate in the competition.

We expect maximum participation in Coder's Arcade 2.0.

All the best and give your best



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: CPSQUAD CHARUSAT <cpsquad@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Apr 17, 2025, 8:39 PM
Subject: Coder‚Äôs Arcade 2.0 ‚Äì University-Level Coding Contest | Prizes
Worth ‚Çπ24,000
To: <24cs@charusat.edu.in>, <24ce@charusat.edu.in>, <24it@charusat.edu.in>,
<24aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <24ec@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Nishat Shaikh <nishatshaikh.it@charusat.ac.in>, Head CSE <
hod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, Head CE CHARUSAT <hod.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Head IT
CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>, HOD AIML <hod.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, Head
EC CHARUSAT <hod.ec@charusat.ac.in>, Dr. Priyanka Patel <
priyankapatel.it@charusat.ac.in>, Jaimin Undavia <
jaiminundavia.mca@charusat.ac.in>, IT <it@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear First Year Students of IT, CE, CSE,AIML,EC and CMPICA,*

Are you ready to challenge your logic and coding skills?

The *Department of Information Technology, CSPIT, CHARUSAT*, in
collaboration with *CP Squad Club*, proudly presents:

üéÆ *Coder‚Äôs Arcade 2.0*
*A University-Level Competitive Programming Contest*
üóì *April 22‚Äì23, 2025* | üïò *From 9:10 AM onwards*
------------------------------
üí° What‚Äôs in it for you?

A thrilling *three-round C/C++ programming competition* where *logic beats
speed*, and smart coders rise to the top!

üëë *Amazing Prizes Await:*

   -

   ü•á *Winner Team:* ‚Çπ12,000 + Certificates
   -

   ü•à *First Runner-Up:* ‚Çπ7,500 + Certificates
   -

   ü•â *Second Runner-Up:* ‚Çπ4,500 + Certificates
   -

   üèÖ *All Participants:* Receive a Participation Certificate

------------------------------
üìã Contest Format & Details

   -

   *Team Size:* 3 members (cross-department teams *not allowed*)
   -

   *Only the first 100 teams* will be allowed to participate ‚Äì hurry and
   secure your slot!

*Round 1:* Logic Sprint
*Round 2:* The Debug Dash
*Round 3:* Code Relay

üìå *Venue:* Will be announced soon
üõë *Last Date to Register:* *April 19, 2025 (12:30 PM)*
------------------------------
üñä How to Register?

Register quickly via the link or scan the QR code on the attached poster:

üîó Register here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSflJYAXhWX13cR0I7y7O11-FnAlqd_AfboN254hzzKyzzjCuQ/viewform?usp=dialog>

‚ö†Ô∏è *Note:* Registration closes as soon as 100 teams register or the
deadline ends‚Äîwhichever is earlier.

------------------------------

*Don‚Äôt miss this chance to shine in front of your peers, test your coding
strength, and bring glory to your team!*
Gear up, team up, and show us what you‚Äôve got! üöÄüíª

We‚Äôre excited to see you at *Coder‚Äôs Arcade 2.0!*

Warm Regards,
*CP Squad Club*
*Department of IT, CSPIT, CHARUSAT*
------------------------------

--

subject: DE Video presentation instructions and deadline
snippet: Dear Students, You have a presentation as one of the components. It is having 10 Marks. This is an individual task. First you need to approve the topic of the presentation for that fill up the google
content:
Dear Students,

You have a presentation as one of the components. It is having 10 Marks.
This is an individual task.

First you need to approve the topic of the presentation for that fill up
the google form below. The presentation topic must be unique and to check
that the response sheet is shared in which you can check whether someone
has taken that topic or not.

*Form Link: https://forms.gle/BttCer3HLGxo92jw7
<https://forms.gle/BttCer3HLGxo92jw7>*
Deadline: 24th April 2025

You can check the response of the above form using the link below. The
definitions which are approved will be highlighted Green and those which
are rejected will be highlighted in yellow.

*Response
Link: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1YL5cO9sncvcOC3PvvH7GGlsUomFkOXyu-1LCYbHayAE/edit?usp=sharing
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1YL5cO9sncvcOC3PvvH7GGlsUomFkOXyu-1LCYbHayAE/edit?usp=sharing>*
Deadline: 24th April 2025

Students, whose topic is approved, need to prepare a video of  5 minutes
minimum and upload it to your YouTube channel. This link you need to
provide in the Google form below. Your face must be visible in
the bottom right corner.

The evaluation criteria are as below:
Video uploaded on YouTube without any copyright issue.
Content of the presentation
Proper video presentation

Once your video is live on YouTube fill up below google form.

*Form Link: https://forms.gle/dfNxvZNbvEWBZTndA
<https://forms.gle/dfNxvZNbvEWBZTndA>*
Deadline: 30th April 2025

Thank You
Ronak N. Patel

snippet: Dear students, Kindly find the attached assignment-2 for PC++. Kindly write it in your notebooks. You are requested to collect your assignment-1 books from respective class faculties. Deadline to

subject: Re: Continuous Evaluation Test for MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics-II)
snippet: Dear CE Students, Please find the continuous evaluation test(Booklet-A and Booklet-B) paper. With regards, Dr. Manoj Prajapati On Mon, Apr 14, 2025 at 11:15 AM Manoj Prajapati <manojprajapati.maths@
content:
Dear CE Students,
Please find the continuous evaluation test(Booklet-A and Booklet-B) paper.

With regards,
*Dr. Manoj Prajapati*

On Mon, Apr 14, 2025 at 11:15‚ÄØAM Manoj Prajapati <
manojprajapati.maths@charusat.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear CE Students,
>
> As you are aware, the continuous evaluation examination is an essential
> component of your overall assessment in the subject. I have scheduled a
> 10-marks Continuous Evaluation test for *MSUD102 (Engineering
> Mathematics-II)* on *Wednesday, 16th April 2025*, during my lecture.
> Please note that *no makeup test will be conducted*. If you miss the
> exam, your score will be recorded as zero.
>
> Please also find the syllabus and examination pattern for your reference.
>
> *Syllabus:*
>
> *Unit 2:*
>
>    - Methods for finding particular integrals: variation of parameters
>    and undetermined coefficients
>    - Linear differential equations of higher order with variable
>    coefficients: Legendre‚Äôs Equation (Special case: Cauchy‚ÄìEuler equation)
>    - System of simultaneous first-order linear differential equations
>
> *Unit 5:*
>
>    - Changing the order of double integration
>    - Transformation to polar coordinates
>    - Applications of double integrals: Area
>    - Evaluation of triple integrals
>    - Transformation to cylindrical coordinates
>    - Applications of triple integrals: Volume
>
> *Exam Pattern:*
>
>    -
>
>    1 Long question from *Unit II* (04 marks)
>    -
>
>    1 Long question from *Unit V* (06 marks)
>
> *Timings:*
>
>    -
>
>    *CE-1:* 12:10 PM ‚Äì 01:10 PM   Offline (During Regular Class)
>    -
>
>    *CE-2:* 01:10 PM ‚Äì 02:10 PM   Offline (During Regular Class)
>
>
> If you have any queries regarding the exam, please feel free to contact
> me.
>
>
> Best regards,
> *Dr. Manoj Prajapati*
>  Assistant Professor
>  Department of Mathematical Sciences,
>  P. D. Patel Institute of Applied Sciences,
>  Charotar University of Science & Technology,
>  Changa-388421, Gujarat, India.
> (M): +91-97171317435
>
>

-- 
With regards,
 Dr. Manoj Prajapati

 Assistant Professor
 Department of Mathematical Sciences,
 P. D. Patel Institute of Applied Sciences,
 Charotar University of Science & Technology,
 Changa-388421, Gujarat, India.
(M): +91-97171317435

Vidwan Profile: https://vidwan.inflibnet.ac.in/profile/237322
Website: https://sites.google.com/view/manojprajapati

--

snippet: Dear Students, Please take a look at the Examination Guidelines and follow them strictly. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: COE Exam <coe.exam@charusat.ac.in> Date: Tue, Apr 15, 2025
content:
Dear Students,

Please take a look at the Examination Guidelines and follow them strictly.
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: COE Exam <coe.exam@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Apr 15, 2025 at 9:32‚ÄØPM
Subject: Important : Issues observed during the ongoing examination sessions
To: Examcell ARIP <examcell.arip@charusat.ac.in>, Exam Cell - IIIM <
exam.iiim@charusat.ac.in>, Exam Pharmacy <exam.ph@charusat.ac.in>, Hardik
I. Patel <hardikipatel.mca@charusat.ac.in>, Janki Patel <
jankipatel.bio@charusat.ac.in>, kanan gamit <kanangamit.ph@charusat.ac.in>,
Dipak Ramoliya <dipakramoliya.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Dhaval Bhoi <
dhavalbhoi.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Karan Morje <karanmorje.cips@charusat.ac.in>,
Sumam Sunny <sumamsunny.phy@charusat.ac.in>, Rameshwari Zala <
rameshwarisolanki.nur@charusat.ac.in>, Kirti Patel <
kirtipatel.mba@charusat.ac.in>, Head CE Depstar <hod.ceds@charusat.ac.in>,
Head IT CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>, Head CE CHARUSAT <
hod.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Head EC CHARUSAT <hod.ec@charusat.ac.in>, Head
Civil CHARUSAT <hod.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Head IT DEPSTAR CHARUSAT <
hod.itds@charusat.ac.in>, Head CSE <hod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, Head
Electrical CHARUSAT <hod.ee@charusat.ac.in>, Head Mechanical CHARUSAT <
hod.me@charusat.ac.in>, HOD AIML <hod.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, Head CSE
DEPSTAR CHARUSAT <hod.csds@charusat.ac.in>, Principal CMPICA CHARUSAT <
principal.cmpica@charusat.ac.in>, Principal DEPSTAR <
principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>, Principal C.S.Patel Institute of
Technology <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>, Principal PDPIAS CHARUSAT <
principal.pdpias@charusat.ac.in>, Principal RPCP CHARUSAT <
principal.rpcp@charusat.ac.in>, Principal MTIN CHARUSAT <
principal.mtin@charusat.ac.in>, Principal ARIP <
principal.arip@charusat.ac.in>, Principal CIPS <
principal.cips@charusat.ac.in>, Principal IIIM - CHARUSAT <
principal.iiim@charusat.ac.in>, Dean FCA CHARUSAT <dean.fca@charusat.ac.in>,
Dean FAS CHARUSAT <dean.fas@charusat.ac.in>, Dean FMD CHARUSAT <
dean.fmd@charusat.ac.in>, Dean FMS CHARUSAT <dean.fms@charusat.ac.in>, Dean
FTE CHARUSAT <dean.fte@charusat.ac.in>, Dean FPH CHARUSAT <
dean.fph@charusat.ac.in>, Dean FOH <dean.foh@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Atul Patel <atulpatel.mca@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Madam/Sir,

This is to inform you that several issues have been observed during the
ongoing examination sessions. In order to maintain discipline, the
following rules will be strictly enforced starting *tomorrow*:

   1.

   *Late Entry Not Allowed*:
   Students must occupy their seats *at least 15 minutes before* the start
   of the examination.
   *The exam hall gates will be closed 10 minutes prior* to the scheduled
   exam time. Latecomers will *not be allowed* to enter or attempt the exam
   under any circumstances.
   2.

   *Misuse of ID Cards ‚Äì Strict Action*:
   If any student is found engaging in *malpractice*, such as using someone
   else‚Äôs ID card then it will be considered as a UFM case and *strict
   disciplinary action will be taken*. This may include *cancellation of
   admission* from the university.
   In case a student does *not have their ID card* for any valid reason,
   they must obtain *prior written permission* from their *HOD or the
   Principal*.
   3.

   *Mobile Phone & Study Material in Bag-Drop Zone*:
   Students have been found *using mobile phones and reading notes* in
the *bag-drop
   zone*.
   All mobile phones, smart watches, head/ear phones, electronic devices
   and study material must be *kept in bags before entering through the
   main gate (ground floor)*.
   4.

   *Unpaid Fees ‚Äì Not allowed in Exam*:
   Some students have still not paid their fees. *Such students will not be
   allowed to appear for the exams from tomorrow onwards.* Please ensure
   all dues are cleared immediately. HOD/ Principal / Dean can generate the
   list of students having pending fees from e-Governance.

*We request all HOD/ Principal/ Dean /Exam Coordinator  to inform their
students to strictly follow the above rules to avoid any disciplinary
action.*

-- 
COE, Exam Section
Charotar University of Science and Technology

--

subject: Fwd: The largest hackathons in India - 'Odoo Hackathon 2025'
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Hemant Yadav <hemantyadav.it@charusat.ac.in> Date: Tue, Apr 15, 2025 at 4:36 PM Subject: Fwd: The largest hackathons in India - 'Odoo Hackathon
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Hemant Yadav <hemantyadav.it@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, Apr 15, 2025 at 4:36‚ÄØPM
Subject: Fwd: The largest hackathons in India - 'Odoo Hackathon 2025'
To: Amit Thakkar <amitthakkar.it@charusat.ac.in>, Amit Nayak <
amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in>, Nirav Bhatt <niravbhatt.it@charusat.ac.in>,
Nikita Bhatt <nikitabhatt.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Dr Dweepna Garg <
dweepnagarg.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Chirag Patel <
chirag.p.patel@ganpatuniversity.ac.in>
Cc: Head IT CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>


Dear sir/madam,

Kindly forward information about odoo hackathon. Details are on trailing
email.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Hemant Yadav <hemantyadav.it@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Tue, 15 Apr, 2025, 4:30 pm
Subject: The largest hackathons in India - 'Odoo Hackathon 2025'
To: <21it@charusat.edu.in>, <22it@charusat.edu.in>, <23it@charusat.edu.in>,
<24it@charusat.edu.in>, IT <it@charusat.ac.in>, Mrugendra Rahevar <
mrugendrarahevar.ce@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Head IT CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>


Greetings from Odoo India Headquarters!

We are pleased to inform you that Odoo will be organising one of the
largest hackathons in India - 'Odoo Hackathon 2025' on 11 - 12 August 2025.
This hackathon is aimed at identifying and nurturing top talent from across
the country with transforming recruitment methods, and we would be honoured
to have your institution participate.

This hackathon presents a valuable opportunity for final and pre-final year
students to demonstrate their technical skills and potentially secure
internship and job opportunities at Odoo (subject to eligibility).



Hackathon Timeline:

06 July 2025 (11:30 PM): Last date for registration

12 July 2025: First Round (Conducted Virtually)

18 July 2025 (7:00 PM): Announcement of Top 250 Teams

11 - 12 August 2025: Final Round (Offline) at Gandhinagar, Gujarat



For further details and to register, please visit:
https://www.odoo.com/event/odoo-hackathon-2025-7644/register

--

subject: Continuous Evaluation Test for MSUD102 (Engineering Mathematics-II)
snippet: Dear CE Students, As you are aware, the continuous evaluation examination is an essential component of your overall assessment in the subject. I have scheduled a 10-marks Continuous Evaluation test for
content:
Dear CE Students,

As you are aware, the continuous evaluation examination is an essential
component of your overall assessment in the subject. I have scheduled a
10-marks Continuous Evaluation test for *MSUD102 (Engineering
Mathematics-II)* on *Wednesday, 16th April 2025*, during my lecture. Please
note that *no makeup test will be conducted*. If you miss the exam, your
score will be recorded as zero.

Please also find the syllabus and examination pattern for your reference.

*Syllabus:*

*Unit 2:*

   - Methods for finding particular integrals: variation of parameters and
   undetermined coefficients
   - Linear differential equations of higher order with variable
   coefficients: Legendre‚Äôs Equation (Special case: Cauchy‚ÄìEuler equation)
   - System of simultaneous first-order linear differential equations

*Unit 5:*

   - Changing the order of double integration
   - Transformation to polar coordinates
   - Applications of double integrals: Area
   - Evaluation of triple integrals
   - Transformation to cylindrical coordinates
   - Applications of triple integrals: Volume

*Exam Pattern:*

   -

   1 Long question from *Unit II* (04 marks)
   -

   1 Long question from *Unit V* (06 marks)

*Timings:*

   -

   *CE-1:* 12:10 PM ‚Äì 01:10 PM   Offline (During Regular Class)
   -

   *CE-2:* 01:10 PM ‚Äì 02:10 PM   Offline (During Regular Class)


If you have any queries regarding the exam, please feel free to contact me.


Best regards,
*Dr. Manoj Prajapati*
 Assistant Professor
 Department of Mathematical Sciences,
 P. D. Patel Institute of Applied Sciences,
 Charotar University of Science & Technology,
 Changa-388421, Gujarat, India.
(M): +91-97171317435

--

subject: Student ID 24ce138, Congratulations on getting Shortlisted for the Internship!
snippet: Dear Student ID 24ce138, Congratulations on getting Shortlisted for the Internship! Launched Global organizing a 2-Month Training + Internship Program with certifications from MNCs in both technical
content:
*Dear Student ID *24ce138*, Congratulations on getting Shortlisted for the
Internship! *

*Launched Global organizing a 2-Month Training + Internship Program with
certifications from MNCs in both technical and non-technical domains. *

 * We are thrilled to announce the Internship and Placement Assistance for
the students, all over India. *

*Students Kindly Go Through All The Information Which Is Mentioned In the
Description Of the  Google Form, **Before Filling the Form:*

*Application Form: *https://forms.gle/4fSnWATch4qMfFsb8
<https://forms.gle/C5UnCQw7uGMQdFk98>

*Certifications/Internships Reports can be submitted to the departments for
the Academic Credit Points.*
*Program Highlights*

*Immer**sive Training Sessions:*

   - Dive into an *exceptional learning experience*, curated by
   professionals from *MAANG companies*, each bringing over *10 years of
   industry expertise*.
   - The program offers *80+ hours of high-quality content*, spread
across *25-30
   dynamic modules*, designed to equip you with cutting-edge skills.

          *  (Login credentials will be provided to the students after
registration)*

* Hands-On Internship under MNCs:*

   - Get deployed directly with one of our partner *MNCs*, where you‚Äôll
   work on *10+ live projects*, solving real-world challenges.
   - Collaborate with industry professionals, gaining valuable practical
   experience and a deeper understanding of your field.
   - *All data, tools, and resources for the projects will be provided by
   the company, ensuring you're set up for success from day one.*

*Post-Program Benefits:*

   - Program completion certificate issued by* Launched Global*
   - Co-branded* Internship Certificate from Top MNCs*
   - Admittance to a *growing community*.
   - *Low-Code and No-Code Tools* training.
   - *100% Outcome-Driven Results*.
   - Curriculum includes *Generative AI and Prompt Engineering*.
   - *Exclusive Masterclasses* with Founders and CXOs of Top Global
   Companies.
   - *Personalized mentorship* for proper guidance.

*We look forward to your active participation in the Training and
Internship Program. This is an excellent chance for you to broaden your
horizons and take a step towards a successful career. For any inquiries or
assistance, feel free to contact us.*

*SHASWATA GUPTA*
*KEY ACCOUNT MANAGER*

subject: INFO!! CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY NOTICE "APPLY FOR IIT COLLABORATED INTERNSHIP"
snippet: Dear Students of Charusat University ( 1st yr ) [ IMPORTANT] Salutations! Launch ED in collaboration with IIT KHARAGPUR KSHITIJ and are organizing a 2 Months Training + Internship program with
content:
*Dear Students of Charusat University*
*( 1st yr )*
*[ IMPORTANT]*



*Salutations!*

*Launch ED *in collaboration with *IIT KHARAGPUR  KSHITIJ *and are
organizing a 2 Months Training + Internship program with certifications
from *CISCO, META* & various other MNCs' s in technical and non-technical
domains. We are enrolling *SHORTLISTED STUDENTS *in the program for
Charusat UNIVERSITY

*Note: If any of your batchmates are missed or haven't received
the notification, recipients are allowed to send this mail to them.*
*LAST 9 SCHOLARSHIP SEAT ARE LEFT*
https://forms.gle/EqAvdBZn1TbB8GJu9

*Students must submit their application. After getting shortlisted, you
will be getting a response from our HR Team:*




*FIND THE BELOW ATTACHMENTS FOR REFERENCE:*
First month: IIT training has been designed in the form of Live lectures
along with live mentorship from industry professionals. (Login credentials
will be provided to students after registration)

Second month: Internship with live mentorship for projects from
professionals. The LIVE INDUSTRY PROJECT will give students experience in
solving real-world problems.

Project 1:- 10 individual projects assigned to each intern which they have
to complete with their mentor.

Project 2:-  Capstone Project: It's a group project assigned to a group of
15 interns. For each intern particular work will be assigned to them they
have to work on it.
(Essential data and materials required for the project will be provided by
the company side itself)

Two types of Classes, we are providing:

1. Blended Program/Recorded classes: You will receive recorded sessions,
whatever doubts you have you can clear it in live doubt-clearing sessions
which will be organized every weekend.

2. Mentor-led/Live classes: You will be having live Zoom classes at 6:30
PM  for 2 to 3 days a week. You will receive your recorded sessions as well
LMS(Learning Management System) portal which you will have admittance to
for 6 months.


*After Completion of the program, the student shall receive a:*
[image: ‚úÖ] *Program completion certificate* issued by IIT KHARAGPUR KSHITIZ.
[image: ‚úÖ] *Certificates verified* through *Wipro* Dice ID.
[image: ‚úÖ] Co-Branded *Internship certificate from Top MNCs.*
[image: ‚úÖ] *100 percent Placement Assistance.*
[image: ‚úÖ] Admittance to a *growing community*.
[image: ‚úÖ] Program Offering with *Low-Code and No-Code Tools. *
[image: ‚úÖ] *100 percent Outcome Driven Result.*
[image: ‚úÖ] The curriculum includes *Generative AI and Prompt Engineering.*
[image: ‚úÖ] *Exclusive Masterclasses* with *Founders and CXOs of Top Global
Companies.*
[image: ‚úÖ] *Personalized Instructors* for proper guidance.




*[THIS NOTIFICATION FOR THE ENROLLMENT OF   MAY-JUNE, JUNE-JULY, JULY-AUG
BATCHES FOR STUDENTS WHO HAVEN'T BEEN ABLE TO ACCEPT THE SCHOLARSHIP SLOT
FOR THE SAME.*

subject: Announcement: One day Workshop on CAD Modeling & Drafting_12th April 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings of the Day! I am glad to inform you that CHAMOS Matrusanstha Department of Mechanical Engineering is organizing a one-day workshop on "CAD Modeling & Drafting" on
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings of the Day!

I am glad to inform you that CHAMOS Matrusanstha Department of Mechanical
Engineering is organizing a *one-day workshop on* *"CAD Modeling &
Drafting"* on *12th April 2025 (10:00 am onwards)*. It will be
conducted online (mode) using Microsoft Teams.

Please find the workshop banner in the attachment.

Kindly do the registration by scanning QR code of the Registration Form

content:
*Hey again, Design Dreamers! üé®üëÄ*

- Missed the first round? Don't worry ‚Äî *we saved you a second shot.* ü´£üí•

- We need 2‚Äì3 creatives for our Newsletter Team!

üñåÔ∏è *What‚Äôs the task?*

Design a newsletter(*TechNova*) cover page that reflects your style ‚Äî
clean, bold, minimal, maximal, moody, quirky‚Ä¶ whatever feels *you.*

*üß† **Need inspiration?*

Browse a few of our older newsletters to get an idea of the layout, then
add your own twist.

*üì¨ Your moment starts here ‚Äî **Hit Submit*
<https://forms.gle/baweAMSejiaEJ7EG6>

*üß∞  Designer toolkit waiting for you *üëâ *Open Design Resources*
<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1R6DdMtqbK4_XUNAFhEwl9W48zxl56TyM?usp=drive_link>

üóìÔ∏è *Submissions close* on *April 15, 2025* ‚Äî but earlier is cooler üòé

Don't wait. Create. We're excited to see what you‚Äôve got! üé®‚ú®

-
*Thanks & Regards,*
*Satyam Charola*
*Newsletter Team Member(Designer), Department Media Team Member.*
*Computer Engineering Student,*
*U & P U. Patel Department of Computer Engineering,*
*Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology - CHARUSAT.*

subject: üöÄ Final Call: Last Day to Register for Summer 2025 Internship (NSDC + WIPRO Certified) ‚Äì Deep Harishbhai Tandel etc. from CHARUSAT Already Joined, Will You?
snippet: Dear Students of Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) We are thrilled to announce that Deep Harishbhai Tandel etc. and many more students from CHARUSAT have already secured their
content:
*Dear Students of **Charotar University of Science and Technology
(CHARUSAT)*

We are thrilled to announce that *Deep Harishbhai Tandel* etc. and many
more students from *CHARUSAT* have already secured their spots in our
prestigious *National Skill Development Certified Internship Program*,
verified by *WIPRO DICE ID*! üåü

Now it‚Äôs your turn to take that leap towards a brighter career!
------------------------------

üî¥ *‚è≥ Registration Closes Tomorrow at 8:25 PM | 10th April 2025*

üîó *Apply Now:* *https://forms.gle/4ztjoYsdkezu32F5A*
<https://forms.gle/4ztjoYsdkezu32F5A>

üìå *Referral ID:* *CHS_25* (Exclusive for *CHARUSAT* Students)
------------------------------

üéì
*Program Highlights:*
‚úÖ Month 1: Live Training by Industry Experts
‚úÖ Month 2: Internship with Real-World Projects
‚úÖ 24/7 Support, Doubt-Clearing & Career Mentorship
‚úÖ No prerequisites ‚Äì open to all departments
‚úÖ Certification by *WIPRO DICE ID + NSDC*
------------------------------

üèÜ
*What You‚Äôll Receive:*
‚úîÔ∏è Certificate of Completion ‚Äì Recognized by WIPRO & Leading MNCs
‚úîÔ∏è Internship Certificate with real project validation
‚úîÔ∏è Letter of Recommendation for top performers
‚úîÔ∏è NSDC Certification ‚Äì Highly valuable for placement & college records
------------------------------

üíº
*Additional Benefits:*
‚ú® 6 Months LMS Access
‚ú® Resume Building & Mock Interviews
‚ú® Placement Assistance from Our Dedicated Career Network
------------------------------

üéØ
*This is your FINAL REMINDER!*
All registrations close *TOMORROW by 8:25 PM*. Details will be submitted to
the registration department EOD.

üöÄ Secure your place in this *2-Month Summer Internship Program* and step
into the world of real-world experience and corporate recognition.

‚ö†Ô∏è Already registered? Kindly ignore this email.

For queries or support, feel free to reply to this email directly.
------------------------------

*Best Regards,*
*Rutwik Gaikwad*
Senior Executive ‚Äì Registration & Onboarding
*LaunchEd Global*

subject: Strict Instructions for Second Online Quiz MSUD102 ‚Äì 19th April at 11:00 AM
snippet: Dear Students, This is to inform you that the second online quiz (5 Marks) is scheduled on 19th April at 11:00 AM sharp. Please note the following strict instructions: No further quiz will be conducted
content:
Dear Students,

This is to inform you that the *second online quiz (5 Marks)* is scheduled
on *19th April at 11:00 AM sharp*.

Please note the following *strict instructions*:

   1.

   *No further quiz* will be conducted *either online or offline* under any
   circumstances.
   2.

   Ensure you are in an area with *proper internet connectivity*.
   3.

   *Avoid travelling* during the quiz time.
   4.

   The *quiz duration is exactly 10 minutes*.
   5.

   In case of any *technical error or issue from your side*, the quiz *will
   not be reopened or resubmitted*.

Make sure to take this seriously and be fully prepared in advance.

Regards,
*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

subject: Regarding practical submissions of PC++ 2025
snippet: Dear students, Good morning!!! Instead of submitting the practical by formatting in the template and uploading in teams, we have planned to get you practicals submission in github, by creating
content:
Dear students,
Good morning!!! Instead of submitting the practical by formatting in the
template and uploading in teams, we have planned to get you
practicals submission in github, by creating repositories. You are supposed
to upload all your CPP files in git repository along with the screenshot of
output with the same caption name in *CPP file and Output file (format can
be: jpg,png,etc.)*

Please *provide your github repository link in the following spreadsheet in
your respective row, where your ID is mentioned*. *Also add your lab
faculty collaborator in that repository.*

subject: üöÄ Final Call: Last Day to Register for Summer 2025 Internship with NSDC Certification
snippet: Dear Students of Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) Congratulations on being shortlisted for our National Skill Development Certified Internship Program, verified by Wipro Dice ID
content:
Dear Students of *Charotar University of Science and Technology* (*CHARUSAT*
)

Congratulations on being shortlisted for our *National Skill Development
Certified* Internship Program, verified by *Wipro Dice ID*!

üî¥ *‚è≥ Registration Closes Today at 7:45 PM | 8th April 2025*

üîó *Apply Now:* *https://forms.gle/4ztjoYsdkezu32F5A*
<https://forms.gle/4ztjoYsdkezu32F5A>

üìå *Referral ID:* *CHA_25* (Exclusive for* CHARUSAT *Students)

This opportunity is available for every department with fixed slots from
*CHARUSAT* to participate in a 2-Month Summer Training + Internship Program
with *WIPRO DICE ID* Certifications!
------------------------------
üí° *Program Overview:*

‚úÖ *Month 1:* Live training sessions led by industry experts

‚úÖ *Month 2:* Internship with real-world projects & expert mentorship

‚úÖ *24/7 Support:* Dedicated mentorship, doubt-clearing sessions, and career
guidance

üéØ This program is designed to help you build a strong foundation and gain
real-world experience to stand out in the competitive job market.

------------------------------
üéì *Certifications & Credentials:*

üèÜ *Certificate of Completion* (Recognized by WIPRO DICE ID & Leading MNCs)

üèÜ *Internship Certificate* validating hands-on experience

üèÜ *Letter of Recommendation* for top-performing students

üìå Boost your career profile with globally recognized certifications that
enhance your employability!
------------------------------
üìà *Additional Benefits:*

‚ú® *6-month LMS access* for continuous learning

‚ú® *Placement assistance* through our dedicated career network

‚ú® *Mock interviews & resume-building support* to boost your job prospects

üíº Get a step closer to your dream job with expert career guidance and
placement assistance!
------------------------------

üéØ *INTERNSHIP WITH NSDC CERTIFICATION!*

üëâ We are excited to announce that all students attending this exclusive
2-Month Summer *Training + Internship* Program will now receive an
*NSDC* (National
Skill Development Corporation)  and *WIPRO DICE ID* Certification ‚Äì a
valuable credential that can be used for placement and college purposes.

üèÜ *NSDC* *Certification* ‚Äì Students will now receive an *NSDC* (National
Skill Development Corporation) Certification upon completion, which can be
used for placement and college purposes.
------------------------------

üö® *Final Reminder:*

 This is your *last chance to secure your spot*! All student details will
be submitted to the registration department by *EOD Today*. *Don‚Äôt miss out
on this career-defining opportunity!*

‚ö†Ô∏è *If you have already registered, kindly ignore this email.*

For any queries, feel free to reply to this email.

*Best Regards,*
*Rutwik Gaikwad*
*Senior Executive*
*LaunchEd Global*

subject: Reel making competition on "Say No to Drugs ‚Äì Yes to Dreams!"
snippet: Dear Student(s) Anti-drug Cell invites enthusiastic students to participate in a short 30‚Äì60 second reel-making competition that conveys a strong anti-drug message. This initiative aims to creatively
content:
Dear Student(s)

Anti-drug Cell invites enthusiastic students to *participate in a* short *30‚Äì60
second reel-making* competition that conveys a strong anti-drug message.
This initiative aims to creatively spread awareness about the harmful
effects of drug use and inspire students to make positive life choices.

Reel Concept: "Say No to Drugs‚ÄîYes to Dreams!"
Duration: *30‚Äì60 seconds*

Message: *Highlight the harmful effects of drugs and promote a drug-free
lifestyle for a better future.*

Hashtags: #SayNoToDrugs #AntiDrugCommittee #CSPIT#CHARUSAT#

Post the reel on the following platforms:

   -

   ‚úÖ Instagram (Reels)
   -

   ‚úÖ Facebook (Reels or Video Post)

  üìÜ   Deadline to submit reel  [*12th April 2025*]
  üë•   Team requirement [*Max. 04 students*]

  üèÜ   Prizes:

   - Winner: ‚Çπ3000
   - Runner-up: ‚Çπ2000

  üìú Certification: All participating students will receive an
*e-certificate* of appreciation*.*

üîó Submission Link:  Click Here <https://forms.gle/bLrFKFNrdoxSAENa9>

snippet: Dear All, The Department of Information Technology, CSPIT, in collaboration with the Equal Opportunity Cell, cordially invites you to an impactful and insightful program: Cyber Clarity: Awareness for a
content:
Dear All,

The Department of Information Technology, CSPIT, in collaboration with the
Equal Opportunity Cell, cordially invites you to an impactful and
insightful program: *Cyber Clarity: Awareness for a Safe Tomorrow. *üõ°Ô∏è

üåü Event Highlights:

Join us for an enlightening session conducted by an expert from the Cyber
Crime Cell, Gujarat Police, focusing on building awareness for a safer
online environment. This is your chance to stay informed about
cybersecurity best practices and threats.

üìÖ *Date: April 9, 2025 (Wednesday)*

*‚è∞ Time: 10:00 AM ‚Äì 12:00 PM*

üìç Venue: Seminar Hall - 2 (Second Floor), EC Building, CSPIT IT.

üéì Certificates: Participation certificates will be provided to all
attendees.

üö® Limited Seats Available! Make sure you register early to secure your
spot.

üîó Registration Link: Click here to register
<https://forms.gle/T2r6acECDcpvx6LS8>

*Last Date for registration: 08/04/2025 - 01:00 PM.*

Don't miss out on this opportunity to learn from industry experts and
become a cyber-aware citizen.

subject: Fwd: Expert Talk on ‚ÄúDecoding the LLM Revolution: Understanding the Generative AI Shift‚Äù ‚Äì April 5, 2025 (2 PM to 4 PM)
snippet: Interested Students are requested to attend. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Amit Nayak <amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in> Date: Sat, Apr 5, 2025 at 10:47 AM Subject: Fwd: Expert Talk on
content:
Interested Students are requested to attend.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Amit Nayak <amitnayak.it@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Apr 5, 2025 at 10:47‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: Expert Talk on ‚ÄúDecoding the LLM Revolution: Understanding
the Generative AI Shift‚Äù ‚Äì April 5, 2025 (2 PM to 4 PM)
To: Parth Shah <parthshah.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Amit Thakkar <
amitthakkar.it@charusat.ac.in>, Nikita Bhatt <nikitabhatt.ce@charusat.ac.in>,
Nirav Bhatt <niravbhatt.it@charusat.ac.in>, Sanskruti Patel <
sanskrutipatel.mca@charusat.ac.in>, Dharmendra Patel <
dharmendrapatel.mca@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Bankim Patel <bankimpatel.dcs@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir/ma'am,
Kindly forward it to the appropriate student's group.
-------------------------------

Dear Students,

We are pleased to announce an *Expert Talk* on the topic:
üéì* ‚ÄúDecoding the LLM Revolution: Understanding the Generative AI Shift‚Äù*
üóì *Date:* Saturday, April 5, 2025
üïë *Time:* 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM
üìç *Platform:* Microsoft Teams
üîó *Join via Link:* Click Here to Join the Meeting
<https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_OWExNTMyMjYtMDBjMi00OWFhLTgyM2MtMzc0MDI3OGQxOTk1%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%228dbd2884-120c-413b-80b2-1117dd3469a4%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%22ce4164f5-cb85-4017-b0fc-0856e1aa3ec3%22%7d>

This insightful session will be delivered by *Mr. Smaranjit Ghose*, a
distinguished professional in the field of AI and Machine Learning. Mr.
Ghose brings extensive expertise in Large Language Models (LLMs), Deep
Learning, and industry-led innovation. He currently serves as the *Chief
Academic Consultant at byteXL* and has led several high-impact projects and
training programs across the globe. His talk will delve into the practical
applications and transformative power of LLMs in today‚Äôs tech landscape.

Don't miss out on this opportunity to learn from an industry expert and
broaden your horizons in the world of AI and Deep Learning.
-

--

subject: Invitation to attend Talks on ML & DL ‚Äì Insights from Industry Leaders
snippet: Dear Students, We are excited to invite you to an exclusive ML Club event where three industry experts will share their insights, experiences, and career journeys in the field of Machine Learning (ML)
content:
Dear Students,

We are excited to invite you to an exclusive *ML Club* event where three
industry experts will share their insights, experiences, and career
journeys in the field of *Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL). *The
Poster is attached to this email for the event details.
*Why to Attend?*

üîπ Understand industry expectations, challenges, and career pathways.
üîπ Learn from experts who have built successful careers in ML/DL.
üîπ Get inspired and motivated to explore this exciting domain.
üîπ Engage in a Q&A session to clarify doubts and receive career guidance.

This is a fantastic opportunity to interact with professionals who have
made significant contributions in ML/DL and get valuable insights to shape
your future in this field.

üìå *Limited seats available! Register now to secure your spot: (The
students with ML club badge need not to register; they will get direct
entry)*

*Link: *https://forms.gle/wFPwg1udnLNB6e6y9

For any queries, feel free to reach out to the student coordinator
mentioned in the poster.
[image: Poster_5April.png]

Looking forward to your enthusiastic participation!

Best Regards,

Ronak N. Patel
Assistant Professor, Representative-Career Development and Placement Cell
[image: phone-icon]  ronakpatel.ce@charusat.ac.in
 [image: phone-icon]  9913760408
[image: phone-icon]  502, Computer Engineering Dept., CSPIT, CHARUSAT
Campus, Changa, Anand Gujarat, India, 388421
[image: phone-icon]  sites.google.com/view/ronak-patel/
 [image: linkedin icon] <https://www.linkedin.com/in/ronaknpatel/>   [image:
youtube icon] <https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrNKDCAM_tjt44gw5uJxKEw>
  [image:
instagram icon] <https://www.instagram.com/ronaknpatel/>


*Accredited with 'A+' by NAAC - Govt. of India*

--

subject: Fwd: Request to send student/s to solve discrepancies related to Liberal Arts- 2025 during 4 to 7 April, 2025 to Room no: 210, IIIM Building
snippet: Dear Students, Read the trailing mail and do the needful. ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Robert Parmar <robertparmar.cs@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Apr 3, 2025 at 5:31 PM Subject:
content:
Dear Students,

Read the trailing mail and do the needful.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Robert Parmar <robertparmar.cs@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Apr 3, 2025 at 5:31‚ÄØPM
Subject: Request to send student/s to solve discrepancies related to
Liberal Arts- 2025 during 4 to 7 April, 2025 to Room no: 210, IIIM Building
To: Dean CHARUSAT <dean@charusat.ac.in>, Principal <principal@charusat.ac.in>,
HOD Group <hod@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Bhaskar Pandya <bhaskarpandya.cs@charusat.ac.in>, CS <cs@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir /Madam,

Greetings...|

This is with a deep sense of gratitude, let us share immense pleasure and
pride for a successful execution of Liberal Arts - 2025. We are happy to
share that we coordinated a total of 15 courses this time with ease and
effectiveness. In the same regards, we appreciate your commitment and
cooperation for providing the Man- power, Infrastructure and above all your
moral support during the Liberal Arts -2025.

As you are well aware that Liberal Arts Courses are taught in *Workshop
Mode* and both *Internal and External evaluation* of the subject selected
by the students was carried out effectively during that period (Four Days
=25 to 28, 2025).

However, we have received applications from students regarding inability to
attend the session/ s during specific day/s or Internal Evaluation and
health issues etc. With a view to solve the issues and complete the
evaluation process in a fair and fine way, you may please instruct the
students having issues regarding Attendance, Submission or Evaluation to
contact *Dr. Robert Parmar *as per the details shared below:

*Venue:* Room : 219, First Floor, IIIM Building

Date: 4-4-2025 | Friday      | 1:00 pm to 4:30 pm

Date: 5-4-2025 | Saturday | 10:00 pm to 4:30 pm

Date: 7-4-2025 | Monday   | 1:00 pm to 4:30 pm





Kindly consider the same and do the needful.







With regards,



Yours sincerely,





*Dr. Robert Parmar *

*Mo: 9925466788*

--

subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025 (NICE-25)-reg.
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in> Date: Sun, 30 Mar, 2025, 5:05 am Subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025 (NICE-25)-
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Sun, 30 Mar, 2025, 5:05‚ÄØam
Subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025
(NICE-25)-reg.


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/26-Mar/AICTE1/index.html>
------------------------------

Respected Sir/Madam,

Crossword-solving is a powerful cognitive exercise that enhances analytical
thinking, decision-making, memory, concentration, and creativity. It
strengthens problem-solving abilities, fosters a competitive spirit, and
expands vocabulary‚Äîskills essential for academic and professional success.

To further promote this engaging and intellectually stimulating activity in
higher education institutions, AICTE, Extra-C, IIM Mumbai, and IIT Madras
have collaborated under an MoU signed on May 21, 2024. As part of this
initiative, the *National Inter-College Crossword Expedition (NICE-25)* is
being organized.

The competition, scheduled between *May and August 2025*, will follow a
hybrid format‚Äîonline preliminary rounds leading to offline zonal and
national finals. This event provides students with an opportunity to
sharpen their minds while competing on a national platform.

*Attached are the competition guidelines, format, and tentative schedule. *The
MoU can be accessed on the AICTE website. We invite your esteemed
institution to encourage participation in this unique and enriching
challenge https://nice.crypticsingh.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=19b602f5a3c2a21c88f676f16f1c8a8f3597377f&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
.

*Registrations will begin from 30th March
2025 on  https://nice.crypticsingh.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=19b602f5a3c2a21c88f676f16f1c8a8f3597377f&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
. *

PFA:-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/18cFYJTXo0Yq6zmen456z8H28ukWH2QGc/view?usp=sharing
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=176b1da9e198e0df1317262dc16b4adeb16352b9&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>



*With Warm Regards,**Dr. A*
*mit Dutta, *
*Director,*
*Policy & Academic Planning Bureau*
*All India Council for Technical Education,*
*Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj,
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=7ab9fbde99d56338df0c3db2a58401aab648dea5&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>*
*New Delhi- 110070
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=7ab9fbde99d56338df0c3db2a58401aab648dea5&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
*
*Phone no. 011-29581117**Email id - *directorpnap@aicte-india.org
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=657f5c3fd8bd8be291d15fb44bcb30989a5d21f3&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>

-- 
*Regards,*

*Nirav Bhatt*

snippet: Dear Students, You are instructed to complete the MEUD101 Elements of Engineering -Home Assignment-CCE Component on or before 3rd May 2025. You have to submit the solution of the assignment in a
content:
Dear Students,

You are instructed to complete the *MEUD101 Elements of Engineering -Home
Assignment-CCE Component* on or before *3rd May 2025*.

You have to submit the solution of the assignment in a separate sketchbook
to your respective EG (Class) teacher.

You have to prepare a solution by solving *any 2 examples from each topic*.
[Total Questions: 12 Min & Max 20]
---

Regards,



*Dr. Sagar Chokshi,*

Associate Professor,
Department of Mechanical Engineering,

Faculty of Technology & Engineering,

Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology,
Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT),
ACCREDITED WITH ‚Äú*A+*‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC
Education Campus Changa -388421
At. & Post Changa-388421, Ta: Petlad, Dist: Anand, (Gujarat) India.
Ph.No. +91-2697-265329; Mob. No. +91-9726622007.

subject: Re: Exclusive Session on Internships, Placements & Scholarships ‚Äì For 2nd Year Girls
snippet: Dear girls, Gentle reminder to join in session. Kindly join in the below given link for the session, Also first year girls who had missed the offline session of yesterday can join in today's online
content:
Dear girls,
Gentle reminder to join in session. Kindly join in the below given link for
the session, Also first year girls who had missed the offline session of
yesterday can join in today's online session.

Link:
https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_ZTAzOGM0MWEtOGRhOS00MzZhLWJhNzctOGZhMDY2NjgyNTAx%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%228dbd2884-120c-413b-80b2-1117dd3469a4%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%22071e10d7-bee7-4ad2-aa19-631bdde8e1b5%22%7d
*--*
*Thanks & Regards,*
*Aayushi Chaudhari | PhD*
Assistant Professor,
U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT,Changa,Anand-388421.
www.charusat.ac.in


On Thu, Mar 27, 2025 at 4:01‚ÄØPM Aayushi Chaudhari <
aayushichaudhari.ce@charusat.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> We are pleased to invite you to *"EMPOWERHER SESSION: NAVIGATING
> INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES" *exclusively for educating girls on achieving
> internship and placement opportunities through scholarships, hackathons,
> and industry programs. This session is aimed at helping 2nd year female
> students gain insights into career-building opportunities at top companies.
> *Introduction*
> This session will be conducted by Pooja Ramani, a 3rd-year Computer
> Engineering student, who has:
> ‚úÖ Completed a 2-month internship at Amazon, Chennai through the Amazon
> Future Engineering Scholarship Program (Foundation for Excellence Group)
> with stipend of Rs 35,000, during summer internship-I.
> ‚úÖ Secured a 6-month return internship at Amazon as a Software Development
> Engineer in Test (SDET) in Chennai with stipend of Rs 1,10,000, for summer
> internship-II.
>
> *What You Will Learn?*
> ÔÇ∑ How to secure internships and placements at top tech companies.
> ÔÇ∑ Details about scholarship programs that provide career opportunities.
> ÔÇ∑ Insights into hackathons and competitions that enhance your resume.
> ÔÇ∑ Tips on building a strong profile and application process.
>
> Session Details
> Online session *[Link will be sent to registered students]*
> Date: 02-04-2025
> Time: 7:00 pm to 8:00 pm
>
> This is a great opportunity for 2nd year students to explore career
> pathways early. We encourage all interested students to attend and take
> advantage of this informative session.
>
> Register yourself using the following form *on or before 29th March, 2025*
> :
> https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfjjeS2OcmDJIVD3m_aMYp5oq3LgmtTn9l-sI52VeRkmB-MTQ/viewform?usp=sharing
>
> *Note: Those girls who are interested, are requested to register before
> coming for the session. *
>
> *--*
> *Thanks & Regards,*
> *Aayushi Chaudhari | PhD*
> Assistant Professor,
> U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
> Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
> CHARUSAT,Changa,Anand-388421.
> www.charusat.ac.in
> [image: Second Year Girls .jpeg]
>

--

subject: Confirmation of Counseling Session Registration ‚Äì Fellowship Program
snippet: Congratulations on registering for the counseling session in your area of interest under our Fellowship Program! We'd love to hear about your current status to assist you better. Could you please
content:
Congratulations on registering for the counseling session in your area of
interest under our Fellowship Program!

We‚Äôd love to hear about your current status to assist you better. Could you
please update us on the following?

Have you successfully enrolled?

Have you completed the counseling session but need more time to enroll?

Are you receiving calls for counseling?

If you haven‚Äôt been available for counseling, what would be a suitable time
for you?

Your response will help us ensure a smooth process for you. Feel free to
reach out if you have any questions.

Looking forward to your update.

Best regards,

snippet: Dear Girls, Gentle reminder to be on time for attending the session. -- Thanks & Regards, Aayushi Chaudhari | PhD Assistant Professor, U & PU Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
content:
*Dear Girls, Gentle reminder to be on time for attending the session.*
*--*
*Thanks & Regards,*
*Aayushi Chaudhari | PhD*
Assistant Professor,
U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT,Changa,Anand-388421.
