On Thu, Mar 27, 2025 at 4:00‚ÄØPM Aayushi Chaudhari <
aayushichaudhari.ce@charusat.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> We are pleased to invite you to *"EMPOWERHER SESSION: NAVIGATING
> INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES" *exclusively for educating girls on achieving
> internship and placement opportunities through scholarships, hackathons,
> and industry programs. This session is aimed at helping 1st year female
> students gain insights into career-building opportunities at top companies.
> *Introduction*
> This session will be conducted by Pooja Ramani, a 3rd-year Computer
> Engineering student, who has:
> ‚úÖ Completed a 2-month internship at Amazon, Chennai through the Amazon
> Future Engineering Scholarship Program (Foundation for Excellence Group)
> with stipend of Rs 35,000, during summer internship-I.
> ‚úÖ Secured a 6-month return internship at Amazon as a Software Development
> Engineer in Test (SDET) in Chennai with stipend of Rs 1,10,000, for summer
> internship-II.
>
> *What You Will Learn?*
> ÔÇ∑ How to secure internships and placements at top tech companies.
> ÔÇ∑ Details about scholarship programs that provide career opportunities.
> ÔÇ∑ Insights into hackathons and competitions that enhance your resume.
> ÔÇ∑ Tips on building a strong profile and application process.
>
> *Session Details*
> Venue: AIML seminar hall, 2nd floor, A6 building
> Date: 01-04-2025
> Time: 11:10 am to 12:00 noon
>
> This is a great opportunity for 1st year students to explore career
> pathways early. We encourage all interested students to attend and take
> advantage of this informative session.
>
> Register yourself using the following form *on or before 29th March, 2025*
> :
> https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdb4mRcNVBdM6NS5EFJLatAtDXsuBMZkZmq51JKtzkKslOWNQ/viewform?usp=sharing
>
> *Note: Those girls who are interested, are requested to register before
> coming for the session. *
> *--*
> *Thanks & Regards,*
> *Aayushi Chaudhari | PhD*
> Assistant Professor,
> U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
> Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
> CHARUSAT,Changa,Anand-388421.
> www.charusat.ac.in
> [image: First Year Girls.jpeg]
>

subject: Recruitment For Nakshatra Aerospace
snippet: Hello everyone! üöÄ Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics & Communication and Mechanical Department As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
content:
*Hello everyone! üöÄ*

Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics &
Communication and Mechanical Department

As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
development on the Propulsion Systems, Design, Avionics, Recovery and
Material Science

*NOTE* :
DEADLINE FOR REGISTRATION ARE EXTENDED TILL 7th April 2025


*Why Join Us?*

Being part of Nakshatra Aerospace means you‚Äôll engage in hands-on projects,
collaborate with like-minded peers, and prepare for interviews with
industry leaders. Plus, it‚Äôs a fantastic way to enhance your resume!
Don‚Äôt miss out on this incredible opportunity to soar high with Nakshatra
Aerospace! üåå

Looking forward to seeing your applications!

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeqw-dwcGPZxyFV196urPrrAdpQljpJn72pVQy4-0QQjfVExQ/viewform?usp=header


For further Queries you can Contact:

nakshatraaerospaceclub@gmail.com

Hitarth Chauhan(24ME006)
+91 7405312628
Vishwesh Patel(24ME057)
+91 9726798232

content:

*CHARUSAT,Changa,Anand-388421.*

subject: This is what you are missing out on!
snippet: Hi shreeja vaishnani , It's been a week since we last saw you on CodeChef! CodeChef is your ideal learning partner for anything related to Programming. This is what you are missing out on Our
content:
Hi shreeja vaishnani , 

 

It's been a week since we last saw you on CodeChef!

 

CodeChef is your ideal learning partner for anything related to Programming.

This is what you are missing out on

  • Our curriculum covers everything that your will encounter during a 4 year Engineering course - Programming, OOPs, Data structures & Algorithms, Web development, Analytics & Data science (coming soon!)

  • Our learning flow gives you access to AI support, Skill Tests, Test case debugging, Video editorials

  • Preparation for OA rounds: Over 4000 curated algorithmic problems

Continue learning!

Should you have any questions, feel free to hit reply.

 

Regards,

Ravikant

Developer@CodeChef

If you do not wish to receive emails from us, you can unsubscribe

content:

Thanks for filling out Attitude of CHARUSAT Students towards Courses on  
Liberal Arts
Here's what was received.


Attitude of CHARUSAT Students towards Courses on Liberal Arts

form.

Student ID
*


24ce138


Institute/College *


CSPIT



Course *


B.Tech

Computer Engineering



Semester *


Sem-2



Liberal Arts *


Strongly agree Agree Neither agree nor disagree Disagree Strongly disagree

Liberal arts courses help me explore my creative side.


Liberal arts subjects feel irrelevant to my career goals.


Liberal arts courses add diversity to the university curriculum.


The inclusion of liberal arts subjects enhances the overall university  
experience.


I believe liberal arts courses should be optional for students in technical  
fields.


I enjoy participating in activities during liberal arts classes.


Liberal arts courses are exciting and fun.


Liberal arts courses encourage me to express my individuality.


Attending liberal arts classes is a refreshing change from my technical  
subjects.


Liberal arts courses have improved my creative problem-solving skills.


Liberal arts courses enhance my ability to work on team projects.


Liberal arts courses have made me more confident in public speaking.


Skills gained in liberal arts courses can be applied in my daily life.


The knowledge gained in liberal arts courses is relevant to modern  
professional settings.


I find it challenging to see the practical applications of liberal arts  
courses in my career.


Liberal arts education is essential for holistic personal and professional  
growth.


The creative assignments in liberal arts courses are harder than they seem.


Liberal arts courses should include a mix of theory and practical work for  
balanced learning.


Liberal arts courses have helped me appreciate diverse cultures and  
perspectives.


Liberal arts classes encourage collaboration and teamwork.


The teaching methods used in liberal arts courses are innovative and  
engaging.


Liberal arts faculty inspire creativity in their students.


My peers perceive liberal arts courses as less serious compared to  
technical courses.


Liberal arts courses provide a platform for socializing and networking.


Experiences in liberal arts courses build transferable skills that are  
valuable in any career.


Participating in liberal arts activities will enhance my resume or  
portfolio.


The ability to think creatively, gained from liberal arts, will help me  
adapt to diverse challenges.


Liberal arts education contributes to building a well-rounded personality.


More hands-on workshops and guest lectures would make liberal arts courses  
more appealing.


Interdisciplinary projects involving liberal arts and technical students  
would foster collaboration.


Subjects Studied *


HSUS109 Dramatics



HSUS109 Dramatics


HSUS109 Dramatics *


Strongly agree Agree Neither agree nor disagree Disagree Strongly disagree

This course has helped me understand the fundamentals of performing arts.


I can now differentiate between various forms of performing arts, including  
theatre.


I have developed a deeper appreciation for the role of dramatics in  
performing arts.


The course has improved my ability to portray different characters  
convincingly.


I have learned professional acting techniques that enhance my stage  
presence.


My confidence in performing in front of an audience has significantly  
improved.


This course has helped me understand the importance of voice modulation,  
body language, and expressions in acting.


I have gained practical experience in various aspects of theatrical  
performance.


The training sessions have improved my ability to improvise during a  
performance.


I feel more comfortable performing in different types of roles and scenes.


I have gained knowledge of the history and evolution of theatre.


The course has deepened my understanding of theatre's impact on society and  
culture.


Learning about theatre theory has enhanced my ability to analyze and  
critique performances.


I now appreciate the aesthetic aspects of theatre, such as stage design,  
lighting, and direction.


The course has provided me with hands-on experience in monologues,  
dialogues, and group scenes.


I have learned effective rehearsal techniques that have improved my  
performance skills.


The training in dance and voice has helped me enhance my overall stage  
presence.


I have developed a better understanding of theatre production and its  
technical aspects.


Performing before a live audience has boosted my confidence and stage  
awareness.


The structured training in this course has helped me refine my acting and  
performance abilities.

subject: Expert talk for CEUC102 on 29th March in Online mode
snippet: Dear students, Good morning !!! Kindly take a note, that you will be having expert talk for CEUC102: PC++ entitled "Beyond the Basics: How Industry Leverages C++ for High-Performance Solutions
content:
Dear students,
Good morning !!! Kindly take a note, that you will be having expert talk
for CEUC102: PC++ entitled *"Beyond the Basics: How Industry Leverages C++
for High-Performance Solutions". *The talk will be in online mode, so all
of you are supposed to join the talk sharp at 9:30 am in morning, using the
following link:
https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_NzZkOGMyN2ItOGNjMC00ODAyLWJiOTQtZDNiZjkyN2VjYTlh%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%228dbd2884-120c-413b-80b2-1117dd3469a4%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%22071e10d7-bee7-4ad2-aa19-631bdde8e1b5%22%7d

For more details regarding talk, please refer to the attached brochure.
Join with your MS Team's credentials only.

*Note: Those who will fail to join this session will not be allowed to
appear in QUIZ-2 and QUIZ-3. *
*--*
*Thanks & Regards,*
*Aayushi Chaudhari | PhD*
Assistant Professor,
U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT,Changa,Anand-388421.
www.charusat.ac.in
[image: CE - 2025 - Event Post_20250328_114217_0000.jpg]

--

subject: Exclusive Session on Internships, Placements & Scholarships ‚Äì For 1st Year Girls
snippet: Dear Students, We are pleased to invite you to "EMPOWERHER SESSION: NAVIGATING INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES" exclusively for educating girls on achieving internship and placement opportunities
content:
Dear Students,

We are pleased to invite you to *"EMPOWERHER SESSION: NAVIGATING INTERNSHIP
OPPORTUNITIES" *exclusively for educating girls on achieving internship and
placement opportunities through scholarships, hackathons, and industry
programs. This session is aimed at helping 1st year female students gain
insights into career-building opportunities at top companies.
*Introduction*
This session will be conducted by Pooja Ramani, a 3rd-year Computer
Engineering student, who has:
‚úÖ Completed a 2-month internship at Amazon, Chennai through the Amazon
Future Engineering Scholarship Program (Foundation for Excellence Group)
with stipend of Rs 35,000, during summer internship-I.
‚úÖ Secured a 6-month return internship at Amazon as a Software Development
Engineer in Test (SDET) in Chennai with stipend of Rs 1,10,000, for summer
internship-II.

*What You Will Learn?*
ÔÇ∑ How to secure internships and placements at top tech companies.
ÔÇ∑ Details about scholarship programs that provide career opportunities.
ÔÇ∑ Insights into hackathons and competitions that enhance your resume.
ÔÇ∑ Tips on building a strong profile and application process.

*Session Details*
Venue: AIML seminar hall, 2nd floor, A6 building
Date: 01-04-2025
Time: 11:10 am to 12:00 noon

This is a great opportunity for 1st year students to explore career
pathways early. We encourage all interested students to attend and take
advantage of this informative session.

Register yourself using the following form *on or before 29th March, 2025*:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdb4mRcNVBdM6NS5EFJLatAtDXsuBMZkZmq51JKtzkKslOWNQ/viewform?usp=sharing

*Note: Those girls who are interested, are requested to register before
coming for the session. *
*--*
*Thanks & Regards,*
*Aayushi Chaudhari | PhD*
Assistant Professor,
U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
CHARUSAT,Changa,Anand-388421.
www.charusat.ac.in
[image: First Year Girls.jpeg]

--

Subject: Hack the Future with Accenture ‚Äì Are You Ready?
To: <nikitabhatt.ce@charusat.ac.in>



<https://notificationsapi.geeksforgeeks.org/track-logs/email?6jnJFoZp=6DbUHII%3D&%2FyjcHIJYiHk%3D=umqOR9w2&7jfcFoVYiHk%3D=vWqJTg%3D%3D&7jfcFoVYl3yTIsT9Mvp1HA%3D%3D=vmKMTw%3D%3D&%2BT%2FeCpt1hHOCLvr9M8h%2BHa4%3D=uw%3D%3D&%2BD%2FaEoxplUKILw%3D%3D=v2OFSg%3D%3D&%2FinYDbZuhQ%3D%3D=umqNR9o01Q%3D%3D&%2FinYDbZlhHGOJcLgGdFz=uw%3D%3D&%2BD%2FTC7ZjgGmE=uWqPSsQ30jDTfQ%3D%3D>
*Innovate, compete, and win big‚Äîstep into the world of Data and AI at
Accenture‚Äôs hackathon*

*Hack the Future: A Gen AI Sprint Powered by Data *is Accenture‚Äôs premier
hackathon, bringing together innovators, problem-solvers, and AI
enthusiasts to tackle real-world challenges using the power of AI

Whether *you‚Äôre a student, an experienced tech professional, or from the
Strategy and Consulting field,* this is your opportunity to innovate,
collaborate, and compete

Why join this hackathon?

   - *Solve real-world challenges with AI-driven solutions*
   - *Learn and grow through mentorship and expert sessions*
   - *Expand your network with AI professionals and industry leaders*

subject: Urmil & Mayuri Desai Family Trust Scholarship for 1st Year Students for the academic year (2024-25) of B.Tech Program.
snippet: Dear First Year CSPIT Students, We are pleased to announce Urmil & Mayuri Desai Family Trust Scholarship which will be awarded to the students of 1 st year of B.Tech program for academic year 2024-
content:
Dear First Year CSPIT Students,


We are pleased to announce Urmil & Mayuri Desai Family Trust Scholarship
which will be awarded to the students of 1st year of B.Tech program for
academic year 2024-25, with the following Criteria:



*Eligibility Criteria to get Scholarship for the Academic Year 2024-25:*

v Students of *1st Semester (1st year)* who have secured 75 percentage or
above in the 12th standard.

v Students whose family income is not more than 6.5 lacs.

v To continue to be eligible for availing Scholarship, the Student has to
secure 7.00 CGPA or above at the end of every semester without backlog.

v In case, a student will not score a minimum 7.00 CGPA in consecutive
semesters, then scholarship will be awarded to another eligible student,
selected by the Donor and recommended by CHARUSAT.

v Only four students shall be selected for the scholarship each semester.
Two boys and two girls. In case applicants of either gender are not
available, then all the four beneficiaries can be boys or girls.

v Students receiving Govt. / Donor / CHARUSAT / any other scholarship or
admitted under the Tuition Fee Waiver Scheme (TFWS) are not eligible to
apply.

v The Scholarship is meant to provide *maximum support to four students
selected by Donor, based on merit-cum-means and complying above conditions.*



*Scholarship Amount:*  Per Students 17500/- per semester (maximum four
students selected by the Donor)



 P*Please find the form and notice for your ready reference. You are
requested to submit the filled form to **Mr.Yatin Talati, **Room no.101,
EE/EC Building, CSPIT.*

*Last Date of Submission of Form:   08.04.2025*

 **Note: No Form will be accepted after the last date.*

-- 
Thanks,
*Yatin Talati*

Accredited Grade ‚ÄúA+‚Äù by NAAC, GOI

Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
Off. Nadiad - Petlad Highway, Changa, Gujarat, INDIA 388421
www.charusat.ac.in

--

subject: Recruitment For Nakshatra Aerospace
snippet: Hello everyone! üöÄ Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics & Communication and Mechanical Department As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
content:
*Hello everyone! üöÄ*

Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics &
Communication and Mechanical Department

As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
development on the Propulsion Systems, Design, Avionics, Recovery and
Material Science

We're thrilled to announce an exciting opportunity for all B.Tech students!
The Nakshatra Aerospace Club is officially recruiting new members, and we
want YOU to be a part of this Stellar journey into the world of Aerospace
innovation!


*Why Join Us?*

Being part of Nakshatra Aerospace means you‚Äôll engage in hands-on projects,
collaborate with like-minded peers, and prepare for interviews with
industry leaders. Plus, it‚Äôs a fantastic way to enhance your resume!
Don‚Äôt miss out on this incredible opportunity to soar high with Nakshatra
Aerospace! üåå

Looking forward to seeing your applications!

subject: C-Quest Quiz Round Results & Details for Round 2 ‚Äì Technical Treasure Hunt
snippet: Dear Participants, Greetings from the C-Quest Team! We would like to thank each and every one of you for your enthusiastic participation in the Quiz Round of C-Quest Hackathon. We were thrilled to
content:
Dear Participants,

Greetings from the C-Quest Team!

We would like to thank each and every one of you for your enthusiastic
participation in the *Quiz Round* of *C-Quest Hackathon*. We were thrilled
to witness such an overwhelming response and impressive performance across
all teams.

We are excited to announce that the *top 101 teams* have been shortlisted
to advance to *Round 2.*
üèÜWhat‚Äôs Next?

*Round: Technical Treasure Hunt*
üìÖ *Date:* 1st April 2025
üïõ *Time:* 12:00 PM to 4:00 PM
üìç *Venue:* Will be shared soon with the selected teams

Attached to this mail is the list of the top* 101 teams* selected for the
second round. Kindly check the attachment to see if your team has made it!

We look forward to seeing you all in the next round for an exciting and
challenging hunt full of tech twists and turns! üí°üîç

Best regards,
*Team C-Quest*
Department of Computer Science & Engineering
CSPIT

*Thanks & Regards,*
*Dr. Jigar Sarda*



*Assistant Professor,Department of Computer Science & EngineeringCHARUSAT*
*E-mail: jigarsarda.ee@charusat.ac.in <jigarsarda.ee@charusat.ac.in>*

<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-4530-9904>*

subject: Important: Online Quiz Scheduled on March 29th ‚Äì Instructions Inside
snippet: Dear Students, The first online quiz is scheduled for March 29th from 11:20 to 11:30 AM. Please keep the following points in mind: The quiz consists of 5 MCQs and must be completed within 10 minutes.
content:
*Dear Students,*

The first online quiz is scheduled for *March 29th from 11:20 to 11:30 AM*.

with the *Equal Opportunity Cell & AIESEC in VVN*, invites you to an

subject: Reminder: HSUS109 DRAMATICS | LIBERAL ARTS 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Hope you are all excited for the HSUS109 Dramatics workshop! The course will be conducted in Workshop Mode from March 25 to March 28, 2025 (9:10 AM ‚Äì 4:30 PM) at CHARUSAT Campus, Changa.
content:
Dear Students,

Hope you are all excited for the *HSUS109 Dramatics* workshop!

The course will be conducted in *Workshop Mode* from *March 25 to March 28,
2025 (9:10 AM ‚Äì 4:30 PM)* at *CHARUSAT Campus, Changa*. Your *Internal and
External Evaluations* will also take place during these four days.

üìç *Venue Details:*


*On Day 1 (09:10 AM ‚Äì 11:10 AM), there will be a General Briefing Session
for all students in the IIIM Building, Room No. 214.*
Attendance is mandatory for all participants. After that and for the
remaining three days, sessions will be conducted in the DEPSTAR building.
Room allocations are as follows:

Room No. 123 ‚Äì Group A (Students of CSPIT EE, IT, EC, ME, CSE)
Room No. 124 ‚Äì Group B (Students of IIIM, PDPIAS and CSPIT CE)

Room No. 125 ‚Äì Group C (Students of DEPSTAR, RPCP, CMPICA)




Please ensure you are seated in your assigned room for each session.

üìå *Important Instructions:*

   -

   *100% Attendance is Compulsory.*
   -

   Carry your *Identity Card* at all times.
   -

   Wear comfortable clothes

For *regular updates*, please join the *Google Classroom* using this
link: click
here <https://classroom.google.com/c/NzUyNDQxMzg3MTE3?cjc=23tria7>

It is *mandatory* to complete all *assignments, tasks, activities, and the
viva* during these four days. Failure to do so may result in a *backlog*.

For any queries, feel free to contact:
üìû *Ms. Celine Davla - 9737517553*

Looking forward to an engaging and exciting workshop!

Regards,

-- 
*Ms. Celine Davla*
*Assistant Professor*
*HSS Department*
*Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management*
*CHARUSAT*
*Mo. 9737517553*

--

subject: Online Quiz 1 Notification for Engineering Physics - 2 (Experiments 5 to 9)
snippet: Dear First-Year Students, The Department of Physical Sciences is conducting an online quiz for Engineering Physics - 2, covering Experiments 5 to 9. Please find the details below: Date: 29/03/2025 Day:
content:
Dear First-Year Students,

The Department of Physical Sciences is conducting an online quiz for
Engineering Physics - 2, covering Experiments 5 to 9. Please find the
details below:

*Date:* 29/03/2025

*Day:* Saturday

*Time:* 4:00 PM to 4:30 PM

*Mode:* Online (Google Form)

*Total Marks:* 25 MCQs

*Evaluation Component:* Continuous Assessment

The Google Form link for the quiz will be shared on the day of the exam. I
just wanted to let you know that *no excuses related to internet*
connectivity issues will be entertained. Just so you know, this quiz is
part of your *continuous evaluation*, and failing to attempt it will
significantly impact your overall grades as per NEP.

The components for internal evaluation (25 Marks).

Quiz 1

Quiz 2

Lab Manual

Journal

20%

20%

20%

40%

Ensure your availability and preparedness for the quiz. For any queries,
feel free to reach out to your lab-in-charge for further assistance.

Best regards,
Sanni


-- 
*Thanks,*



*Sanni, Ph.D.Assistant professorDepartment of Physical Sciences
<https://www.charusat.ac.in/PDPIAS/people/>Faculty of Applied SciencesP D
Patel Institute of Applied Sciences,CHARUSAT
<https://www.charusat.ac.in/>, Changa. - 388 421, India*

*Email: sannikapatel.phys@charusat.ac.in <sannikapatel.phys@charusat.ac.in>*
*            sunkapatel@gmail.com <sunkapatel@gmail.com>*
*Phone: (M) +91 - 9978577009*

You are about to lose your daily streak in your learning journey!

 

So hurry, head to CodeChef and solve 1 problem to extend your streak!

Continue learning!

Should you have any questions, feel free to hit reply.

 

Regards,

Ravikant

Developer@CodeChef

subject: üåü Data Science Club ‚Äì New Tenure Begins! Join the Next Leadership Team!üöÄ
snippet: Dear Students, As we wrap up an incredible tenure at the Data Science Club of CHARUSAT University, it's time for a fresh start ! The current team is set to retire, paving the way for a new
content:
Dear Students,

As we wrap up an incredible tenure at the *Data Science Club* of CHARUSAT
University, it‚Äôs time for a fresh start ! The current team is set to
retire, paving the way for a *new leadership team* to take charge. If
you‚Äôre passionate about *Data Science, AI, ML, event organizing and tech
collaboration*, this is your chance to *step up and lead*!

*Why Join the Core Team? *
As a member, you'll get to:
‚úÖ Organize and participate in workshops, hackathons, and speaker sessions
on AI, ML, and Data Science.
‚úÖ Work alongside industry experts and build a strong professional network.
‚úÖ Develop leadership, teamwork, and technical skills that add value to your
resume.
‚úÖ Be a part of an enthusiastic community that shares your passion for data
and innovation.

*Open Positions*
We have various roles available, including Lead , Co-Lead , Web developer ,
Content writer and many more. Check out the attached **Roles &
Responsibilities Document* to find your best fit!

*How to Apply? *
üìå Step 1: Fill out the application form ‚Äì *https://forms.gle/RSpxUU3S8Ct9WpLr6
<https://forms.gle/RSpxUU3S8Ct9WpLr6>*
üìå Step 2: Submit your application before *28th Feb 2025 (Friday)*
üìå Eligibility: Open to all tech branches students of CSPIT who are
passionate about Data Science and community building.

This is your *opportunity to lead, learn, and leave an impact*. Don't miss
out on becoming a part of the *Next-Gen Data Science Club team*!

For any queries, feel free to reach out to us.

Best Regards,
Data Science Club Team,
CSPIT,
CHARUSAT University.

--

content:

appreciate your enthusiasm and participation.

subject: Academic Summer Internship Opportunity ‚Äì Apply Now!
snippet: Welcome to LaunchED Global! Internship Program Details Dear CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY Student, We warmly invite you to participate in the Launched Global Collaboration with the KSHITIJ IIT KHARAGPUR
content:
Welcome to LaunchED Global!

Internship Program Details
Dear CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY Student,

We warmly invite you to participate in the *Launched Global*
<http://launchedglobal.in/> Collaboration with the *KSHITIJ IIT
KHARAGPUR* Industrial
Learning and Certification Program.
*Learn more about you, please fill out the application form.*Submit Now
<https://forms.gle/Bqo98gcFeFsBogTM7>

IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT: Once you fill out the form, kindly share it with
your friends and ensure that everyone fills it out.

*Join Our Official WhatsApp Group For More Information:*
Join WhatsApp Group <https://chat.whatsapp.com/LiAZB7NDBFa4hVXStKAoFc>Preferred
Slots: APRIL TO JULY*FIND THE BELOW ATTACHMENTS FOR REFERENCE*

*First Month: *Industrial training has been designed in the form of Live
lectures along with living mentorship from industry professionals. (Login
credentials will be provided to students after registration).

*Second Month:* Internship with live mentorship for projects from
professionals. The LIVE INDUSTRY PROJECT will give students experience in
solving real-world problems.
*PROJECTS :*

*Project 1* 10 individual projects are assigned to each intern, which they
must complete with their mentor.

*Project 2 (Capstone Project):* It's a group project assigned to 15
interns. For each intern particular work will be assigned to them, and they
have to work on it.
(Essential data and materials required for the project will be provided by
the company side itself)
*Here are two types of Classes we are providing:*

*1.Blended Program/Recorded classes:* You will receive recorded sessions,
whatever doubts you have you can clear them in live doubt-clearing sessions
organized every weekend.

*2.Mentor-led/Live classes* You will have live Zoom classes at 6:30 PM 2 to
3 days a week. You will get your recorded sessions as well
You will have access to the LMS(Learning Management System) portal for 6
months.
*Program Highlights:*

   - India's First - offering programs with low-code and no-code tools,
   with a promise of 100% outcome-driven results
   - Certifications from *LaunchEd - KSHITIJ IIT KGP* verified through
   Wipro Dice ID
   - Learn from tech-giant mentors and industry leaders
   - Cutting-edge curriculum including generative AI and prompt engineering
   - Exclusive masterclasses with students, founders, and CXos from top
   global companies
   - Personalized instructors for comprehensive guidance from start to
   finish

*Secure your spot now to pave the way for a successful career journey with
LaunchED Academy!*

Your Success Awaits !

Don't miss this chance to advance your career with our exclusive Upskilling
Program. Limited slots available ‚Äì *apply now!*

*ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ Take the first step with LaunchED Global!
<http://launchedglobal.in/>*

Join WhatsApp Group <https://chat.whatsapp.com/LiAZB7NDBFa4hVXStKAoFc>Preferred
Slots: APRIL TO JULY*FIND THE BELOW ATTACHMENTS FOR REFERENCE*

*First Month: *Industrial training has been designed in the form of Live
lectures along with living mentorship from industry professionals. (Login
credentials will be provided to students after registration).

*Second Month:* Internship with live mentorship for projects from
professionals. The LIVE INDUSTRY PROJECT will give students experience in
solving real-world problems.
*PROJECTS :*

*Project 1* 10 individual projects are assigned to each intern, which they
must complete with their mentor.

*Project 2 (Capstone Project):* It's a group project assigned to 15
interns. For each intern particular work will be assigned to them, and they
have to work on it.
(Essential data and materials required for the project will be provided by
the company side itself)
*Here are two types of Classes we are providing:*

*1.Blended Program/Recorded classes:* You will receive recorded sessions,
whatever doubts you have you can clear them in live doubt-clearing sessions
organized every weekend.

*2.Mentor-led/Live classes* You will have live Zoom classes at 6:30 PM 2 to
3 days a week. You will get your recorded sessions as well
You will have access to the LMS(Learning Management System) portal for 6
months.
*Program Highlights:*

   - India's First - offering programs with low-code and no-code tools,
   with a promise of 100% outcome-driven results
   - Certifications from *LaunchEd - KSHITIJ IIT KGP* verified through
   Wipro Dice ID
   - Learn from tech-giant mentors and industry leaders
   - Cutting-edge curriculum including generative AI and prompt engineering
   - Exclusive masterclasses with students, founders, and CXos from top
   global companies
   - Personalized instructors for comprehensive guidance from start to
   finish

*Secure your spot now to pave the way for a successful career journey with
LaunchED Academy!*

Your Success Awaits !

Don't miss this chance to advance your career with our exclusive Upskilling
Program. Limited slots available ‚Äì *apply now!*

*ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ Take the first step with LaunchED Global!
<http://launchedglobal.in/>*

subject: "CHARUSAT Students Get Certified: Phase-2 Launch-ED Global Internship"
snippet: Dear Student, We are excited to invite you to apply for the Launch-ED Global Internship Program, a unique opportunity for students eager to gain hands-on experience in the tech industry through expert
content:
Dear Student,

We are excited to invite you to apply for the Launch-ED Global Internship
Program, a unique opportunity for students eager to gain hands-on
experience in the tech industry through expert training and mentorship.

*Program Overview:*

   -

   *Month 1: Expert Training*
   - Attend live sessions led by industry professionals with over 10 years
      of experience.
      - Learn valuable skills in low-code/no-code tools, AI, and prompt
      engineering.
      - Receive personalized mentorship and hands-on training.
   -

   *Month 2: Real-World Projects*
   - Work on individual mini-projects with mentor support.
      - Collaborate on a capstone group project addressing real-world
      challenges.

*Program Benefits:*

   - Certification from leading MNCs.
   - Networking and professional mentorship.
   - Training in cutting-edge technologies, including Generative AI and
   low-code/no-code tools.

*How to Apply:*

   - Submit your application via this registration form.
   *REGISTRATION FORM* <https://forms.gle/fbz2jzGmzNycTt5eA>

   - Shortlisted candidates will be contacted by our HR team.

Spaces are limited, so apply soon!

subject: Fwd: Math for AI Club Activity: Math Magic Behind GANs
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Spoorthy V <spoorthy.aiml@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Mar 20, 2025 at 2:01 PM Subject: Math for AI Club Activity: Math Magic Behind GANs To: <22aiml
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Spoorthy V <spoorthy.aiml@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Mar 20, 2025 at 2:01‚ÄØPM
Subject: Math for AI Club Activity: Math Magic Behind GANs
To: <22aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <23aiml@charusat.edu.in>, Head CSE <
hod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, <24aiml@charusat.edu.in>, Head CE CHARUSAT <
hod.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Head IT CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>,
DEPSTAR_CE <depstar_ce@charusat.ac.in>, Depstar_CSE <
depstar_cse@charusat.ac.in>, DEPSTAR IT <depstar_it@charusat.ac.in>, HOD
AIML <hod.aiml@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: AIML <aiml@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

I hope this email finds you well.

Math for AI club under the Department of Artificial Intelligence & Machine
Learning, CSPIT, CHARUSAT is organizing an *Expert Talk* on the *"Math
Magic Behind GANs"* on March 21, 2025.

Discover the fascinating mathematical concepts that power *Generative
Adversarial Networks (GANs)*, one of the most revolutionary AI techniques
used in image synthesis, deep learning, and beyond.

This event is open to all students of the institute who are eager to
explore the intersection of *Mathematics and AI*. No prior GAN experience
is needed‚Äîjust bring your curiosity!

Join us for an interactive session that will deepen your understanding and
spark new insights.


*Session Details:*

   - *Date:* March 21, 2025
   - *Time:* 10:10 AM to 11:15 AM
   - *Venue:* Will be updated at the earliest.
   - *Last Date of Registration:*  21/03/2025 (09:00 PM)


*Registration Link:* https://tinyurl.com/8usp657c (Seats are limited)


Feel free to contact us for any queries on

*Pooja Mehta (22AIML020) - 6351857705 (Student Coordinator)*

*Kesha Desai (22AIML008) - 7573017335 **(Student Coordinator)*

*Spoorthy V. - 8310726037 **(Faculty Coordinator)*


We look forward to seeing you there!


*Please refer to the attached brochure for details. *

-- 
Thanks and regards,

*Dr. Spoorthy. V*,
Assistant Professor,
Department of AI-ML,
CSPIT, CHARUSAT Campus,
Highway, Off, Nadiad - Petlad Rd,
Changa, Gujarat 388421

--

> *Dear Students,*
>
> The Department of Computer Science and Engineering, CSPIT, is excited to
> present *C-Quest Hackathon* in collaboration with the *IEEE Computer
> Society, CHARUSAT and TechGenius Club*‚Äîan exhilarating competition aimed
> at *fostering innovation and advanced programming in C.*
> This is your chance to participate in C-QUEST ‚Äì Battle of the Best, an exclusive
> coding competition for first-year students, where you can showcase your C
> programming skills, compete with top talent, and contribute to impactful
> programming that shapes the future of development. Designed to challenge
> your problem-solving abilities, debugging skills, and algorithmic thinking,
> this hackathon offers an exciting opportunity to test your knowledge and
> compete against the brightest minds!*Why Should You Participate?*
>
> ‚úÖ *Test Your Skills:* Solve challenging C programming problems
> ‚úÖ *Sharpen Your Logic:* Tackle algorithmic puzzles and debugging tasks
> ‚úÖ *Win Exciting Prizes:* Get rewarded for your coding excellence

> ‚úÖ *Boost Your Resume:* A great addition to your programming portfolio
> *Event Details*
>
> üìÖ *Date:* 5th April 2025
> ‚è∞ *Time:* 9:00 AM ‚Äì 4:00 PM
> üìç *Venue:* Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology (CSPIT), CHARUSAT
> üë• *Who Can Participate?* First-year students passionate about coding
> üéØ *Eligibility:* *Teams of 2 members (Interdepartmental teams of the
> same institute are allowed)*
>
> Whether you're a *beginner or already confident* in C programming, this
> event is a fantastic opportunity to *learn, compete, and grow* in a
> supportive and thrilling environment.
>
> üìå *How to Register?*
> Simply *scan the QR code* in the attached flyer or reach out to us for

>

>
> Looking forward to your participation!
>

>

subject: Important Notice: Kit distribution | DRAMATICS
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings! Please note that the kit distribution for your liberal arts workshop on DRAMATICS is scheduled on Tuesday, 18th March 2025(Today). You need to collect the kits from Indukaka
content:
Dear Students,



Greetings!



*Please note that the kit distribution for your liberal arts workshop on
DRAMATICS is scheduled on Tuesday, 18th March 2025(Today).* You need to
collect the kits from Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management between
1:15 PM to 4:15 PM.


Please note the following instructions for the courses:



1.       100% Attendance is Compulsory.

2.       It is required that you carry your own Identity Card.

3.       Details of the schedule/venue of the course will be there in your
Kit.

4.    Check the SOP, kit letter, Schedule and Syllabus in the kit


Contact the Institute / Department Coordinators or your Mentor in case you
have any queries.



We hope you will have a wonderful learning experience.



Thank you.



Regards,


-- 
*Ms. Celine Davla*
*Assistant Professor*
*HSS Department*
*Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management*
*CHARUSAT*
*Mo. 9737517553*

--

subject: Fwd: C-Quest Hackathon
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Jigar Sarda <jigarsarda.ee@charusat.ac.in> Date: Mon, 17 Mar, 2025, 5:34 pm Subject: C-Quest Hackathon To: <24cs@charusat.edu.in>, <24ce@
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Jigar Sarda <jigarsarda.ee@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, 17 Mar, 2025, 5:34‚ÄØpm
Subject: C-Quest Hackathon
To: <24cs@charusat.edu.in>, <24ce@charusat.edu.in>, <24it@charusat.edu.in>,
<24aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <24ec@charusat.edu.in>, <24ee@charusat.edu.in>, <
24me@charusat.edu.in>, <24cl@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head CSE <hod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, Head CE CHARUSAT <
hod.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Head IT CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>, HOD AIML <
hod.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, Head EC CHARUSAT <hod.ec@charusat.ac.in>, Head
Electrical CHARUSAT <hod.ee@charusat.ac.in>, Head Mechanical CHARUSAT <
hod.me@charusat.ac.in>, Head Civil CHARUSAT <hod.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Avani
Khokhariya <avanikhokhariya.cse@charusat.ac.in>, srushti gajjar <
srushtigajjar.cse@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear Students,*

The Department of Computer Science and Engineering, CSPIT, is excited to
present *C-Quest Hackathon* in collaboration with the *IEEE Computer
Society, CHARUSAT and TechGenius Club*‚Äîan exhilarating competition
aimed at *fostering
innovation and advanced programming in C.*
This is your chance to participate in C-QUEST ‚Äì Battle of the Best, an
exclusive
coding competition for first-year students, where you can showcase your C
programming skills, compete with top talent, and contribute to impactful
programming that shapes the future of development. Designed to challenge
your problem-solving abilities, debugging skills, and algorithmic thinking,
this hackathon offers an exciting opportunity to test your knowledge and
compete against the brightest minds!*Why Should You Participate?*

‚úÖ *Test Your Skills:* Solve challenging C programming problems
‚úÖ *Sharpen Your Logic:* Tackle algorithmic puzzles and debugging tasks
‚úÖ *Win Exciting Prizes:* Get rewarded for your coding excellence
‚úÖ *Network with Peers:* Meet like-minded coding enthusiasts
‚úÖ *Boost Your Resume:* A great addition to your programming portfolio
*Event Details*

üìÖ *Date:* 5th April 2025
‚è∞ *Time:* 9:00 AM ‚Äì 4:00 PM
üìç *Venue:* Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology (CSPIT), CHARUSAT
üë• *Who Can Participate?* First-year students passionate about coding
üéØ *Eligibility:* *Teams of 2 members (Interdepartmental teams of the same
institute are allowed)*

Whether you're a *beginner or already confident* in C programming, this
event is a fantastic opportunity to *learn, compete, and grow* in a
supportive and thrilling environment.

üìå *How to Register?*
Simply *scan the QR code* in the attached flyer or reach out to us for
registration details!

*Last date of registration: 20th March 2025.*

Looking forward to your participation!

*Best regards,*
*CSPIT-CSE*
[image: C.png]

subject: Fwd: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making Competition Details
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: DHRUVI MAHALE <22cs036@charusat.edu.in> Date: Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:07 PM Subject: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: DHRUVI MAHALE <22cs036@charusat.edu.in>
Date: Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:07‚ÄØPM
Subject: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making
Competition Details
To: <coordinator.nss@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: <pinalhansora.cse@charusat.ac.in>, <22cs051@charusat.edu.in>


Respected Sir,

I hope this email finds you well.

We, the *CSE NSS Unit*, are organizing a *Traffic Awareness Program* on *20th
March 2025* to spread awareness about road safety and responsible driving
among students. As part of this initiative, we are hosting a *Poster Making
Competition* on *18th March 2025*.

üìå *Competition Details:*

   - Open to all students of *Charusat University*
   - Teams of *2 or 3 members* can participate
   - Only *20 teams* will be selected on a *first-come, first-serve* basis
   - The best posters will be showcased at the *Traffic Awareness Program*
   - *Participants must bring their own laptops for designing the poster  *

We request you to kindly forward this information to all departments so
that interested students can participate. They can register by filling out
the form linked below:

üìç *Registration Link: *https://forms.gle/nFMfduwfUAyHPfzX6

Attached is the *poster for the event* for further reference.
[image: image.png]

For any queries, students can contact:
üìû  *9328068864 **, *99790 99218

We appreciate your support in spreading the word about this initiative.
Looking forward to your kind cooperation.

Best Regards,
Dhruvi mahale



-- 
Thanks & Regards
--

--

subject: Summer Internship with Wipro Dice ID and NSDC Certification
snippet: Dear Student of Charusat University, "INTERNSHIPS DON'T JUST ADD TO YOUR RESUME; THEY DEFINE YOUR FUTURE. GET AHEAD BEFORE THE WORLD LEAVES YOU BEHIND üåê" INTERNSHIP WITH NSDC
content:
*Dear Student of Charusat University,*

*"INTERNSHIPS DON‚ÄôT JUST ADD TO YOUR RESUME; THEY DEFINE YOUR FUTURE. GET
AHEAD BEFORE THE WORLD LEAVES YOU BEHIND üåê"*

*INTERNSHIP WITH NSDC CERTIFICATION!*
üëâ We are excited to announce that all students attending this exclusive
2-Month Summer Training + Internship Program will now receive an *NSDC
(National Skill Development Corporation)  and WIPRO DICE ID Certification* ‚Äì
a valuable credential that can be used for *placement and college purposes*.

üìå *Application Form:* https://forms.gle/DDjMnNEeBnEXV4pPA

*Referral ID:* DICE_25
üìå *Program Highlights*

‚úÖ *Month 1:* Advanced training through live interactive sessions with
industry experts.
‚úÖ *Month 2:* Hands-on internship with real-world projects and expert
mentorship.
‚úÖ *Continuous Support:* 24/7 mentorship, doubt-clearing sessions, and
career guidance.
üéì *Certifications & Credentials*

üèÜ *Certificate of Completion* accredited by *AICTE*.
üèÜ *Internship Certificate* verified by *Wipro DICE ID* & leading MNCs.
üèÜ *Letter of Recommendation* for outstanding performers, endorsed by
industry experts.
üèÜ *NSDC Certification* ‚Äì Students will now receive an *NSDC (National
Skill Development Corporation) Certification* upon completion, which can be
used for *placement and college purposes*.
üìà *Additional Benefits*

‚ú® *6-month access* to a personalized LMS portal.
‚ú® *Placement assistance* through a dedicated career community for 6 months.
‚ú® 24/7 mentorship and doubt-clearing support.
‚ú® *6 months of recorded sessions* with access to LMS software, including:

   - *Resume building assistance*
   - *Mock interviews* to help prepare for real-world opportunities
   - *Assessments* for the sessions and mock interviews

üìå Apply Now:  https://forms.gle/DDjMnNEeBnEXV4pPA

*Referral ID:* DICE_25

üö® *Reminder: **Students kindly fill out the application form and complete
your registration by EOD.*

üëâ *For students already enrolled, please disregard this message.*

Best regards,
*Training and Internship Cell*
*LaunchEd Global*

subject: A COURSE ON LIBERAL ARTS | HSUS109 DRAMATICS | MARCH 2025
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings! You must be aware that your curriculum offers a 2 Credit Compulsory Course on Liberal Arts. We thank you for selecting HSUS109 Dramatics. Please note that the course will be
content:
Dear Students,



Greetings!



You must be aware that your curriculum offers a 2 Credit Compulsory Course
on Liberal Arts. We thank you for selecting HSUS109 Dramatics.



Please note that the course will be taught in the Workshop Mode (9:10 am to
4:30 pm) during 25th to 28th March 2025 at CHARUSAT Campus, Changa. *Your
Internal as well as External Evaluation will also be carried out during
these 4 days only. *


*The venue for your 4 days workshop will be informed shortly.*

*For regular updates please join the google classroom using this link.
(Click here for the link
<https://classroom.google.com/c/NzUyNDQxMzg3MTE3?cjc=23tria7>)*



It is compulsory for you to attend the course and complete all assignments,
tasks, activities given and appear in the Viva (Internal and External)
during those 4 days only.



*If you fail to attend, complete the tasks, activities and
assignments, you may fail in the second semester and get a backlog.*



Please note the following instructions for the courses:



1.      Students are required to collect a Course Kit from Indukaka
Ipcowala Institute of Management on *Monday- March 24, 2025. *

2.       100% Attendance is Compulsory.

3.       It is required that you carry your own Identity Card.

4.       The details regarding schedule and venue will be informed through
email shortly.



Please find the Standard Operating Procedure(SOP) attached herewith for
your reference and understanding.


Feel free to contact the course coordinator in case of any queries.

Ms. Celine Davla - 9737517553



Happy Learning!



Regards,


-- 
*Ms. Celine Davla*
*Assistant Professor*
*HSS Department*
*Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management*
*CHARUSAT*
*Mo. 9737517553*

--

*Benefits on enrollment *



   - 50% AWS exam voucher will be provided to students
   - Full access to all modules of AWS LMS and Hands-on lab.
   - Exam preparation material with Mock exam




*Benefits of AWS Certification*


There are numerous advantages to becoming AWS certified. Amazon Web
Services certifications‚Ä¶



   - Validate your skills and knowledge in the preeminent cloud computing
   platform.
   - are consistently listed among the top-paying info-tech certifications
   worldwide.
   - Garner more interviews for aspiring cloud specialists and higher wages
   once hired.
   - Are recognized industry-wide as reliable and well-designed tech
   credentials.
   - Demonstrate credibility and dedication to your cloud computing career
   path.
   - Provide access to a network of like-minded peers and AWS
    thought-leaders.
   - Require recertification which ensures that your AWS skills remain
   current.


Interested students are requested to register themselves using the
following link:

*Registration for Cloud Practitioner Foundational**: *Click Here!!
<https://forms.gle/EAo4zLYKoBKGmc7N9>

Registration is open till next week (22 March 2023)

*Respective faculty members are requested to circulate this to students
in your respective Institute / Branch.*


For any Query contact

Prof. Sanket Suthar (CSPIT-IT)

sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in <sandippatel.it@charusat.ac.in>

Dr. Parth Shah (CSPIT-IT)

parthshah.ce@charusat.ac.in

subject: Invitation to Participate in Viksit Bharat Youth Parliament 2025
snippet: Dear Students, The CHARUSAT NSS Cell is pleased to invite you to participate in the Viksit Bharat Youth Parliament 2025, an incredible opportunity to express your vision for a developed India. This
content:
Dear Students,

The *CHARUSAT NSS Cell* is pleased to invite you to participate in the *Viksit
Bharat Youth Parliament 2025*, an incredible opportunity to express your
vision for a developed India. This initiative, supported by the *Ministry
of Youth Affairs & Sports, Govt. of India*, encourages youth engagement in
policy discussions and leadership development.
*Event Details:*

*District-Level Competition:* 17th March 2025
*Venue:* Sardar Patel University, Vallabh Vidyanagar

*Register Here:* https://mybharat.gov.in/ -> Viksit Bharat Youth Parliament
2025 <https://mybharat.gov.in/mega_events/viksit-bharat-youth-parliament>
(*Register as soon as possible!*)
*Deadline : 16th March 2025*
*Participation Guidelines:*

   - Open to students aged *18-25 years*.
   - Submit a *1-minute video* on the topic: *"What does Viksit Bharat mean
   to you?"*
   - Language options: *Gujarati, Hindi, or English*.
   - *Selected 150 participants* will compete at the District Level.
   - *Top 10* will advance to the State Level, and winners will qualify for
   the *National Level* competition.

For detailed guidelines and further information, please find the *attached
PDF*.

*We encourage all eligible students to take advantage of this opportunity
and make CHARUSAT proud! *

For any queries, feel free to contact the *CHARUSAT **NSS Cell*.
-- 
Thanks & Regards
--

--

subject: Regarding: B. Tech. Second Semester Midterm Exam-Instruction to Students
snippet: Dear Students, It has been observed on Day 1 (today) of the B. Tech. Second Semester Midterm exam, students are reporting late for examination. You are instructed to report to your exam place at 10:10
content:
Dear Students,

It has been observed on Day 1 (today) of the B. Tech. Second Semester
Midterm exam, students are reporting late for examination.

You are instructed *to report to your exam place at 10:10 am sharp without
fail *for further examination.

The entry of the multiutility building will be closed at 10:20 am from
tomorrow onwards. Therefore, please enter the building on or before that
without fail. It is advised *to enter the building at 10:00 am *for smooth
execution.

You are constantly observed on camera so don't make any kind of copies or
talk during the exam. You can contact the respective exam supervisor during
the exam if you have any queries.

Thank You.

Best of Luck for further exams.

subject: The Quill: CHARUSAT Chronicles | Volume 10 - Issue 2
snippet: Welcome to Quill The Quill: CHARUSAT Chronicles Greetings from CHARUSAT! In the ever-evolving journey of academic excellence and innovation, we are delighted to introduce Quill ‚Äî the official
content:
[Welcome to Quill]
[https://mailer.charusat.org.in/index.php/campaigns/pj902x2k39ea7/track-url/ls409tohbwc79/cde86d8c0da7b957c934ecfd99c713dcf0d13606]


THE QUILL: CHARUSAT CHRONICLES

Greetings from CHARUSAT!

In the ever-evolving journey of academic excellence and innovation, we
are delighted to introduce QUILL ‚Äî the official newsletter of
CHARUSAT. True to its name, Quill embodies the spirit of creativity,
intellect, and expression that defines our vibrant community.

WHAT‚ÄôS INSIDE QUILL?

 	* ACCOLADES: CHARUSAT'S EXCELLENCE ‚Äì Celebrating extraordinary
accomplishments of our students, faculty, and alumni.
 	* RESEARCH PUBLICATIONS: THE EDGE OF EXPLORATION ‚Äì Showcasing
groundbreaking discoveries.
 	* EMINENT SPEAKERS: UNVEILING NEW PERCEPTIONS ‚Äì Dive into engaging
conversations and transformative ideas.
 	* CAMPUS BUZZ: CELEBRATING CAMPUS LIFE ‚Äì Experience the energy and
excitement of campus life.
 	* FACULTY SPOTLIGHT: ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE ‚Äì Highlighting the
brilliance of our faculty.
 	* STUDENT SPOTLIGHT: RISING STARS ‚Äì Inspiring stories of our
student community.

Quill is more than just a newsletter; it is a chronicle of our shared
vision, growth, and success. Join us in celebrating the milestones and
moments that make CHARUSAT a hub of inspiration and innovation.

[Quill Cover Page]
[https://mailer.charusat.org.in/index.php/campaigns/pj902x2k39ea7/track-url/ls409tohbwc79/6a1d41c8c004b6b45507b44a8baa19329fc0135a]
Read More

Warm regards,
MR. KRUTEN PATEL
Executive Officer - Corporate Communications

subject: Hands on Workshop on HIgh Performance Computing under Super Computing Facility @ CHARUSAT
snippet: Hands-On Workshop on High Performance Computing Organized by Supercomputing Facility at CHARUSAT & AIML Club at CHARUSAT Dear Students and Faculty members, We are excited to invite you to a two-day
content:
Hands-On Workshop on High Performance Computing

Organized by Supercomputing Facility at CHARUSAT & AIML Club at CHARUSAT

Dear Students and Faculty members,

We are excited to invite you to a two-day hands-on workshop on High
Performance Computing (HPC) at CHARUSAT. This workshop will provide you
with practical experience in parallel computing techniques and technologies.
*Workshop Details:*

üìÖ Date: 11-12 March 2025

üìç Venue: 323A, A6 Building

üë• Maximum participants: 40

üí∞ Registration: Free of cost

*Note:* E-certificates will be provided to participants with 100%
attendance and 100% allocated task submission.
About the Workshop

This workshop will introduce you to the Supercomputing Facility at
CSPIT-CHARUSAT. You'll gain hands-on experience with various parallel
computing paradigms including:

   - ‚Ä¢ GPU Programming with CUDA
   - ‚Ä¢ Shared Memory Parallelism with OpenMP
   - ‚Ä¢ Distributed Memory Parallelism with MPI
   - ‚Ä¢ Multi-GPU training with PyTorch

Workshop Schedule
Time Day 1 (March 11) Day 2 (March 12)
9:10 AM - 10:00 AM Super computing in action - Transforming Science and
Innovation
Dr. Amit Thakkar
10:00 AM - 12:00 PM Shared Memory Parallelism with OpenMP
Dr. Ritesh Patel GPU Programming with CUDA (continued)
Dr. Ritesh Patel
12:00 PM - 1:00 PM Lunch Break Lunch Break
1:00 PM - 2:00 PM Shared Memory Parallelism with OpenMP (continued)
Dr. Ritesh Patel Multi-GPU training with PyTorch
Mr. Harshal Yagnik
2:00 PM - 4:20 PM Distributed Memory Parallelism with MPI
Mr. Harshal Yagnik Multi-GPU training with PyTorch (continued)
Mr. Harshal Yagnik
Benefits

   - ‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with the Supercomputing Facility
   - ‚Ä¢ Learn from experts in the field of high-performance computing
   - ‚Ä¢ E-certificates for participants with 100% attendance and task
   completion
   - ‚Ä¢ Valuable skills for research and industry applications

Registration Information

The workshop is open to all students and faculty members. Registration is
required as seats are limited to 40 participants.

Limited seats available - Register today!
Register Now <#>

Registration closes on March 9, 2025 or when all seats are filled

Organized by Supercomputing Facility at CHARUSAT & AIML Club |
CSPIT-CHARUSAT

"EMPOWERING THE POTENTIAL OF PARALLEL COMPUTING"


With Regards,

Amit Thakkar, Ph.D.
Professor & Head
Department of Computer Science & Engineering
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology (CSPIT)
Charotar University of Science & Technology.(CHARUSAT)
Jay Swaminarayan.

--

subject: Fwd: Inauguration of IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch - Women in Engineering (WIE)
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in> Date: Fri, 7 Mar 2025, 9:36 am Subject: Inauguration of IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch - Women in
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal CSPIT <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, 7 Mar 2025, 9:36‚ÄØam
Subject: Inauguration of IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch - Women in
Engineering (WIE)
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>



Inauguration of IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Women in Engineering Affinity
Group and Seminar talk on "Women Innovators in Tech: Success Stories and
Lessons Learned"

Newly Established IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Women in Engineering
Affinity Group invites all female students and faculties of CHARUSAT to
participate in the inauguration ceremony followed by a seminar talk.
About IEEE WIE

*Vision:* "To be globally recognized for its contributions in STEM fields.
Our goal is to facilitate the recruitment and retention of women in
technical disciplines globally. We envision a vibrant community of IEEE
women and men collectively using their diverse talents to innovate for the
benefit of humanity."

*Mission:* "To connect, support, and inspire women and girls worldwide, and
facilitate their recruitment and retention in STEM fields, fostering
technological innovation and excellence for the benefit of humanity."
Guest Speaker
Ruzan Khambatta

A visionary entrepreneur, social innovator, and passionate advocate for
women's empowerment. Through her groundbreaking initiatives like Wajra O'
Force, PoliceHEART 1091, and Halla Bol, she has transformed thousands of
lives. Her success mantra? Small steps today lead to giant leaps tomorrow!

Learn more about Ruzan Khambatta <https://ruzankhambatta.com/wizzo1/>
Event Details

   - *Date:* *10th March 2025*
   - *Time:* *9:45 AM to 11:00 AM*
   - *Venue:* *2nd floor, Seminar hall, CSPIT EC-EE(A6 building), CHARUSAT*

This event is a milestone moment as we officially launch the Student
Chapter of WiE Society of IEEE, a dedicated community to uplift and support
women in technology. Whether you're a student, professional, or tech
enthusiast, this is an opportunity to connect, learn, and be part of a
movement that drives change.

E-Certificates will be provided to all the participants.

Let's come together to celebrate, empower, and innovate!
Register Here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1YtXFaNHx3A12jsPhcPr6jRjZWwjOh48EskA9I3Ra9Mg/edit>

Looking forward to your presence!

Regards,

-- 
Dr. Trushit Upadhyaya
Professor & I/c Principal
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology
Faculty of Technology & Engineering
Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT)
CHARUSAT Campus, Changa, 388421
Petlad, Anand, Gujarat, India.
M: 7874840344
https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Gzsxo-oAAAAJ&hl=en

--

subject: Fwd: Certified Ethical Hacker v13 (CEHv13) - World‚Äôs No. 1 Ethical Hacking Certification, now with the power of AI (March 2025)
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Dr. Priteshkumar Prajapati <priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Mar 6, 2025 at 2:50 PM Subject: Certified Ethical Hacker v13 (CEHv13) -
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Priteshkumar Prajapati <priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Mar 6, 2025 at 2:50‚ÄØPM
Subject: Certified Ethical Hacker v13 (CEHv13) - World‚Äôs No. 1 Ethical
Hacking Certification, now with the power of AI (March 2025)
To: Head CE CHARUSAT <hod.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Head CSE <
hod.cse@charusat.ac.in>, HOD AIML <hod.aiml@charusat.ac.in>, HOD Depstar <
hodds@charusat.ac.in>, Head EC CHARUSAT <hod.ec@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Head IT CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>, Principal C.S.Patel Institute
of Technology <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>, Principal DEPSTAR <
principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in>, Dean FTE CHARUSAT <
dean.fte@charusat.ac.in>, Principal CMPICA CHARUSAT <
principal.cmpica@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Sir/Madam,

Please share the email below with your students to get benefit from
subsidized academic costs as an EC-Council Academia Partner.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Dear students,

We are glad to inform you that *"Charotar University of Science and
Technology - CHARUSAT"* is the official *EC-Council Academia Partner *since
January 2020. We are immensely pleased to welcome ‚ÄúCHARUSAT‚Äù *students* to
EC Council's newly launched *CEHv13* program. Certified Ethical
Hacker CEHv13
<https://www.eccouncil.org/programs/certified-ethical-hacker-ceh/> will
teach you the latest commercial-grade hacking tools, techniques, and
methodologies hackers and information security professionals use to hack an
organization lawfully. *110+ students have benefited from CEH at CHARUSAT
with a subsidized academia kit price.*

*What‚Äôs new in CEHv13?*: *From the creators of Certified Ethical Hacker
(CEH) comes the latest and evolved version 13 with added AI capabilities.
Structured across 20 learning modules covering over 550 attack techniques,
CEH provides cybersecurity professionals with the core knowledge they need
to detect and defend against emerging threats.*

*You will get:*

   - EC-Council Official Course Book for CEHv13 for self-study (24 Months) -
   Accessible Online/Offline. To Download App
   <https://support.vitalsource.com/hc/en-us/articles/201344733-Bookshelf-Download-Options>

   - Access To iLabs for 6 Months. Check the ilabs Demo Here:
   *https://youtu.be/iU_7zKypJZI* <https://youtu.be/iU_7zKypJZI>.
   - An Exam Voucher (1 Year) - *Get a globally recognized certificate
for* passing
   the exam. Accreditations
   <https://linkprotect.cudasvc.com/url?a=https%3a%2f%2fwww.eccouncil.org%2faccreditations%2f&c=E,1,hLej6Kb3ZRL_QKhhm71kedMm89bbj8UclU3d50zuCt2frG_t19Fir_60SvUk16RJBGYXwVBLF11HLMhr7nDv8WGkPElWNiTm9zdZ_xfo&typo=1>
   - Over 200 hands-on labs with Over 3,500 hacking tools. Learn how to
   hack multiple operating systems (Windows 11, Windows servers, Linux,
   Ubuntu, Android)
   - The venue of the Exam will be our University Premises.

*Popular Cybersecurity Tools in the Course:*


* - Network scanning and mapping tools (e.g., Nmap, hping3)- Vulnerability
assessment tools (e.g., OpenVAS, Nessus)- Penetration testing tools (e.g.,
Metasploit, Aircrack-ng)- Packet sniffers and network analyzers (e.g.,
Wireshark, Omnipeek Network Analyzer)- Social engineering tools (e.g.,
Social-Engineer Toolkit (SET), SpeedPhish Framework (SPF))- Password
cracking tools (e.g., John the Ripper, L0phtCrack)- Forensics tools (e.g.
FTK, EnCase, Autopsy)- Wireless hacking tools (e.g., Aircrack-ng,
Wifiphisher)- Encryption tools (e.g., CryptoForge, VeraCrypt)*
*Master AI to automate ethical hacking tasks and hack and defend against AI
systems.*

*‚Ä¢ ShellGPT* ‚Äì Automates various reconnaissance and penetration testing
tasks using AI-driven scripting.
*‚Ä¢ ChatGPT *‚Äì Helps generate code, automate tasks, and create scripts for
ethical hacking.
‚Ä¢ *FraudGPT* ‚Äì Simulates AI-assisted malicious activities to learn defense
strategies.
‚Ä¢ *WormGPT* ‚Äì An offensive AI tool used to simulate exploitations and
malware creation.
‚Ä¢ *DeepExploit* ‚Äì AI-powered vulnerability scanning and exploitation tool.
‚Ä¢ *Nebula* ‚Äì Automates network discovery and vulnerability identification
with AI.
‚Ä¢ *Veed.io* ‚Äì Can visualize security analytics and post-exploitation
results for better reporting.


*Typical Job Roles for C|EH :*

   - Mid-Level Information Security Auditor
   - Cybersecurity Auditor
   - Security Administrator
   - IT Security Administrator
   - Cyber Defense Analyst
   - Senior Security Consultant
   - Information Security Manager
   - Senior SOC Analyst
   - Solution Architect
   - Cybersecurity Consultant



   - Vulnerability Assessment Analyst
   - Warning Analyst
   - Information Security Analyst 1
   - Security Analyst L1
   - Infosec Security Administrator
   - Cybersecurity Analyst L1, L2, & L3
   - Network Security Engineer
   - SOC Security Analyst
   - Security Analyst
   - Network Engineer

*Webinar on "A Career in Cybersecurity" by EC-Council with Collaboration of
CHARUSAT | Campus Official: *https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X-QgxO3JhlA


*Testimonials:*

   - How Certified Ethical Hacker Helped Me Land a Job with Big4 | Sidhant
   Gupta <https://youtu.be/PLvVyh96n8M?si=IVLEptb5F-QPMUaw>
   - Catch Your Big Break in Cybersecurity with C|EH | Ravina Joshi
   <https://youtu.be/TO7veOnV9T4?si=uzHTokSpVAtp1iOm>
   - How C|EH Helped Me Build a Successful Career in Cybersecurity
   <https://youtu.be/SZ8tmKzyBh4?si=TZpSsdfrCeZf2I2j>


*Cost for CHARUSAT Students only:*

   - *We* communicated and requested *the EC-Council for the same, and they
   are ready to provide a *subsidized academia kit* for CHARUSAT
   students at a *reduced cost as per the options below.

subject: Regarding COE visit on 9th March (Sunday)
snippet: Dear Students, The Committee of the Centre of Excellence (COE) will visit our university on 9th March 2025 (Sunday). Therefore, it will be a working day, and all students are required to actively
content:
Dear Students,

The Committee of the Centre of Excellence (COE) will visit our university
on *9th March 2025 (Sunday)*. Therefore, it will be a *working day*, and
all students are required to actively participate in regular lab sessions,
lectures, and other university-organized activities.

As compensation, the university will observe a *holiday on 13th March 2025
(Thursday)*.

Your cooperation in maintaining a disciplined and engaged environment is
greatly appreciated.

Thank You

--

subject: Gujarat Cultural Elocution Competition ‚Äì 2025 (University Level) || Registration Deadline: March 6, 2025, 8:00 PM
snippet: Dear CSPIT & DEPSTAR Students, The CHARUSAT NSS Unit is organizing the University Level Gujarat Cultural Elocution Competition ‚Äì 2025 as part of the initiative by the State NSS Department. We
content:
Dear CSPIT & DEPSTAR Students,

The CHARUSAT NSS Unit is organizing the *University Level Gujarat Cultural
Elocution Competition ‚Äì 2025* as part of the initiative by the State NSS
Department. We invite interested students to participate and showcase their
oratory skills.

*Date:* March 8, 2025
*Time:* 12:15 PM (Updated) Onwards
*Venue: *RPCP Auditorium
*Levels:* University ‚Üí Zone ‚Üí State

*Topics (Choose One):*

   - Character Building for Nation Building
   - Importance of Constitution in a Citizen‚Äôs Life
   - Youth: The Future of the Nation ‚Äì Challenges and Responsibilities
   - Values, Morality, and Ethics: Pillars of Indian Culture
   - Developed India 2047: Vision for a Better Future

*Eligibility:* Participants must be born on or after January 1, 1999.
*Registration Deadline:* March 6, 2025, 8:00 PM


*Registration Link:* <goog_111173522>https://forms.gle/LPeLhMmYZheqgaRr9

For further details, please refer to the attached PDFs.

For any queries, contact:

   - *Mr. Kishan Patel* (NSS Coordinator) ‚Äì +91 97244 42255
   - *Mr. Dhruv Rupapara* (Student Coordinator) ‚Äì +91 63539 33976

*We encourage students to participate.*

Best Regards,
*NSS Unit, CHARUSAT*

---Thanks & Regards---
*Dhruv D. Rupapara*
2nd Year B.Tech. EC
NSS Student Coordinator
V.T. Patel Department of Electronics & Communication Engineering
CSPIT, CHARUSAT, Changa 388421
--

subject: Certified Ethical Hacker v13 (CEHv13) - World‚Äôs No. 1 Ethical Hacking Certification, now with the power of AI (March 2025)
snippet: Dear students, We are glad to inform you that "Charotar University of Science and Technology - CHARUSAT" is the official EC-Council Academia Partner since January 2020. We are immensely
content:
Dear students,

We are glad to inform you that *"Charotar University of Science and
Technology - CHARUSAT"* is the official *EC-Council Academia Partner *since
January 2020. We are immensely pleased to welcome ‚ÄúCHARUSAT‚Äù *students* to
EC Council's newly launched *CEHv13* program. Certified Ethical
Hacker CEHv13
<https://www.eccouncil.org/programs/certified-ethical-hacker-ceh/> will
teach you the latest commercial-grade hacking tools, techniques, and
methodologies hackers and information security professionals use to hack an
organization lawfully. *110+ students have benefited from CEH at CHARUSAT
with a subsidized academia kit price.*

*What‚Äôs new in CEHv13?*: *From the creators of Certified Ethical Hacker
(CEH) comes the latest and evolved version 13 with added AI capabilities.
Structured across 20 learning modules covering over 550 attack techniques,
CEH provides cybersecurity professionals with the core knowledge they need
to detect and defend against emerging threats.*

*You will get:*

   - EC-Council Official Course Book for CEHv13 for self-study (24 Months) -
   Accessible Online/Offline. To Download App
   <https://support.vitalsource.com/hc/en-us/articles/201344733-Bookshelf-Download-Options>

   - Access To iLabs for 6 Months. Check the ilabs Demo Here:
   *https://youtu.be/iU_7zKypJZI* <https://youtu.be/iU_7zKypJZI>.
   - An Exam Voucher (1 Year) - *Get a globally recognized certificate
for* passing
   the exam. Accreditations
   <https://linkprotect.cudasvc.com/url?a=https%3a%2f%2fwww.eccouncil.org%2faccreditations%2f&c=E,1,hLej6Kb3ZRL_QKhhm71kedMm89bbj8UclU3d50zuCt2frG_t19Fir_60SvUk16RJBGYXwVBLF11HLMhr7nDv8WGkPElWNiTm9zdZ_xfo&typo=1>
   - Over 200 hands-on labs with Over 3,500 hacking tools. Learn how to
   hack multiple operating systems (Windows 11, Windows servers, Linux,
   Ubuntu, Android)
   - The venue of the Exam will be our University Premises.

*Popular Cybersecurity Tools in the Course:*


* - Network scanning and mapping tools (e.g., Nmap, hping3)- Vulnerability
assessment tools (e.g., OpenVAS, Nessus)- Penetration testing tools (e.g.,
Metasploit, Aircrack-ng)- Packet sniffers and network analyzers (e.g.,
Wireshark, Omnipeek Network Analyzer)- Social engineering tools (e.g.,
Social-Engineer Toolkit (SET), SpeedPhish Framework (SPF))- Password
cracking tools (e.g., John the Ripper, L0phtCrack)- Forensics tools (e.g.
FTK, EnCase, Autopsy)- Wireless hacking tools (e.g., Aircrack-ng,
Wifiphisher)- Encryption tools (e.g., CryptoForge, VeraCrypt)*
*Master AI to automate ethical hacking tasks and hack and defend against AI
systems.*

*‚Ä¢ ShellGPT* ‚Äì Automates various reconnaissance and penetration testing
tasks using AI-driven scripting.
*‚Ä¢ ChatGPT *‚Äì Helps generate code, automate tasks, and create scripts for
ethical hacking.
‚Ä¢ *FraudGPT* ‚Äì Simulates AI-assisted malicious activities to learn defense
strategies.
‚Ä¢ *WormGPT* ‚Äì An offensive AI tool used to simulate exploitations and
malware creation.
‚Ä¢ *DeepExploit* ‚Äì AI-powered vulnerability scanning and exploitation tool.
‚Ä¢ *Nebula* ‚Äì Automates network discovery and vulnerability identification
with AI.
‚Ä¢ *Veed.io* ‚Äì Can visualize security analytics and post-exploitation
results for better reporting.


*Typical Job Roles for C|EH :*

   - Mid-Level Information Security Auditor
   - Cybersecurity Auditor
   - Security Administrator
   - IT Security Administrator
   - Cyber Defense Analyst
   - Senior Security Consultant
   - Information Security Manager
   - Senior SOC Analyst
   - Solution Architect
   - Cybersecurity Consultant



   - Vulnerability Assessment Analyst
   - Warning Analyst
   - Information Security Analyst 1
   - Security Analyst L1
   - Infosec Security Administrator
   - Cybersecurity Analyst L1, L2, & L3
   - Network Security Engineer
   - SOC Security Analyst
   - Security Analyst
   - Network Engineer

*Webinar on "A Career in Cybersecurity" by EC-Council with Collaboration of
CHARUSAT | Campus Official: *https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X-QgxO3JhlA


*Testimonials:*

   - How Certified Ethical Hacker Helped Me Land a Job with Big4 | Sidhant
   Gupta <https://youtu.be/PLvVyh96n8M?si=IVLEptb5F-QPMUaw>
   - Catch Your Big Break in Cybersecurity with C|EH | Ravina Joshi
   <https://youtu.be/TO7veOnV9T4?si=uzHTokSpVAtp1iOm>
   - How C|EH Helped Me Build a Successful Career in Cybersecurity
   <https://youtu.be/SZ8tmKzyBh4?si=TZpSsdfrCeZf2I2j>


*Cost for CHARUSAT Students only:*

   - *We* communicated and requested *the EC-Council for the same, and they
   are ready to provide a *subsidized academia kit* for CHARUSAT
   students at a *reduced cost as per the options below.

subject: MEUD101 EOE Midterm Syllabus
snippet: Dear Students, Please find the syllabus below for the MEUD101 EOE Midterm Exam. The detailed points for chapters/units: 3,6 & 10, you can find it from the FY Handbook/Syllabus booklet. 1.
content:
Dear Students,
Please find the syllabus below for the *MEUD101 EOE Midterm Exam*. The
detailed points for chapters/units: 3,6 & 10, you can find it from the FY
Handbook/Syllabus booklet.

*1. Fundamentals of Engineering Drawing*
Importance of engineering drawing, drawing instruments and materials, BIS
and ISO
Different types of lines used in engineering practice, methods of
projections as per SP 46-1988.
Engineering scale.
Title block, Types of line, Geometric construction,Dimensioning System
*3. Orthographic Projection*
*6. Introduction of Mechanical Engineering*
*10. Scope of Civil Engineering*
---

Regards,



*Dr. Sagar Chokshi,*

Associate Professor,
Department of Mechanical Engineering,

Faculty of Technology & Engineering,

Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology,
Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT),
ACCREDITED WITH ‚Äú*A+*‚Äù GRADE BY NAAC
Education Campus Changa -388421
At. & Post Changa-388421, Ta: Petlad, Dist: Anand, (Gujarat) India.

subject: Important Email: Clarification on Syllabus and Reading Material
snippet: Dear Students, In my last email, I shared the syllabus, and some of you raised concerns about a mismatch in section numbering. To clarify, please refer to the following reading material for Unit 2 and
content:
Dear Students,

In my last email, I shared the syllabus, and some of you raised concerns
about a mismatch in section numbering. To clarify, please refer to the
following reading material for *Unit 2* and *Unit 5* to verify the
syllabus. Do not get confused.

   - *Unit 2:* Up to *Subsection 2.2* (*Complementary Functions and Their
   Examples*). Please check *Subsection 2.2* in this reading material.
   - *Unit 5:* Only *Section 5.3* (*Evaluation of Double Integrals and Its
   Examples*), *excluding Sections 5.1 and 5.2*.  Please check *Subsection
   5.3* in this reading material

If you still have any doubts, feel free to contact me.

Best regards,

subject: Invitation to Participate ‚Äì Gujarat Cultural Elocution Competition 2025 (University, Zone, and State Level)
snippet: Dear CHARUSAT Family, We are pleased to inform you that the Gujarat Cultural Elocution Competition ‚Äì 2025 is being organized by the State NSS Department at University, Zone, and State Levels. As part
content:
Dear *CHARUSAT Family*,

We are pleased to inform you that the *Gujarat Cultural Elocution
Competition ‚Äì 2025* is being organized by the *State NSS Department*
at *University,
Zone, and State Levels*. As part of this initiative, the *CHARUSAT NSS Unit*
will be hosting the *University Level Competition*, and we invite
enthusiastic students to participate and showcase their oratory skills.
*Competition Details:*

üìÖ *Date:* 08/03/2025   ||   *Time :* 10:00 AM Onwards
üìç *Venue:* To Be Communicated Soon
üé§ *Levels:* University ‚Üí Zone ‚Üí State
*Topics (Choose One):*

‚úÖ Character Building for Nation Building
‚úÖ Importance of Constitution in a Citizen‚Äôs Life
‚úÖ Youth: The Future of the Nation ‚Äì Challenges and Responsibilities
‚úÖ Values, Morality, and Ethics: Pillars of Indian Culture
‚úÖ Developed India 2047: Vision for a Better Future

üîπ *Eligibility:* Participants must be born on or after *01/01/1999*.
üîπ *Winners will advance to the Zone and State Level Competitions.*

Interested students are requested to fill out the registration form by
clicking the link below:

üìå  https://forms.gle/LPeLhMmYZheqgaRr9 *(Dead Line : 06/03/2025 08:00 PM)

*üèÜ Prizes & Additional Details:*

For detailed information on *competition topics and prizes*, please refer
to the *attached PDFs*.


For any queries, feel free to contact:
üìû *Mr. Kishan Patel* ‚Äì Coordinator, NSS Cell-CHARUSAT (*+91 97244 42255*)
üìû *Mr. Dhruv Rupapara* ‚Äì Student Coordinator (*+91 63539 33976*)

We look forward to your enthusiastic participation!

üí™ *Best of luck to all participants! Be prepared with high practice and
give your best performance!*

*P.S.: All faculty members are requested to inform their respective
students about this competition.*
-- 
*Mr. Kishan Patel*
*Program Coordinator*
NSS Unit- CHARUSAT
Charotar University of Science and Technology

CHARUSAT Campus, CHANGA, Gujarat- 388421
Accredited with 'A+' by NAAC - Govt. of India

*"Not Me, But You"*

subject: (CHARUSAT STUDENTS ) LAUNCHED KSHITIJ IIT KHARAGPUR INTERNSHIP PROGRAM
snippet: Dear Students Warm greetings From LaunchED Kshitij 2025 (IIT), Kharagpur We are thrilled to share an exceptional opportunity tailored for the creative minds of Batch 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024. In
content:
*Dear Students*

Warm greetings From *LaunchED *Kshitij 2025 (IIT), Kharagpur

We are thrilled to share an exceptional opportunity tailored for the
creative minds of *Batch 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024*. In collaboration with
*LaunchED * Kshitij 2025 (IIT), Kharagpur we present a *two-month Training
and Internship Program* featuring certifications from global leaders, and
other renowned organizations.

*Who Can Apply?*

We invite applications from shortlisted students across all departments. If
any of your classmates have not received this information, please forward
this email to them.


https://forms.gle/jALGvwB63X9Up12D8
*Program Highlights*

   -

   *Month 1: Training*
   - Live industry-led sessions and recorded materials.
   -

   *Month 2: Internship*
   - Hands-on individual projects and a group capstone project with
      professional mentorship.

*Key Benefits*

   -
   - *Certificate of Completion* from  *LaunchED * Kshitij 2025 (IIT),
   Kharagpur
   - *Verified certification* via Wipro Dice ID.
   - *Co-branded Internship Certificate* from leading MNCs.
   - *100% Placement Assistance* and access to an expanding professional
   network.
   - Training on *Low-Code and No-Code Tools* and *Generative AI* concepts.
   - Invitations to *Exclusive Masterclasses* hosted by industry leaders.
   - *Personalized mentorship* for tailored career development.

--

subject: Re: internal exam old question papers
snippet: Dear Students, Kindly note the syllabus for Mid-Term exam 2025 for subject Digital Electronics -CSUC101 is as follows: Unit 1: Number Systems: Different Radix Number Systems, Number base conversions,
content:
Dear Students,
Kindly note the syllabus for Mid-Term exam 2025 for subject Digital
Electronics -CSUC101 is as follows:

*Unit 1: Number Systems:*

*Different Radix Number Systems, Number base conversions, Complements,
Signed and Unsigned Numbers, Digital arithmetic (Binary Addition and
Subtraction (normal and with complements)), Binary codes, Code Conversion,
Binary Logic and Logic Gates  *

*Unit 2:  Simplification of Boolean functions:  *

*Boolean Algebra (Basic Definitions, Axioms, Postulates and Theorem,
Boolean functions: Canonical and Standard Form, Maxterm and Minterm, SOP
and POS), Simplification of Boolean functions using Boolean theorems and
postulates, Simplification of Boolean functions using K-map (up to 4
variable K-map), Realize logic circuit using Basic gates and Universal
gates*

*Unit 3: Combinational Circuits: (Covered in Lab)*
*Design Procedure, Half Adder, Half Subtractor, Full Adder  *

All the Best for the Exam
